May also be a structure - see comments. If invalid, or not a valid time zone name, then UTC is used as the destination time zone. If set to "0", the local server's time zone is used.

params.name: dbType
params.description: Required numeric value, indicating the type of this DB connection. DBType Meaning 0 MS SQL 1 MS Access 2 Oracle 3 MySQL 4 SyBase
ValueIn

params.name: NoDelimiters
params.description: Optional. Any Boolean expression. If this parameter evaluates to true (non-zero), then text delimiters will be suppressed in the output value. Defaults to true

params.name: dbType
params.description: Required numeric value, indicating the type of this DB connection. DBType Meaning 0 MS SQL 1 MS Access 2 Oracle 3 MySQL 4 SyBase
ValueIn

params.name: NoDelimiters
params.description: Optional. If this parameter evaluates to true (non-zero), then text delimiters will be suppressed in the output value. Defaults to true

params.name: dbType
params.description: Required numeric value, indicating the type of this DB connection. DBType Meaning 0 MS SQL 1 MS Access 2 Oracle 3 MySQL 4 SyBase
ValueIn

params.name: NoDelimiters
params.description: Optional. If TRUE (non-zero), then text delimiters will be suppressed in the output value. Defaults to true

params.name: dbType
params.description: Required numeric value, indicating the type of this DB connection. DBType Meaning 0 MS SQL 1 MS Access 2 Oracle 3 MySQL 4 SyBase
ValueIn

params.name: dbType
params.description: Required numeric value, indicating the type of this DB connection. At present, only MS SQL and Oracle are supported. DBType Meaning 0 MS SQL 2 Oracle

params.name: ValueIn
params.description: Required. Time value as used by the indicated database.

params.name: dbType
params.description: Required numeric value, indicating the type of this DB connection.  At present, only MS SQL and Oracle are supported. DBType Meaning 0 MS SQL 2 Oracle

params.name: ValueIn
params.description: Required. Time and date value as used by the indicated database.

params.name: FormatStr
params.description: Optional. Provides a format to use. Please refer to the BuffRead function for a description of the formatting options

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the x screen coordinate of the left side of the window.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the y screen coordinate of the Bottom side of the window.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the x screen coordinate of the Right side of the window.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the y screen coordinate of the Top of the window.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. The window context that the coordinates are taken from.

params.name: CoordX
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the x-coordinate to convert.

params.name: CoordY
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the y-coordinate to convert.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression specifying the converted coordinate to return, where 0 returns the converted x-coordinate, and 1 returns the converted y-coordinate.

params.name: Destination
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the directory into which the source directory is to be copied. This directory must already exist.

params.name: Source
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the directory to be copied.

params.name: Address
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the absolute RAM address to start to copy. Typically the address is specified using the colon ( : ) operator.

params.name: Length
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of bytes to copy.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text or buffer expression containing data bytes to copy.

params.name: Address
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the absolute RAM address to start to copy.

params.name: Length
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of bytes to copy.

params.name: DSN
params.description: Required. Data source name of the database to use

params.name: TableName
params.description: Required. Table name to read and write in both databases

params.name: KeyField
params.description: Required. Field name to use for the SQL WHERE clause

params.name: OrgKeyValue
params.description: Required. Key values of the records when complete

params.name: CopiedKeyValue
params.description: Required. Key values of the records to copy

params.name: Username
params.description: Required. User name for database access

params.name: Pass
params.description: Required. Password for database access

params.name: TransObj
params.description: Required. Value of transaction object

params.name: Angle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the angle in radians.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. A VTScada module. The data returned will be for the source file which contains that module. Information for all of the modules in the same source file will be included in the returned value. The module need not be the root module of the source file.

params.name: Reset
params.description: Optional Tells the function to reset all of the code coverage counters to 0 immediately after the statistics are collected. A true value indicates that the reset should be done and a false (0) indicates that it should not be done. The default value is 1.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text expression for which to generate a CRC.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the offset from 0 in the buffer where the CRC calculation will start.

params.name: Length
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of buffer bytes to include in the CRC. Length must not be greater than 65500.

params.name: Table
params.description: Required. A text expression giving a CRC look-up table buffer. The length of the table buffer must be a multiple of 256 plus 1. A table can be generated automatically with the CRCTable function.

params.name: Start
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the initial value for the register used in the CRC calculation. For most drivers this is 0 or 0xFFFF.

params.name: Polynomial
params.description: Required. A long expression that gives the bit pattern of the generating polynomial. For Allen-BradleyÂ® and ModiconÂ®, Polynomial = 0b1000000000000101, which corresponds to the expression: x^16 + x^15 + x^2 + 1 To determine the value of Polynomial for a given generator expression, drop the highest order term, and represent each term present by a 1 in the bit position equal to its exponent. For example, x^16 + x^12 + x^5 + 1 would have a Polynomial value of 0b0001000000100001. The first 1 corresponds to x^12, the second to x^5, and the last to 1 (which is x^0). This polynomial is used by the XMODEM protocol.

params.name: Length
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the byte length of the CRC accumulator register (usually 2 or 4). The CRCTable buffer returned is 256 * Length + 1 bytes long.

params.name: Shift
params.description: Any numeric expression that is 0 for right-shifted CRC calculations (such as Allen-BradleyÂ® or ModiconÂ®), and 1 for left-shifted CRC calculations (such as XMODEM).

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the .SRC file that contains this module's definition.

params.name: Statement1, Statement2, Statement3, â¦
params.description: Required. Any expressions to be executed. Any number of parameters may be used.

params.name: OrigBMP
params.description: Required. The original image to be cropped. This must be a valid image object, created with the MakeBitmap statement.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any expression for the number of pixels from the left side of the original image to set to be the left side of the new image. "0" will start at the same place as the original image.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any expression for the number of pixels from the top of the original image to set to be the top of the new image. "0" will start at the top of the original image.

params.name: Width
params.description: Required. Any expression for the number of pixels wide the new image will be. The new image will be enforced to be at least 1 pixel wide, even if Width is set to less than 1 pixel.

params.name: Height
params.description: Required. Any expression for the number of pixels high the new image will be. The new image will always be at least 1 pixel height, even if Height is set to less than 1 pixel.

params.name: ModuleToSearch
params.description: Required. Module value which is the root of the static module tree to search. May also be an array of module values. If the next parameter (ModuleToFind) is invalid, then only the variable references which are not within the scope of this module are returned, i.e. external references.

params.name: WhatToFind
params.description: Optional. May be either a module or a variable to search for. If invalid, all references to all variables (whether they may contain modules or otherwise) outside the specified scope tree are returned.

params.name: Context
params.description: Optional. Instance of a module that indicates what scope ModuleToSearch would run in, were it to run. (Note that ModuleToSearch does not need to be running when CrossReference is called.) If invalid, only the static scope will be searched.

params.name: Length
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of bytes to create.

params.name: Editor
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns an editor value that was created by the MakeEditor function. If this isn't an editor type value, or if it is invalid, nothing happens.

params.name: TimeType
params.description: Any expression that evaluates to a 0 or 1. When 0, it indicates that time returned should be local time. If set to 1, indicates that the current UTC time should be returned. Defaults to 0 if missing or Invalid.

params.name: Day
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of days since January 1, 1970. This is a "Julian" style date. The function, Today() is commonly used.

params.name: DateForm
params.description: Required. Any numeric or text expression selecting the format for the date format. Will also accept a date locale such as "us-en", matching the Windows locale. If DateForm is numeric, the format for the date will be interpreted according to the standard Date Formatting Codes . If DateForm is a text value, it is interpreted as a date formatting string. Please refer to the Date Formatting Strings in the appendix. Note that these key strings are case sensitive. In the event that the DateForm parameter does not resolve to either a numeric or text value, the system-configured date format, as specified through the Windows Control Panel, is used. In this case, the Flags parameter is used to select from a number of options for the date.

params.name: Day
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the day of the month for the date.

params.name: Month
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the month number for the date. January is month 1.

params.name: Year
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the year of the date. The full four-digit date must be used.

params.name: ValidateInputRanges
params.description: Optional Boolean.  If set to TRUE, this function will validate the Day and Month parameters to be in their valid range. If both Day and Month are legal values for the given year, DateNum will return days since January 1, 1970, for a given date. Otherwise, this will return Invalid. Defaults to FALSE, meaning that a value will be calculated without verification that the Day and Month parameters are within a valid range.

params.name: ShowSelector
params.description: Sets the display mode. 1 to temporarily open the popup DateSelector. 2 to permanently show an embedded DateSelector. Also used as a return value: 0 indicates that a date was selected, -1 indicates that the operator closed the popup without selecting a date.

params.name: LeftParm
params.description: Any numeric expression specifying the location of the left edge of the calendar.

params.name: TopParm
params.description: Any numeric expression specifying the location of the top edge of the calendar.

params.name: pSelTimestamp
params.description: Output. A pointer to a variable holding a timestamp value. The returned date from the calendar will be found here. You may also use this to hand an initial date to the calendar, to display when ShowSelector becomes true. If the initial date is not in range and no other date is selected, then the parameter will return invalid. No timestamp is returned if no date is selected.

params.name: HelpID
params.description: (Optional) Specific HelpID for this use of the DateSelector.

params.name: MinTimestamp
params.description: (Optional) Minimum selectable date. (the number of seconds, in local or UTC time, since midnight of January 1, 1970 (where "midnight" is 00:00) to the minimum selectable date.)

params.name: MaxTimestamp
params.description: (Optional) Maximum selectable date. (the number of seconds, in local or UTC time, since midnight of January 1, 1970 (where "midnight" is 00:00) to the maximum selectable date.)

params.name: pWidth
params.description: (Optional) Returns pointer set to width of the calendar.

params.name: pHeight
params.description: (Optional) Returns pointer set to height of the calendar.

params.name: DisabledDays
params.description: (Optional) Bitwise. Days of the week that are disabled: 0bSFTWTMS, read right-to-left. eg. 0b1110001 disables Sunday, Thursday, Friday. Saturday.

params.name: BackColorParm
params.description: (Optional) Background color. Default <FFFFFFFF> (white).

params.name: TextColorParm
params.description: (Optional) Text color. Default <FF000000> (black).

params.name: FontSizeParm
params.description: (Optional) Selected font size. 0 = small (default) 1 = medium 2 = large 3 = X-large 4 = XX - large

params.name: HighlightToday
params.description: (Optional) Boolean. TRUE to highlight today's date. Default TRUE.

params.name: FirstDayOfWeek
params.description: (Optional) The weekday considered first (Sunday = 0).

params.name: Date
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of days since January 1, 1970.

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: IDKey
params.description: Required. Any text expression that uniquely identifies the record to be created.

params.name: DefaultEvent
params.description: Required. Any text expression containing one byte for each list in the system. Any missing bytes or bytes with values not included in the list provided, default to "do nothing to the list". Note that there is one byte for each list in the system. Text Value Default Event + Add to list <space> Do nothing to list

params.name: EventCode
params.description: Required. Any variable in which the event code for the function is returned. This parameter may be used to indicate completion of the function, as it will not be set to a valid value until execution is complete. It has one of the following meanings: EventCode Meaning 0 New record added 1 Record already existed. it was updated 2 Error occurred - record not added EventCode may be replaced by a constant or Invalid if it is not required. This parameter will not be set if there is a parameter error (see comments)

params.name: FieldVal
params.description: (or FieldVal1, FieldVal2, FieldVal3, â¦ ) One or more parameters that are an array or a list of values for each field. FieldVal (or FieldVal1, FieldVal2, FieldVal3, â¦ ) will be set to Invalid if not specified, if insufficient parameters are specified to fill each field in the new database record, or if the parameter is an array with insufficient entries to fill each field in the database.

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Screen coordinates of the left side of drop list

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Screen coordinates of the top of list

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Screen coordinates of the right side of the list

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Screen coordinates of the bottom of list

params.name: DSN
params.description: Required. DSN of the database to query

params.name: UserName
params.description: Required. The user name in the database for authentication.

params.name: Password
params.description: Required. The password in the database for authentication.

params.name: SQLQuery
params.description: Required. An SQL query that returns either one or two columns. The first column is used for droplist display, the second (if it exists) provides the matching value for each entry in the list.

params.name: Title
params.description: Required. The title for the drop list

params.name: LocFocusID
params.description: Required. Numeric expression from 0 to 32767 for the focus number of this graphic. If this value is 0, the droplist will display its current setting, but will not be able to be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed) and will appear grayed out. The default value is 1.

params.name: Init
params.description: Required. Any expression for the initial value displayed in the field

params.name: Var
params.description: Required. A variable whose value will be set by this droplist

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Optional. If true (non-0) a bevel is drawn around the droplist. If false (0) no bevel is drawn. The default value is false

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: Optional. If true (non-0) the title is included in the calculation for vertical alignment. If false(0) it is added to the droplist after it (and its bevel if one exists) has been vertically aligned. The default is true

params.name: AddInvalid
params.description: Required. If true an entry with an invalid value will be added at the top of list.

params.name: InvalidText
params.description: Required. Used with AddInvalid to provide the text to display for the item at the top of the list.

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: Stream
params.description: Required. Any variable in which the stream containing the database will be returned.

params.name: Timestamp
params.description: Optional. An optional parameter that is any numeric expression indicating the earliest timestamp to include in the stream. Only database records with date/time values greater than or equal to this parameter will be returned.

params.name: DSN
params.description: Required. Datasource name to query.

params.name: UserName
params.description: Required. The user name in the database for authentication.

params.name: Password
params.description: Required. The user name in the database for authentication.

params.name: SelectQualifier
params.description: Required. SQL selection qualifier, such as "top 100" etc.

params.name: Fields
params.description: Required. An array of field names to query for

params.name: Tables
params.description: Required. An array of tables to query from

params.name: WhereFields
params.description: Required. An array of fields named for SQL WHERE clause

params.name: WhereOperators
params.description: Required. An array of Operators for the SQL WHERE clause

params.name: WhereValues
params.description: Required. An array of Array of values for the SQL WHERE clause

params.name: WhereAndFlag
params.description: Required. Set 1 for AND of where fields, reset for OR

params.name: UserQuery
params.description: Required. Overrides Fields, Tables, & Where when defined

params.name: ColName
params.description: Required. Text array of titles for displaying data

params.name: ColFormat
params.description: Required. Text array of format qualifiers for each of the values.

params.name: ColCellWidth
params.description: Required. Array giving the size to use for the cells columns

params.name: RowHeight
params.description: Required. Height of the data rows. Set to invalid to use the defaults.

params.name: TitleHeight
params.description: Required. Height of the column titles. Set to invalid to use the defaults.

params.name: ExtDisplayRef
params.description: Required. Object value of where ColFormat modules located

params.name: AutoResizeWidths
params.description: Required. Automatically resize the widths to fit the available space

params.name: OrderBy
params.description: Required. Field names for ORDER BY clause only used

params.name: LockFirstColParm
params.description: Required. TRUE to lock column 0 while horizontal scrolling

params.name: SortParm
params.description: Required. Enables grid list sorting

params.name: SelectedRowParm
params.description: Required. 0 - based value of row of selected item

params.name: SelectedColParm
params.description: Required. 0 - based value of column of selected item

params.name: Horz
params.description: Required. Horizontal scroll position

params.name: Vert
params.description: Required. Vertical scroll position

params.name: Refresh
params.description: Required. Set flag to re-query data

params.name: DataPtr
params.description: Required. Pointer to data read from db in [Col][Row] format

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: IDKey
params.description: Required. Any text expression that uniquely identifies the record to be created.

params.name: DefaultEvent
params.description: Required. Any text expression containing one byte for each list in the system. Any missing bytes or bytes with values not included in the list provided, default to "do nothing to the list". Note that there is one byte for each list in the system. Text Value Default Event + Add to list <space> Do nothing to list

params.name: TimeStamp
params.description: Required. The time to be used for all lists that the new record is a member of. Current time will be used if this field is invalid.

params.name: EventCode
params.description: Required. Any variable in which the event code for the function is returned. This parameter may be used to indicate completion of the function, as it will not be set to a valid value until execution is complete. It has one of the following meanings: EventCode Meaning 0 New record added 2 Error occurred - record not added EventCode may be replaced by a constant or Invalid if it is not required. This parameter will not be set if there is a parameter error (see comments)

params.name: FieldVal
params.description: (or FieldVal1, FieldVal2, FieldVal3, â¦ ) One or more parameters that are an array or a list of values for each field. FieldVal (or FieldVal1, FieldVal2, FieldVal3, â¦ ) will be set to Invalid if not specified, if insufficient parameters are specified to fill each field in the new database record, or if the parameter is an array with insufficient entries to fill each field in the database.

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: Result
params.description: Required. A variable in which the resulting array will be stored. The dimension of the array will match the number of fields requested.

params.name: Orientation
params.description: Required. Any logical expression that denotes the orientation of the resultant array. If true (non-0) each record retrieved forms its own row, with each column representing a field. If false (0), the reverse holds true. This means that with Orientation set to 1, if 5 fields were requested in the FieldVals parameter(s), the resultant array would be R[n][5], where n is the number of matching records found.

params.name: List
params.description: Required. Any numeric value or array of numeric values that define(s) the list(s) to search. (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations ) Value List -1 Entire database 0 Transaction log Number, starting at 1 The specific list number The database and transaction log cannot be combined with other lists.

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: Result
params.description: Required. A variable in which the resulting 1 or 2 dimensional array will be stored.

params.name: List
params.description: Required. Any numeric value or array of numeric values that define(s) the list(s) to search List List Description -1 Entire database 0 Transaction log Number, starting at 1 The specific list number The database and transaction log cannot be combined with other lists.

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: IDKey
params.description: Required. Any text expression used for designating the record(s) to delete. Can contain the wildcard characters "*" and "?".

params.name: EventCode
params.description: Optional. Any variable in which the event code for the function is returned. This parameter may be used to indicate completion of the function, as it will not be set to a valid value until execution is complete. It has one of the following meanings EventCode Meaning 0 Record(s) deleted 1 Error occurred - record(s) not deleted EventCode will not be set if there is a parameter error (see comments).

params.name: DBFile
params.description: Required. A text expression giving the file in which to store the database information. If this parameter is invalid or is a null text string (""), no file is created and the database is reconstructed every time the system starts. DBFile can be an array containing 1 or 2 file names or streams. On startup, the second stream will be brought into sync with the first. The first is only read to initialize the database system. Both streams are maintained while the system is running. Note that the value for this parameter may not be changed while the DBSystem call is active (i.e. the file cannot change) - any changes will be ignored.

params.name: DBTransFile
params.description: Required. A text expression giving the file in which transactions are logged. If this parameter is invalid or is a null text string (""), no file is created and no transaction logging is done. Unlike the DBFile parameter, the value of this parameter may be changed even while the DBSystem function is active (i.e. the file is dynamic).

params.name: MaxTrans
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the maximum number of transactions to be stored in the transaction log file.

params.name: NumLists
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of memory lists to be maintained. The valid range is from 0 to 255.

params.name: IDKeySize
params.description: Required. Any expression that designates the maximum length for the ID key. This affects the size of the files and the database stored in memory.

params.name: FieldAttribs
params.description: Required. Either an array or a series of parameters that defines what type and size the fields are. The number of parameters or array entries determines how many fields there are. The valid field types are FieldAttribs Field Type Attribute -4 Indicates a VTScada value field. Any VTScada value may be written, but will only go into the in-memory copy of the database. The disk record will have a zero length field. -3 Double precision float (8 bytes) -2 Long integer (4 bytes) -1 Short integer (2 bytes) 0 Indicates a Status field . 1 or more Text (number defines length)
1 or more

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: IDKey
params.description: Required. Any text expression that designates the record to use. It can contain the wildcard characters "*" and "?".

params.name: Event
params.description: Required. Any text expression containing on byte for each list in the system. Any missing bytes or bytes with values not included in the following list  default to "do nothing to list". Note that there is one byte for each list in the system, not for each list that has been selected by the List parameter. Text Value Event + Add to list - Remove from list <space> Do nothing to list

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: Stream
params.description: Required. Any stream value created from the contents of a database. This results from a DBGetStream statement.

params.name: EventCode
params.description: Required. An optional variable in which the event code for the function is returned. This parameter may be used to indicate completion of the function, as it will not be set to a valid value until finished executing. It has the following meaning Value Meaning 0 Database successfully updated 1 Update failed EventCode may be replaced by a constant or Invalid if it is not required. This parameter will not be set if there is a parameter error (see comments)

params.name: DBSysVal
params.description: Required. The database value to use. This is the return value from a DBSystem call.

params.name: IDKey
params.description: Required. Any text expression that designates the record to use. It can contain the wildcard characters "*" and "?".

params.name: FieldNumber
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that indicates the field for which data is requested. Valid values for FieldNumber are as follows Value Meaning -1 A timestamp is required. A ListNum parameter must be supplied, specifying which list the timestamp is to be retrieved from. 0 Event code for the record 1 to 255 Indicates which piece of the record's data you wish to retrieve.

params.name: 1 to 255
params.description: ListNum

params.name: Program
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the program which is the DDE server. This does not contain the .EXE extension. This is usually the same as the root file name of the executable file, but may be different as in the case of Microsoft Word for Windows 6.0 which uses the name "MSWord".

params.name: Topic
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the DDE topic name within the server. For a VTScada server the topic name is usually the name of the window. For Microsoft Excel, the topic is the spreadsheet name.

params.name: Item
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the location or name of the value to retrieve.

params.name: Error
params.description: Optional. A variable that will be set when an error occurs. Values may be as follows:  0=OK, -1=DDE is stopping, -2=FAILED

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Optional. If present, this indicates a "COLD" link as opposed to a "HOT" link (i.e. you have to poll the server to get an update, rather than it pushing updates to you). When set to 1, this triggers a poll. The trigger is then reset.

params.name: pollTimeOut
params.description: Optional. If this is a COLD link (see Trigger)  then pollTimeOut is the value in seconds of the time out for the poll.

params.name: Program
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the program which is the DDE server. This does not contain the .EXE extension. This is usually the same as the root file name of the executable file, but may be different as in the case of Microsoft Word for Windows 6.0 which uses the name "MSWord".

params.name: Topic
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the DDE topic name within the server. For a VTScada server the topic name is usually the name of the window. For Microsoft Excel, the topic is the spreadsheet name.

params.name: Item
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name or location of the value to send.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any expression for the value to be sent, up to a maximum of 255 characters. If this value is invalid, a null value (null text string) will be sent to the DDE server program.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object expression giving the module instance whose variables' value will be shared.

params.name: ShareName
params.description: Required. Any text expression that gives the DDE share name other DDE enabled programs use to access the variables in Object.

params.name: Password
params.description: Required. Any text expression that gives the password required to access this DDE share name. If this is invalid, no password is required.

params.name: ShareName
params.description: Required. Any text expression that gives the DDE share name.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the value whose changes are to be limited to amounts no less than Delta.

params.name: Delta
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the lower limit of the change in Value that will allow the function value to change. If Delta is less than or equal to 0, the function will always return Value.

params.name: Status
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression giving the enabled status of the window in which the debugger is displayed, as follows. The default value is 1 - Enabled. Status Meaning 0 Disabled 1 Enabled 2 Enabled, bring to front 3 Enabled, reload ViewModule, then bring to front

params.name: CipherValue
params.description: Required. The information to be decoded.

params.name: UnpackDictionary
params.description: If a dictionary was used to pack the information as part of the encoding, the mirror of that dictionary must be provided to unpack the information. See notes and example in the Unpack function.

params.name: Key
params.description: Optional string. Must be included if the CipherValue was encrypted using a key, in which case this value must match the key that was used in the Encode function.

params.name: HashKey
params.description: Optional string. Must be included if the CipherValue was protected from tampering with a Hash value, in which case this value must match the Hash that was used in the Encode function.

params.name: pError
params.description: Optional. If present, will return a numeric value from the module providing extra information if the decode operation fails. Possible values and meanings for pError follow: 0 No error 1 Invalid Opcode 2 Hashed CipherText, missing HashKey parameter 3 Encrypted CipherText, missing Key parameter 4 Error in Salt Length 5 Error in Decompressed Length 6 Error in Base64 Encoding 7 Error in Salt Length 8 Hash does not match payload 9 Error when Decrypting payload 10 Error when Decompressing payload

params.name: Data
params.description: Required text. A string of parameters to decode. You can obtain this automatically via TagObj.Parameters , where TagObj is the MenuItem tag you are examining.

params.name: Reserved
params.description: Boolean. Set to TRUE to return an array of parameter values.

params.name: AlarmName
params.description: Required text. Unique name for the alarm. Typically the unique ID, which can be obtained using GetAlarmName . If there are multiple built-in alarms in a tag, the convention is to concatenate the UniqueID with a separator and a unique integer or string per alarm. For example, Concat(Root\UniqueID, \AlarmSeparatorString, 0).

params.name: Key
params.description: Required. The handle to the key to use to decrypt the data.

params.name: CipherText
params.description: Required. A text string that contains the cipher text to be decrypted.

params.name: Final
params.description: Required. A parameter that specifies whether this is the last section in a series being decrypted. Final is set TRUE for the last or only block and FALSE if there are more blocks to be decrypted

params.name: Reserved n/a
params.description: An optional parameter which should be set to 0. If omitted or invalid, then the value 0 is used.

params.name: Flags
params.description: Optional. An optional parameter specifying the flags to be passed to CryptDecrypt. If omitted or invalid then the value 0 is used. When using a CNG key, the Flags parameter can take the same values as for Encrypt .

params.name: Error
params.description: Required. An optional variable in which the error code for the function is returned. It can have the following meanings: Value Meaning 0 Key successfully imported. 1 Key, CipherText or Final parameters invalid. x Any other value is an error from CryptDecrypt.

params.name: InputBuffer
params.description: Required. Any expression that will yield a buffer of data to be compressed or decompressed. This can be a string, a buffer, or a stream.

params.name: Decompress
params.description: Required. A Boolean value. If set to true (non-zero), the data in the InputBuffer is decompressed. If set to false (zero), the data in InputBuffer is compressed.

params.name: DeflateHandle
params.description: Optional. A variable that holds an existing deflate handle or is to receive a new deflate handle (see the "Comments" section  for further details).

params.name: MaxDecompressedLength
params.description: Optional. Specifies the maximum length of the decompressed output (see the "Comments" section  for further details).

params.name: FlushMode
params.description: Optional. Indicates the type of flushing that the encoder should use when processing the data. Values are FlushMode ZLib Value 0 Z_NO_FLUSH 2 Z_SYNC_FLUSH 3 Z_FULL_FLUSH 4 Z_FINISH Effective use of this parameter requires an understanding of the ZLib library ( www.gzip.org/zlib ). The default value is Z_SYNC_FLUSH which is appropriate for continuous, stream mode type operations. For a single encoding, as in a file or a web page, then Z_FINISH is likely to be more appropriate. It is not normally necessary to specify a flush value for decompress but, if one is specified, it will be used.

params.name: NewAccountData
params.description: Required. An AccountData structure, a single dimension array of AccountData structures or a dictionary of AccountData structures identifying the account(s) to delete.

params.name: PtrReturnCode
params.description: Optional. A pointer to a value that will contain one of the defined result codes at the conclusion of the operation.

params.name: HaveLock
params.description: Optional. A Boolean value that indicates whether the working copy lock is held by the calling code. Default FALSE.

params.name: Array
params.description: Required. Any array variable that has been created via a New function call. This should be a single dimension array or unexpected results may occur.

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the element in the array to delete. If out of range, then the original array will be returned.

params.name: HandleName
params.description: Required. The name of the handle variable in the container module.

params.name: ArrayName
params.description: Required. The name of the variable in the ContainerObj that holds an array of values from which to delete the contributor. This parameter may be invalid if there is no such array in the container.

params.name: CountName
params.description: Required. The name of the variable in the ContainerObj that holds a count of the current number of this type of contributor. This parameter may be invalid if no such variable exists in the ContainerObj. Not all contributors need to be counted. The CountIncrement determines the initial change in the count and the contributor must maintain the count.

params.name: ContainerObj
params.description: Required. The object value of the container tag module.

params.name: ContributorObj
params.description: Required. The object value of the contributor to delete.

params.name: CountIncrement
params.description: Required. This value will be subtracted from the variable in the container that has the name of CountName. This value is usually a "1" or a "0", indicating whether the contributor is actively contributing its value now. The contributor will increment or decrement the value of the CountName variable as the corresponding state of the contributor changes.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression that gives the module value of the module to delete.

params.name: IgnoreSource
params.description: If true, the function will not modify any source file. Also, will not check that .SRC and .RUN files are in sync and therefore will not return a value of 3. Defaults to FALSE if invalid or not specified.

params.name: Action
params.description: Required. Any expression that gives the VTScada Value Types of the action.

params.name: Position
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the statement number in the script to delete, beginning with 1.

params.name: PtrReturnCode
params.description: Required. A pointer to a variable that will be used for the return code. PtrReturnCode Meaning 1 Privilege deleted. 2 Denied. The calling context does not have the Manager general privilege. 3 The privilege is not valid - no action taken. 4 The specified user does not exist - no action taken. 6 The application cannot be edited.

params.name: State
params.description: Required. Any expression that gives the code value of the state.

params.name: Statement
params.description: Required. Any expression that gives the code value of the statement.

params.name: PtrReturnCode
params.description: Required. A pointer to a variable that will be used for the return code. PtrReturnCode Meaning 0 User does not exist. No action taken. 1 User deleted. 2 Denied. The calling context does not have the Manager general privilege. 6 The application cannot be edited.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression that gives the variable value to delete.

params.name: IgnoreSource
params.description: An optional Boolean expression. If true, the function will ignore out-of-sync source files and not attempt to make any source file changes. The result is convenient deletion of non-temporary variables without having the function modify the corresponding source code. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: PageName
params.description: Required. The text name of the page to delete.

params.name: Address
params.description: Required. The address from which to get the data.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. A pointer to the destination for the read data.

params.name: Rate
params.description: Required. The update rate in seconds.

params.name: OriginalAddress
params.description: Original Address string from I/O tag.

params.name: TagID
params.description: Required string. The UniqueID of the tag for which the token request is to be denied.

params.name: TokenRequestRecord
params.description: Required. The record of the token request to deny.

params.name: Custom
params.description: Optional. A structure of custom fields to log

params.name: Timestamp
params.description: Optional The UTC timestamp of this event. Defaults to current time

params.name: SessionID
params.description: Optional. The ID of session denying the request.

params.name: AccountID
params.description: Optional. The Account ID of user denying the request. Defaults to the currently signed-in user.

params.name: MachineID
params.description: Optional. The MachineIDof the workstation where this action originated. Defaults to the current machine.

params.name: Device
params.description: Optional. Name of client device

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Normally, the name of a variable holding a numeric value for which the derivative will be taken.

params.name: Time
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the  time in seconds between derivative function updates.

params.name: CSPHandle
params.description: Required. The handle of a CSP critical security parameter to use to generate the key.

params.name: AlgID
params.description: Required. Identifies the algorithm for which the key is to be generated. Values for this parameter vary depending on the CSP used, and are defined in WinCrypt.h

params.name: Seed
params.description: Required. A text string to use as a seed.

params.name: Flags
params.description: Optional. Specifies the flags to be passed to CryptGenKey. If omitted or invalid, then the value "0" is used.

params.name: Error
params.description: Optional. A variable in which the error code for the function is returned. The error codes are as follows Error Meaning 0 Key successfully generated 1 CSPHandle or AlgID parameters invalid X Any other value is an error from CryptGenKey.

params.name: XPosPtr
params.description: Required. A pointer to the dialog's X-position. The X-position will be modified by this function if the dialog is beyond the left or right edge of the screen.

params.name: YPosPtr
params.description: Required. A pointer to the dialog's Y-position variable. The Y-position will be modified by this function if the dialog is beyond the top or bottom edge of the screen.

params.name: XOffset
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression giving the default X-position to use if the value of the XPosPtr is Invalid. It is also the X-position that will be used if the dialog is beyond the right edge of the screen and Width is Invalid. Default is 0.

params.name: YOffset
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression giving the default Y-position to use if the value of the YPosPtr is Invalid. It is also the Y-position that will be used if the dialog is beyond the bottom edge of the screen and Height is Invalid. Default is 0.

params.name: Width
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression giving the width of the dialog.

params.name: Height
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression giving the height of the dialog.

params.name: SuppressCentering
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, this function won't center off-screen windows, instead shifting windows on-screen. Note that when this is true and *pXPosition and *pYPosition are valid, then XOffset and YOffset are not used because VTScada will always shift the positions given in the pointers on-screen rather than falling back on XOffset/YOffset.

params.name: WinOptions
RefWindow
params.description: Optional Window object. If provided, and if the values of pXPosition and pYPosition are not preset or would cause the dialog to appear outside of the screen, the module will try to center the dialog to this window instead of the screen.

params.name: CaseInsensitive
params.description: Optional. A Boolean indicating whether the keys in the dictionary are to be case sensitive. TRUE == Not Case Sensitive (default) FALSE == Case Sensitive

params.name: RootValue
params.description: Optional text value, almost never used. Numeric values will be cast to text. If not provided, the dictionary will have no root value. (default: Invalid) In practice, root values are only ever assigned to dictionaries to create nested dictionaries. If the script cannot find a specific key in a dictionary it will then search the nested dictionary.

params.name: Dictionary
params.description: Required. The name of the dictionary.

params.name: Deep
params.description: Optional. A Boolean that causes all linked dictionaries, if any, to be copied as well. Defaults to FALSE

params.name: Acyclic
params.description: Optional. A Boolean indicating that cyclic links within the dictionary structure should not be included in the copy. Defaults to FALSE

params.name: Lock
params.description: Optional. A Boolean indicating that the contents of the dictionary copy are to be constant. Defaults to FALSE

params.name: Dictionary
params.description: Required. The name of the dictionary.

params.name: Key
params.description: Required. The name of the key to be removed.

params.name: ResultBuffer
params.description: Required. Any expression that resolves to the variable to be set to the output buffer. This buffer is created asynchronously and should be checked for valid data before use. The content of this buffer will be an instruction set for transforming the contents of Buffer1 into a duplicate of the contents of Buffer2. A detailed description of this instruction set is provided in the Comments section.

params.name: Completion Counter
params.description: Required. Any expression that resolves to a variable containing a numeric value or Invalid. If a numeric variable, the value will be incremented at the instant that Diff is called. It will then be decremented after the Result Buffer has been populated. The same variable can be used to monitor any number of simultaneous, asynchronous Diff operations. If this parameter is set to Invalid then the Diff operation will be performed synchronously. The function won't return until the Result Buffer is populated.

params.name: Buffer1
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns the first buffer. This is the buffer that is intended to be modified by the instructions returned.

params.name: Buffer2
params.description: Required. Any expression for the second buffer. This is the buffer that the first buffer would resemble were the returned instructions applied.

params.name: Delimiter
params.description: Optional. The bytes used to delimit lines in text buffers (or records in any sort of delimited buffer). Multiple delimiters can be specified by passing an array of text strings. If not otherwise specified, the default is an array containing typical text file line endings (newline, carriage return or a combination of the two characters in either order). Can accept either a single string or an array of strings

params.name: ChunkSize
params.description: Optional.  The number of bytes to compare as a unit in a binary buffer. Must be set to 1 or greater to enable a binary diff (a delimited diff is performed by default). Unless the contents of the buffers are guaranteed to align to a given number of bytes it is recommended that this be set to 1 to enable binary diffs. Defaults to 0.

params.name: ClipLength
params.description: Optional. This numeric value is an optimization. It indicates how long a string of matches (i.e. both buffers having identical contents) will become before the function decides that it has found an optimal instruction set and will discard competing sets. If Diff returns sub-optimal instructions you should increase this value. Lower values will reduce the execution time of the function at the cost of the quality of the output. Higher values increase output quality but decrease speed. Sub-optimal instruction sets will result if strings of matches having the given length can occur randomly within the two buffers. Defaults to 20.

params.name: EdgeLength
params.description: Optional. Another numeric optimization, best set to twice the ClipLength. Causes the elimination of instruction sets that are estimated to require at least EdgeLength more instructions than the best set at any point during the search. Sub-optimal instruction sets will result if the estimate is inaccurate by an amount greater than this value. Lower EdgeLength values will reduce the execution time of the function at the cost of the quality of the output. Higher values will increase output quality but decrease speed. Defaults to 40.

params.name: MaxVariance
params.description: Optional. Sets a maximum variance, as measured by the number of items changes in the same way. If the DIFF strays from an exact match by MaxVariance by a given number of data adds or deletes, execution will stop. A mixture of adds and deletes will cancel each other out. When set to a value smaller than the default, files with lots of small modified areas will pass while files with a single modification, larger than this variance, will fail. Defaults to 1,000,000.

params.name: PointCap
params.description: Optional. Sets a cap on the number of points that will be searched within the buffers. In effect, this value serves to cause a timeout when comparing extremely large buffers that are almost completely different. Defaults to 1,000,000,000.

params.name: Path
params.description: Required. Any text expression that indicates the full path name for the directory to list. The search is non-recursive (i.e. it considers only the specified directory, not any of its sub-directories). Path may include a wildcard, such as "*.DAT". A known path alias for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: Attributes
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that gives the attributes to match on each file listed. Files that don't match these attributes won't be listed. The Attribute parameter may be set as one of the following: Attribute Bit No. Meaning 0 - Files without attributes 8 3 All files (regardless of attributes) ... or, it may be constructed by adding together the numbers from the following table : Attribute Bit No. Meaning 1 0 Read only 2 1 Hidden 4 2 System 16 4 Sub-directory 32 5 Archive

params.name: AlreadyHasLock
params.description: Required Boolean. Set TRUE when we already have the working copy lock.

params.name: RSema
params.description: Required. Repository semaphore, if already held by the caller.

params.name: CallBack
params.description: Required. Module name of the caller performing the changes.

params.name: FileSet
params.description: The set of files to be changed, identified using a path relative to the working-copy.

params.name: User
params.description: The user ID that is to be applied to the change.

params.name: Comment
params.description: Any text value that is the comment to be stored in the version log for this change.

params.name: pFail
params.description: A pointer to a Boolean. This will be set TRUE on failure.

params.name: AlarmObject
params.description: Required. The object value for the alarm that was passed to the Register subroutine that will be disabled.

params.name: EventTime
params.description: Optional. The time stamp to use when adding this event to the alarm lists. If invalid or not defined, the default is CurrentTime().

params.name: Workstation
params.description: Required. Any of the name or IPs that can be used to connect to the workstation.

params.name: DLLName
params.description: Required. Any text expression that gives the full path, file name, and extension of the DLL to load, or the handle returned from a LoadDLL statement.

params.name: FuncName
params.description: Required. Any text expression that gives the name of the function to call in the DLL.

params.name: ReturnType
params.description: Required. The return type of the DLL function, as shown in the following table ReturnType Attribute 0 Void (return value only) 1 16-bit Integer 2 32-bit Integer 3 64-bit Double 4 Pointer to a buffer (*) 5 HWnd value of VTScada Object 6 Reserved 7 64-bit Integer 8 Pointer-width Integer* *The pointer-width integer is the size of a pointer in the host environment. Therefore, in 32-bit VTScada, it is a 32-bit integer, and in 64-bit VTScada, it is a 64-bit integer.

params.name: Function1, Function2, â¦
params.description: Required. Any expression or statement. This is the body of the loop. All of the Function parameters are executed in order prior to testing the Condition parameter.

params.name: Condition
params.description: Required. Any logical expression for the loop control. As long as this is true, the loop will repeat.

params.name: TagObj
params.description: Required object value. The tag to be examined.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression that gives the object value that defines the selected graphic list to drag.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that is the new X coordinate of the selected handle(s).

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that is the new Y coordinate of the selected handle(s).

params.name: KeepRatio
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true (non-zero), the aspect ratio of the graphic will be preserved during stretching (online). If false (0), it will not.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the left side of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the bottom side of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the right side of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the top side of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: RotateAngle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the angle of rotation of the arc in degrees. This represents a rotation about the center of the bounding box. If it is greater than 0, the arc's shape will still be defined by the proportions of the bounding box, but will no longer be within its (un-rotated) screen coordinates. Note that although the arc itself will rotate RotateAngle degrees, neither of the endpoints for the lines defined by StartX, StartY, and EndX, EndY will be affected (i.e. the arc will not 'line up' with the angled lines).

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that defines the window in which to draw the arc.

params.name: StartX
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the X coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the starting angle. The other endpoint is the center of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: StartY
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the Y coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the starting angle. The other endpoint is the center of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: EndX
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the X coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the ending angle. The other endpoint is the center of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: EndY
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the Y coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the ending angle. The other endpoint is the center of the arc's bounding box.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the left side of the bounding box.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the bottom side of the bounding box.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the right side of the bounding box.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the top side of the bounding box.

params.name: RotateAngle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the angle of rotation of the chord in degrees. This represents a rotation about the center of the bounding box. If it is greater than 0, the chord's shape will still be defined by the proportions of the bounding box, but will no longer be within its (un-rotated) screen coordinates. Note that although the chord itself will rotate RotateAngle degrees, neither of the endpoints for the lines defined by StartX, StartY, and EndX, EndY will be affected (i.e. the chord will not 'line up' with the angled lines).

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that defines the window in which to draw the chord.

params.name: StartX
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the X coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the starting angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: StartY
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the Y coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the starting angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: EndX
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the X coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the ending angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: EndY
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the Y coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the ending angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the left side of the bounding box.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the bottom side of the bounding box.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the right side of the bounding box.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the top side of the bounding box.

params.name: RotateAngle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the angle of rotation of the ellipse in degrees. This represents a rotation about the center of the bounding box. If it is greater than 0, the ellipse's shape will still be defined by the proportions of the bounding box, but will no longer be within its (un-rotated) screen coordinates.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that defines the window in which to draw the ellipse.

params.name: XArray
params.description: Required. An array element expression. This array specifies the X coordinates of the path to draw, beginning with the element specified.

params.name: YArray
params.description: Required. An array element expression. This array specifies the Y coordinates of the path to draw, beginning with the element specified.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of points (number of array elements) in the path.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that defines the window.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the left side of the bounding box.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the bottom side of the bounding box.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the right side of the bounding box.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the top side of the bounding box.

params.name: RotateAngle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the angle of rotation of the pie, in degrees. This represents a rotation about the center of the bounding box. If it is greater than 0, the pie's shape will still be defined by the proportions of the bounding box, but will no longer be within its (un-rotated) screen coordinates. Note that although the pie itself will rotate RotateAngle degrees, neither of the endpoints for the lines defined by StartX, StartY and EndX, EndY will be affected (i.e. the pie will not 'line up' with the angled lines).

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that defines the window.

params.name: StartX
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the X coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the starting angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: StartY
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the Y coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the starting angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: EndX
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the X coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the ending angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: EndY
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the Y coordinate of an endpoint of a line that defines the ending angle. The other endpoint is the center of the bounding box.

params.name: MajorTickImage
params.description: Required. The full path to an image file to use as a major tick mark.

params.name: MinorTickImage
params.description: Required. The full path to an image file to use as a minor tick mark.

params.name: MajorDivisions
params.description: Optional. The number of major divisions in the scale. The default is 1 major division.

params.name: MinorDivisions
params.description: Optional. The number of Minor divisions between the major divisions in the scale. The default is 5 minor divisions.

params.name: RelativeSize
params.description: Optional. The relative size of the tick marks. If set, the tick marks will resize independently from the automatic sizing that is done when you resize the transform. Typically the range for this parameter is from 0 to 2, where 2 is double the default size and 0.5 is half the default size. The default is 1 which is the native size as scaled with the transform size.

params.name: LinearScale
params.description: Optional. A flag that, when set to true causes a linear scale to be drawn. When set to false, a Radial scale will be created. The default is true.

params.name: Orientation
params.description: Optional. A flag that is relevant only when drawing a linear type scale. When set to true the scale will be oriented vertically. When set to false, the scale will be oriented horizontally. The default is false.

params.name: MinAngle
params.description: Optional. The angle for the starting position of a radial type scale. 0 is defined as up or the 12 oâclock position. This parameter is relevant only when drawing a radial type scale. The default is 0.

params.name: MaxAngle
params.description: Optional. The angle for the ending position of a Radial type scale. . 0 is defined as up or the 12 oâclock position. This parameter is relevant only when drawing a radial type scale. The default is 90.

params.name: Hue
params.description: Optional. The Hue translation to perform on the tick mark image. The image must have color in it already to perform a hue translation. If there is no color to start with, then changing this value does nothing. You can add color by setting a value for the ColorizeHue parameter, described later. The default is 0, indicating that no hue translation is done and the indicator is in its native color.

params.name: Saturation
params.description: Optional. The amount of saturation of the colors in the tick mark image. A value of 0 will make the image black and white (no color saturation). A value of 2 produces a brightly colored (saturated) indicator. The default is 1 which corresponds to the native saturation of the indicator image.

params.name: Brightness
params.description: Optional. An adjustment of the brightness of the tick mark image. Higher numbers produce a brighter image. A 0 produces a black image. The default is 1 which corresponds to the native brightness of the tick mark image.

params.name: Transparency
params.description: Optional. An adjustment of the opacity of the tick mark image where 1 means 100% opacity and 0 means %100 transparent. The default is 1.

params.name: Contrast
params.description: Optional. An adjustment of the contrast of the colors in the tick mark image. A value of 0 produces a flat looking image and a value of 2 gives a high contrast image. The default is 1 which corresponds to the native contrast of the image.

params.name: ColorizeHue
params.description: Optional. A value that works in conjunction with ColorizeIntensity. This is the hue of the color that is introduced by colorizing an image. Colorizing an image will introduce color into an image that previously was black and white or grayscale. The default value is 0.

params.name: ColorizeIntensity
params.description: Optional. A value to define how much color to introduce into the image. The default is 0, meaning not to introduce any color at all into the image.

params.name: Attributes
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the attributes to match for each drive. Drives that don't match these attributes won't be listed. The Attributes parameter is constructed by adding together the numbers from the table below (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations ) Attribute Bit No. Drive Type 1 0 Removable drive (floppy disk) 2 1 Fixed drive (hard disk) 4 2 Remote drive (network disk) 8 3 CD-ROM drive

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of one side of the droplist.

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the (opened) droplist.

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the droplist opposite to X1.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the top or bottom of the (opened) droplist, whichever is the opposite to Y1.

params.name: Data
params.description: Required. An array of data to display in the droplist.

params.name: Title
params.description: Required. Any text expression to be used as a title for the droplist.

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. A variable whose value indicates the array index of the highlighted item in the list. Index can be set invalid to reset the droplist.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression from 0 to 32767 for the focus number of this graphic. If this value is 0, the droplist will display its current setting, but will not be able to be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed) and will appear grayed out. The default value is 1.

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Required. If the droplist is editable, Trigger provides feedback. While editing, the value will be 0. When editing is complete (tab, enter or loss of focus) the value will change to non-zero; 1 if enter is pressed, 2 otherwise. If this information is not required and the next parameter is used, a value of invalid or a constant may be substituted.

params.name: NoEdit
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If TRUE (non-0) the text displayed in the droplist cannot be edited directly, if FALSE (0) it can be edited in the same manner as an editfield. Options of the Style parameter may conflict with this parameter, if configured. In this case, the Style parameter will be used and the NoEdit parameter will be ignored. If a variable is used to specify the NoEdit parameter value and this variable is set to invalid, NoEdit will default to TRUE. If Invalid is used directly as the value of the NoEdit parameter, NoEdit will default to FALSE.

params.name: Init
params.description: Required. Any expression for the initial value displayed in the field if Index is set to invalid. If NoEdit is true, then Init must be an element of the data array.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. The variable whose value is set by the droplist. The maximum number of characters that a user can provide is 65535.

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) a bevel is drawn around the droplist, if false (0) no bevel is drawn. The default value is false.

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the editfield according to one of the following options VertAlign Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated is determined by the value of AlignTitle. The default value is 0.

params.name: Left
params.description: Any numeric expression for the left coordinate of the tool.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Any  numeric expression for the bottom coordinate of the tool.

params.name: Right
params.description: Any  numeric expression for the right coordinate of the tool.

params.name: Top
params.description: Any  numeric expression for the top coordinate of the tool.

params.name: TreeData
params.description: The data to display, in Node array format. The format is the same as for a call to TreeControl

params.name: Title
params.description: Any text expression to be used as a title.

params.name: SelectedKey
params.description: The key of the  selected item. Must be a variable, and may specify initial selection.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Any numeric expression from 0 to 32767 for the FocusID.

params.name: FTrigger
params.description: The Focus Trigger of the DropTree.

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE (non-0) a bevel is drawn. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If TRUE (non-0) the title is included in the calculation for vertical alignment. The default is FALSE.

params.name: DlgRoot
params.description: Optional. The object value of the root dialog. Used for alignment of the DropTree. Defaults to the caller if not specified.

params.name: Trigger
params.description: An optional numeric expression. Initially set to zero (0) when the DropTree opens. If the user presses the Escape key or closes the extended window, then Trigger becomes 1.

params.name: BGColor
params.description: Optional background color of the control.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any expression giving a numeric status value to be tested. It is interpreted as true if it is non-zero, and false if it is zero.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Dictates whether the change from false to true or true to false is tested. If it is 0, a true to false (a falling edge) is tested. If it is 1, a false to true (a rising edge) is tested.

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of one side of the edit field.

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the edit field.

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the edit field opposite to X1.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the top or bottom of the edit field, whichever is the opposite of Y1.

params.name: Title
params.description: Required. Any text expression to be used as a title for the field.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. A variable whose value is set by the edit field.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression from 0 to 32767 for the focus number of this graphic. If this value is 0, the edit field will display its current setting, but its value will not be able to be changed and it will appear grayed out. The default value is 1.

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Optional. Trigger provides feedback. While editing, the value will be 0. When editing is complete (tab, enter or loss of focus) the value will change to non-zero: 1 if enter is pressed, 2 otherwise.

params.name: View
params.description: Optional. Indicates how to display the edit field, as follows View Display Mode 0 Invisible 1 Normal (color scheme - no graying) 2 Grayed-out (only if FocusID is 0) 3 Non-grayed text on a shaded background 4 Gray only if ID == 0 and allow clicks to be detected by a Pick(). This parameter may be used to force an edit field with a FocusID of 0 to display normally, rather than allowing it to default to its grayed color. Note that if the FocusID is not 0, setting this value as 2 will not force the field to gray out. The default value is 2 if FocusID is 0 and 1 otherwise.

params.name: ModItem
params.description: Required. A file name, a dictionary of file names, or an array of names of modified files. File paths relative to the working copy are recommended. Files outside the working copy cannot be added. If invalid, all the working copy files are used. If a dictionary, then the keys are the files to use. If the values are FileMetadata, then the structures are expected to be fully populated including the deltas. If the values are streams, then the stream contains the new copy of the file to commit. The stream may contain a Time metadata value for the time stamp. If the metadata is not there, CurrentTime will be used. Otherwise the dictionary values contain a numeric value with options as follows: 0 means the file is added, modified or deleted based on the working copy file 1 mean the file is deleted from working copy 2 mean ignore the file in the working copy The default for this value is 0

params.name: JustInformSubscribers
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to not mark the file as modified. This is useful when switching between repository revisions.Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Section
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the section in the file. This should not include the square brackets delimiting the section.

params.name: VarName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the variable for which the value is to be set.

params.name: Title
params.description: Optional. Any text expression to be used as a title for the field. No default.

params.name: DataType
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression giving the type of data accepted by the edit field as follows. No default. DataType Type 0 Byte (unsigned) 1 Short (2 byte signed) 2 Long (4 byte signed) 3 Double precision floating point (8 byte signed) 4 Text Note that for types 1 and 2, if the number entered into the field is prefaced by a "0x", the value is taken to be a hexadecimal value and is converted to a decimal value when return is pressed. The default value is 4.

params.name: Section
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the section in the file. This should not include the square brackets delimiting the section.

params.name: VarName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the variable for which the value is to be set.

params.name: Title
params.description: Optional. Any text expression to be used as a title for the field. No default:

params.name: BoxOnLeft
params.description: Optional. A Boolean, indicating whether the check box should be to the left or right of the label. Defaults to TRUE (box to the left of the label).

params.name: Align
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression controlling the alignment of the label and the box. Defaults to 3 - Left, vertically centered. Value Meaning 0 Left, top. 1 Right, top. 2 Full, top. 3 Left, vertically centered. 4 Right, vertically centered. 5 Full, vertically centered. 6 Left, bottom. 7 Right, bottom. 8 Full, bottom.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the left hand side of the square area where the editor will operate.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the bottom of the square area where the editor will operate.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the right hand side of the square area where the editor will operate.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the top of the square area where the editor will operate.

params.name: EditorValue
params.description: Required. An editor value that has been created by MakeEditor which contains the text contents for the editor.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression from 0 to 32767 giving the focus number of the graphic. If FocusID is zero, this graphic cannot receive the input focus.

params.name: Font
