params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUEfor subroutine calls.

params.name: Result
params.description: Required. A pointer to the array retrieved from file. The  array may be multidimensional as described in the Comments section. Please review the information carefully.

params.name: Tag
params.description: Required. The object value of the tag from which to get the logged data.

params.name: Name
params.description: Required. The name of the logged value in the tag. If Invalid or a valid empty string, a timestamp is used. It is possible to retrieve more than one field in a single GetLog statement. To do this, pass an array of values in as the Name parameter. Typically "Value" for most tag values, or "Value!" for tag attribute data. (Value! was introduced with VTScada version 12 and is not available in legacy data. It cannot be retrieved by SQL queries.)

params.name: Start
params.description: Required. The start time in seconds since January 1, 1970.

params.name: End
params.description: Required. The end time in seconds since January 1, 1970. If invalid, Size limits the number of tags retrieved.

params.name: TPP
params.description: Required. The time span per tag. If Invalid, Size limits the number of tags retrieved.

params.name: Size
params.description: Required. The maximum number of tags to get. If greater than 0, data is accessed one at a time from file, rather than at equal time intervals. If TPP is valid, Size is ignored.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Indicates the mode of data collection. Note: The mode is useful only when the TPP  parameter is valid and greater than 0. Mode may be one of: It is possible to retrieve more than one mode in a single GetLog statement. To do this, pass an array of values in as the Mode parameter. Mode Data Collection 0 Time-weighted average 1 Minimum in range 2 Maximum in range 3 Change in value over the range 4 Value at start of range 5 TimeOfMinInRange 6 TimeOfMaxInRange 7 SumOfZtoNZTransitions 8 SumOfNonZeroTime 9 Totalizer.  (Invalid is counted as zero) 10 Deprecated. Equivalent to mode 4. 11 Difference between the start and end values of a range (see following note) 12 Bitwise OR (see following note) 13 Bitwise AND (see following note) 14 Value at end of range Mode 11: This is for hardware that can count to a limited number, then rolls over to start a fresh count. For example, a tag that counts equipment starts, but which can only count from 0 to 15  before wrapping around to start again. This gives a value of sixteen per roll-over since there must be one more start after fifteen to have the roll-over occur. A graph of a very simple case where there is a start every second would look like the following: (Each rollover must be followed by a fresh start, not a gradually declining value. If there are a series of declining values then, because each is less than the previous, each counts as another rollover.) The formula used is (RolloverCount * RolloverValue) + (LastValidValue - FirstValidValue). Where, for any given time interval: Rollovers are counted when a new value is smaller than the last valid value. The RolloverValue is passed to the function in the parameter StaleTime. LastValidValue starts with the last valid value in the previous time interval (if any), and is updated with each new valid value within the time interval. FirstValidValue starts with the last valid value in the previous time interval (if any), and is updated with only the first valid value found in the current time span. Given this example, suppose that you want a count of starts in each thirty-second interval. In the first interval there is no previous valid value, one wrap-around and a last valid value of 12. (1*16) + (12 - 0) = 28. This is an idealized case. Consider a more realistic case where not all values are logged. (This may be due to factors such as polling intervals, deadbands, hardware, etc.) The following graph shows the same data where the orange dots represent values obtained and logged and the gray line represents what really happened: In the first 30 seconds there is one roll-over when the value drops from 13 to 2. The first value is 0 and the last is 11. The Historian will return 27: (1*16) + (11-0) = 27. The Historian will return 30 for the period from 30 to 60. The first valid value (carried from the previous period) is 11. The last valid value is 9 and there are two roll-overs. (2*16) + (9-11) = 30. Modes 12 and 13: These are intended to provide a summary of the bit-wise Historian value attributes within a query. (Value attributes were added in VTScada version 11.5 / 12.0) With mode 12, the first value is OR'd with zero, and each successive value in the time period is OR'd with result of the last comparison. From the result you will know whether any particular attribute bit was set on any values within the period. With mode 13, the first value is AND'd with a value having all bits set to 1 and each successive value is AND'd with the result of the last comparison. From the result you will know whether any particular attribute bit was set on all values within the period.

Required text. The name of the tag to retrieve changed/overridden
                         parameters

Optional Boolean.  TRUE to fetch deployed version of the given
                         tag's parameters. Defaults to FALSE to get the current set of tag parameters on this workstation, regardless of whether or not they have been deployed.

params.name: PtrReturnCode
params.description: Required. A pointer to a return code. If launching GetTagHistory multiple times for a set of tags this should be an array with an index incrementing for each launch. PtrReturnCode will be invalid until this launched function finishes. Watch for this value to become valid before attempting to process the results. In the case of an array, use AValid to watch for every instance to finish. Defined error codes are provided in the reference chapter. See: Historian Error Codes

params.name: PtrResult
params.description: A pointer to the historical data that will be returned in this parameter. Always returns an array with at least two dimensions according to the parameter, Fields.

params.name: TagObj
params.description: Object value of the tag for which the history is to be retrieved.

params.name: FieldNames
params.description: Either the name or an array of names of the fields to retrieve. Typically, the field in which you are interested is "Value" for most tag values, or "Value!" for tag attribute data (Value! was introduced with VTScada version 12 and is not available in legacy data. It cannot be retrieved by SQL queries.) Note that TagData will still be a two-dimensional array even if FieldsNames is simply text. In most cases, it is better to specify this parameter as a one-dimensional array containing two elements: "Timestamp" and "Value". Both dimensions of TagData will then have data.

params.name: StartTime
params.description: UTC time stamp indicating the beginning of the data range to retrieve. A local time value should be converted to UTC as follows. (LocalTimeZone should be 0 in almost all cases.) UTCStartTime = ConvertTimestamp(Start, LocalTimeZone, FALSE, Invalid);

params.name: EndTime
params.description: UTC time stamp indicating the end of the data range to retrieve. (Selection is inclusive of this time.) Ignored if TPP is non-zero.

params.name: TPP
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the time span in seconds for each array entry. Each array element will contain the data which correspond exactly to this time period which corresponds to 0 or more data points. If TPP is equal to 0, the data is read and placed in the array on a one to one basis. If TPP is less than 0, an error will be returned. If reading string values with TPP > 0 and Modes = 4 then valid text values are returned. Attempting to do the same with any Modes value other than 4 will return only Invalid.

params.name: NumEntries
params.description: The number of log entries to be returned in the array. Use a negative value to retrieve values in reverse chronological order.

params.name: Modes
params.description: Optional numeric expression giving the method of handling the data. If TPP is greater than 0, the values that fall in each time span will be represented as follows: Mode Data Collection 0 Time-weighted average 1 Minimum in range 2 Maximum in range 3 Change in value over the range 4 Value at start of range 5 TimeOfMinInRange 6 TimeOfMaxInRange 7 SumOfZtoNZTransitions 8 SumOfNonZeroTime 9 Totalizer.  (Invalid is counted as zero) 10 Deprecated. Equivalent to mode 4. 11 Difference between the start and end values of a range (see following note) 12 Bitwise OR (see following note) 13 Bitwise AND (see following note) 14 Value at end of range Mode 11: This is for hardware that can count to a limited number, then rolls over to start a fresh count. For example, a tag that counts equipment starts, but which can only count from 0 to 15  before wrapping around to start again. This gives a value of sixteen per roll-over since there must be one more start after fifteen to have the roll-over occur. A graph of a very simple case where there is a start every second would look like the following: (Each rollover must be followed by a fresh start, not a gradually declining value. If there are a series of declining values then, because each is less than the previous, each counts as another rollover.) The formula used is (RolloverCount * RolloverValue) + (LastValidValue - FirstValidValue). Where, for any given time interval: Rollovers are counted when a new value is smaller than the last valid value. The RolloverValue is passed to the function in the parameter StaleTime. LastValidValue starts with the last valid value in the previous time interval (if any), and is updated with each new valid value within the time interval. FirstValidValue starts with the last valid value in the previous time interval (if any), and is updated with only the first valid value found in the current time span. Given this example, suppose that you want a count of starts in each thirty-second interval. In the first interval there is no previous valid value, one wrap-around and a last valid value of 12. (1*16) + (12 - 0) = 28. This is an idealized case. Consider a more realistic case where not all values are logged. (This may be due to factors such as polling intervals, deadbands, hardware, etc.) The following graph shows the same data where the orange dots represent values obtained and logged and the gray line represents what really happened: In the first 30 seconds there is one roll-over when the value drops from 13 to 2. The first value is 0 and the last is 11. The Historian will return 27: (1*16) + (11-0) = 27. The Historian will return 30 for the period from 30 to 60. The first valid value (carried from the previous period) is 11. The last valid value is 9 and there are two roll-overs. (2*16) + (9-11) = 30. Modes 12 and 13: These are intended to provide a summary of the bit-wise Historian value attributes within a query. (Value attributes were added in VTScada version 11.5 / 12.0) With mode 12, the first value is OR'd with zero, and each successive value in the time period is OR'd with result of the last comparison. From the result you will know whether any particular attribute bit was set on any values within the period. With mode 13, the first value is AND'd with a value having all bits set to 1 and each successive value is AND'd with the result of the last comparison. From the result you will know whether any particular attribute bit was set on all values within the period. In the case of modes 5 and 6, FieldName should still be set to indicate the field on which the mode is to act. The return values will be times indicating the maximum or minimum in that field for each time span. If TPP is less than or equal to 0, Mode is ignored. If the data is text, the first entry in a given time range is used for the array entry and Mode is ignored. It is possible to retrieve more than one mode in a single GetTagHistory statement. To do this, pass an array of values in as the Mode parameter.

params.name: RootLevel
params.description: Optional text. The name of the tag to begin with. May be a unique id or a tag name. Defaults to VTSDB if not specified.

params.name: DoRecursive
params.description: Optional. A Boolean value which, when set TRUE, results in sub-tags being returned as well as tags at the current level of the tree. Defaults to false if Invalid.

params.name: SearchType
params.description: Optional flag.  Set 0 for a name search or 1 to search all parameters. Defaults to 0, name search.

params.name: SearchString
params.description: Optional text. A value to filter for, using pattern matching.

params.name: TagType
params.description: Optional. The type of tag to be filtered for. Set to Invalid (not "*") for all tag types.

params.name: AreaSearch
params.description: Optional text - the area name to filter for using pattern matching.

params.name: EnableRealmAreaFiltering
params.description: Optional Numeric with possible values as follows: 0 => no realm or user filtering. 1 => apply realm & user filtering. (Default) 2 => apply only realm filtering.

params.name: IncludeGhosts
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to include disabled tags. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: ExcludeLeaves
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to filter for only tags that have child tags. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: ExcludeMenuItems
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set to TRUE to exclude Menu ItemTags. Defaults to FALSE

params.name: ExcludeSubordinateTags
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set to TRUE to exclude Subordinate tags and tags from subordinate applications. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: EquipTypeSearch
params.description: Optional text. Provide an equipment type name to search for tags with that EquipmentType property. No default.

params.name: ParmSearchString
params.description: Optional text. Search string for full parameter search

params.name: AdditionalFilters

params.description: AddrSearchString

params.name: TagObj
params.description: Required. The tag instance being checked.

params.name: Specifier
params.description: Optional text. The name of the tag attribute to return. If this parameter is Invalid, a structure including all attributes will be returned. May be any of: IsString IsAnalog IsDigital IsDiscrete IsInput IsOutput IsPump IsDriver EquipmentType IsAnalytic IsMemoryTag IsContainer

params.name: GetGroups
params.description: Optional Boolean. If set TRUE, the list of tag groups will be retrieved and returned at the end of the list of types. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: GetModuleNames
params.description: Optional Boolean. If set TRUE, this function will return module names rather than the display name for each type. If set, Groups will be invalid. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Time
params.description: Required numeric. The number of seconds since midnight

params.name: FormatID
params.description: Required text. The phrase identifier key specifying the time format. See: Date and Time Phrase Keys

params.name: Stream
params.description: Required. Any stream expression for the input stream.

params.name: Token
params.description: Required. A variable into which the next token read will be stored.

params.name: ClassBuffer
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the character classifier table.

params.name: NumClasses
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of character classes.

params.name: StateBuffer
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the tokenizer state table.

params.name: ActionBuffer
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the tokenizer action table.

params.name: SkipWhite
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, all white spaced is skipped. Otherwise all continuous white space is treated as a token.

params.name: LineCount
params.description: Required. Must be a variable. The number of lines read is stored here.

params.name: Column
params.description: Required. Must be a variable. The current column is stored here.

params.name: CharCount
params.description: Required. Must be a variable. The number of characters read is stored here.

params.name: TagID
params.description: Required text. The unique IDof the tag to check.

params.name: IncludeAncestry
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUEto search the tag's ancestry. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: Snapshot
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUEif this function is called in script. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: GetRequest
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to search the TokenRequests list instead of the Tokens list. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: ReturnAll
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to return all matching records. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: TagID
params.description: Required text. The UniqueIDof the tag.

params.name: IncludeAncestry
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUEto search the tag's ancestry. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: Snapshot
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUEif calling this function in script. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: CodePointer
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code pointer value that defines the graphic statement.

params.name: CodePointer
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code pointer value which defines the graphic statement.

params.name: Action
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code value that defines the action.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which defines the information desired Mode Information desired 0 Script size in characters 1 Character offset to script 2 Trigger size in characters 3 Character offset to trigger 4 Destination size in characters 5 Character offset to destination 6 Size of script excluding [ ] , in characters 7 Character offset to first script statement 8 Total size of action, in characters

params.name: AlarmName
params.description: Required record. A reference to the alarm, as returned by the function GetAlarmObject.

params.name: TrimRealm
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, and if the user is a member of a security group, the realm (group) will be trimmed from the result.

params.name: DefaultToRootSession
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE (the default value) then if a valid session is not found, this function will return the Display Manager's root session. (That is, the one pertaining to the actual running application as opposed to any remotely established session.) If set FALSE, then Invalid will be returned if a valid session is not found.

params.name: QueryVariable
params.description: Optional. The name of a variable to be queried. Examples include, but are not limited to: \IsRootSession \AppTitle \CurrentWinInst\PageInstance

params.name: TagObj
params.description: Required. The tag object at the point in the hierarchy where you want to collect the accumulated values.

params.name: AccumulatorName
params.description: Required. The name of the accumulator, from which to retrieve the current count.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for a variable.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the desired information. The character offset is to the right after the declared variable (i.e. the carriage return is not included, nor is the line feed that ends the line), and length includes the CR, LF(2). Mode Desired information 0 Character offset to variable declaration 1 Size of variable declaration in characters In the case of the offset to the variable declaration, this is located immediately following the variable preceding this variable and will in fact include the carriage return and line feed from the previous variable. Likewise, the size of the variable declaration includes the leading carriage return and line feed, any spaces preceding the actual variable name and does not include the carriage return and line feed following the variable.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for a variable.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. A variable handle, such as would be returned from the FindVariable or AddVariable functions.

params.name: RecipeName
params.description: Optional text. The recipe, from which the version array should be retrieved.

params.name: SortAscending
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE(the default), recipe versions are sorted in ascending order before being returned.

params.name: Detailed
params.description: Optional. A flag which, if set to a non-zero value, results in a detailed 2-dimensional array of information about the voices being returned. If this parameter is "0" or omitted, the return value will be a 1-dimensional list of voice names suitable for use in the VoiceTalk\Configure function. If Detailed is specified, a 2-dimensional array containing the available speech voices will be returned. Each row in the array represents a speech module as follows: [N][0] Text value that indicates the name of this voice This is a human readable string (such as "Microsoft Mary") that may be passed to the VoiceTalk\Configure function. [N][1] Text value giving the language of the voice. For example, American English will be returned as "409,9", where 409 is the hexadecimal representation of standard English (decimal 1033), and 9 indicates American version of English. [N][2] Text value giving the gender of the voice. Either "Male" or "Female" [N][3] Text value giving the age of the voice (e.g., "Adult") [N][4] Text value vendor providing the voice (e.g. "Microsoft")

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression which gives the object value for the transformed module instance.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any expression that defines the requested return value as indicated by the following: Option Return Value 0 Left side 1 Bottom side 2 Right side 3 Top side

params.name: XMLContainer
params.description: The XMLNode within which to search for element type name. Only the direct child nodes of this node are searched. This is the equivalent of the first parameter of the Scope operator.

params.name: ElementType
params.description: The element type name to search for. This is equivalent to the second parameter of the Scope operator.

params.name: Editor
params.description: Required. Any expression for the editor value.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the character offset to display.

params.name: Highlight
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, characters will automatically be highlighted, beginning at Offset.

params.name: NumHighlight
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of characters to highlight if Highlight is true.

params.name: TagID
params.description: Required string. The UniqueID of the tag for which the token request is to be granted.

params.name: TokenRequestGUID
params.description: Required string. The GUID of the token request to grant. (Must be obtained via your script code. See: GetToken (Control Lock Module) )

params.name: Custom
params.description: Optional. A structure of custom fields to log

params.name: Timestamp
params.description: Optional The UTC timestamp of this event. Defaults to current time

params.name: SessionID
params.description: Optional. The ID of session granting the request. Relevant only if the token ownership is tied to the session.

params.name: AccountID
params.description: Optional. The Account ID of user granting the request. Defaults to the currently signed-in user.

params.name: MachineID
params.description: Optional. The MachineIDof the workstation where this action originated. Defaults to the current machine.

params.name: Device
params.description: Optional. Name of client device

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of one side of the grid area.

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the grid area.

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the grid area opposite to X1.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the grid area, whichever is the opposite to Y1.

params.name: Style
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the line style for the grid lines. Valid line styles are from 1 to 10, where 1 is a solid line.

params.name: Color
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the color of the grid lines. If the number is less than 10000, the grid lines are non-destructive. If greater than or equal to 10000, the grid lines are destructive and the actual color used is Color - 10000. RGB values and system color constants are not supported.

params.name: Horizontal
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of horizontal lines in the grid. This value may be zero.

params.name: Vertical
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of vertical lines in the grid. This value may be zero.

params.name: Titles
params.description: Required. The array of the titles you wish to use for the grid column headings. The title bar for a grid can be disabled by setting the Titles array to Invalid, or by setting TitleHeightParm to 0. By default, users will be able to click each of your titles to sort the grid (up or down) by the contents of that column. This (and all other) array parameters must use dynamic arrays. Alternatively, you may provide the name of a callback module, which will provide the titles. If doing so, your module must provide its own code to enable sorting by title. Refer to the comments section and example 4.

params.name: Data
params.description: Required. The array of data with which to populate the grid. Array elements match grid cells according to: Data[row][col].

params.name: DataFormat
params.description: Required. Usually an array of the data formats corresponding to the values specified in the Data array, in which case there must be one entry per column of data. Alternatively, this may be a single format that will be applied to all values, as shown in the example at the end of this topic. Available format codes are listed in most text functions including GUIText

params.name: ColWidthsParm
params.description: Optional. The array of the widths of the columns in pixels. Alternatively, a single value may be used to if all columns are to be the same width.

params.name: NumDataRowsParm
params.description: Optional. Specifies the number of data rows to display. Extra cells may be shown according to the height available to the grid, but no data will be displayed after the row set by this parameter.

params.name: NumDataColsParm
params.description: Optional. Specifies the number of data columns to display. No extra columns are shown if the Gridlist area is wider than the sum of the column widths.

params.name: GridListBGndParm
params.description: Optional. Sets the background color for the cells in the grid.

params.name: GridColorParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the color of the grid lines.

params.name: GridLineWidthParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the width of the grid lines.

params.name: GridStyleParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the style of the grid lines.

params.name: RowHeightParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the height of the rows in the grid.

params.name: TitleHeightParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the height of the column headings row above the grid. The title bar for a grid can be disabled by setting TitleHeightParm to 0, or by setting the Title array to Invalid.

params.name: HCellPaddingParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the horizontal cell padding for the grid.

params.name: VCellPaddingParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the vertical cell padding for the grid.

params.name: HScrollPosParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the horizontal scroll bar position.

params.name: VScrollPosParm
params.description: Optional. Indicates the vertical scroll bar position.

params.name: DisableVScroll
params.description: Optional. A flag that may be set to TRUE (non-zero) to disable vertical scrolling, or FALSE (0) to enable vertical scrolling.

params.name: DisableHScroll
params.description: Optional. A flag that may be set to TRUE (non-zero) to disable horizontal scrolling, or FALSE (0) to enable horizontal scrolling.

params.name: DisableColumnSizing
params.description: Optional. A flag that may be set to TRUE (non-zero) to disable column resizing, or FALSE (0) to enable column resizing.

params.name: DisableSorting
params.description: Optional. A flag that may be set to TRUE (non-zero) to disable sorting by clicking the column headings, or FALSE (0) to enable sorting by clicking the column headings.

params.name: DisableSelectedCellParm
params.description: Optional bitwise flag. Set bit 0 to disable selected-cell tracking. Set bit 1 to disable highlighting of the selected cell. Defaults to neither bit being set, thereby enabling selected-cell tracking and highlighting.

params.name: DisableVGridLines
params.description: Optional. A flag that may be set to TRUE (non-zero) to disable vertical grid lines, or FALSE (0) to enable vertical grid lines.

params.name: DisableHGridLines
params.description: Optional. A flag that may be set to TRUE (non-zero) to disable horizontal grid lines, or FALSE (0) to enable horizontal grid lines.

params.name: LockFirstColumn
params.description: An optional flag that may be set TRUE (non-zero) to lock the first column from horizontal scrolling (e.g. the first column contains row titles). The default value if Invalid or not supplied is FALSE.

params.name: Sort
params.description: An optional parameter that specifies the column on which the GridList is to be sorted. The parameter is 1-based (i.e. a value of 1 refers to the first column). If negative, the sort order is descending If the user clicks a column title to sort the GridList, then the parameter is set to the appropriate value. . If Invalid or not supplied, no column sorting will be applied.

params.name: SelectedRow
params.description: An optional parameter that specifies the row of the selected cell. The parameter is 0-based (i.e. a value of 0 refers to the first row). If the user clicks in a cell, then the parameter is set to the index of the selected row. If Invalid or not supplied, no cell is selected.

params.name: SelectedColumn
params.description: An optional parameter that specifies the column of the selected cell. The parameter is 0-based (i.e. a value of 0 refers to the first column). If the user clicks in a cell, then the parameter is set to the index of the selected column. If Invalid or not supplied, no cell is selected.

params.name: GridFontParm
params.description: An optional parameter that specifies the font to be used for Titles and Grid elements. The selected font will affect all items in the GridList. If using callbacks, it will allow the user to use the same font in their callbacks or have a separate title font and use their own font in their callbacks. Note: Nothing in a GridList is sized based on font size. The caller must ensure that the row and title heights are large enough to accommodate the font. No default value.

params.name: GetSortKeyScope
params.description: An optional module value of GetSortKey call-back (example in comments section). Required only when using call-backs for the cells of the Gridlist.

params.name: EnableBorderParm
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set true to show a border around the grid. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: CellTextColorParm
params.description: Optional color value. Color of the text in the cells.

params.name: TitleTextColorParm
params.description: Optional color value. Color of the text in the title.

params.name: TitleBackColorParm
params.description: Optional color value. Color of the title background.

params.name: TitleGridColorParm
params.description: Optional color value. Color of the title grid or border

params.name: LockFirstColColorParm
params.description: Optional color value. Color of the locked first columns gridline.

params.name: CaseSortParm
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE for case-insensitive sorting. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: DisableControlsParm
params.description: Optional bitwise flags to disable the keyboard or mouse so that the caller can define its own behavior for controls. Set bit 0 to disable keyboard input. Set bit 1 to disable cell selection by the mouse pointer. Default to neither bit set.

params.name: IsFocusableParm
params.description: Optional Boolean. If set TRUE, this allows the gridlist to take the focus when it is clicked on or tabbed to. Such a gridlist will only respond to keyboard input if it has focus. Defaults to FALSE. Note that the focus and keyboard-input behavior will also happen if the selected cell option is explicitly enabled.

params.name: LeftReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the left side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: BottomReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the bottom side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here. The top and bottom references are measured down from the top of the screen. The top and bottom references are measured down from the top of the screen.

params.name: RightReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the right side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: TopReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the top side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: ScaleLeft
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleBottom
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleRight
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleTop
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleWhole
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales the horizontal and vertical dimensions by the specified factor before the left, bottom, right and top coordinates are scaled.

params.name: Trajectory
params.description: Required. Either a Trajectory function, a variable containing a Trajectory value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Trajectory value or function, the appropriate translation is applied to the image after the rotation is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image isn't translated, but is displayed. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Rotation
params.description: Required. Either a Rotate function, a variable containing a Rotate value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Rotate value or function, the appropriate rotation is applied to the image before the trajectory is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image is rotated clockwise the number of degrees specified. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Opacity
params.description: Required. Any Numeric expression, setting the opacity of the object. A value of one results in a solid, zero is invisible and values between zero and one are used as an alpha setting for opacity.

params.name: Reserved
params.description: Reserved for future use, set to 0.

params.name: Button
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the button combination that activates this graphic. Button Locator Buttons 0 No button combination will activate this graphic 1 Right button 2 Middle button 3 Right and middle buttons 4 Left button 5 Left and right buttons 6 Left and middle buttons 7 All three buttons If the above values are multiplied by 8, the meaning for multiple buttons pressed becomes "OR" rather than "AND." For example, to accept any button on a 2 or 3 button mouse, use 56 (i.e. 8 * 7). To accept the left mouse button regardless of whether the right button is pressed, use 32 (i.e. 8 * 4). If a 64 is added to this parameter, the function will become true when the mouse buttons are released rather than when they are pressed.

params.name: BottomReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the bottom side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here. The top and bottom references are measured down from the top of the screen.

params.name: Visibility
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, the image is drawn normally. If false, the image is not drawn.

If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleBottom
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleRight
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. params.name: ScaleWhole
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales the horizontal and vertical dimensions by the specified factor before the left, bottom, right and top coordinates are scaled.

params.name: Trajectory
params.description: Required. Either a Trajectory function, a variable containing a Trajectory value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Trajectory value or function, the appropriate translation is applied to the image after the rotation is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image isn't translated, but is displayed. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Rotation
params.description: Required. Either a Rotate function, a variable containing a Rotate value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Rotate value or function, the appropriate rotation is applied to the image before the trajectory is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image is rotated clockwise the number of degrees specified. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Visibility
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, the image is drawn normally. If false, the image is not drawn.

params.name: Reserved  n/a
params.description: Reserved for future use, set to 0.

params.name: Button
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the button combination that activates this graphic. Value Locator Buttons 0 No button combination will activate this graphic 1 Right button 2 Middle button 3 Right and middle buttons 4 Left button 5 Left and right buttons 6 Left and middle buttons 7 All three buttons If the above values are multiplied by 8, the meaning for multiple buttons pressed becomes "OR" rather than "AND." For example, to accept any button on a 2 or 3 button mouse, use 56 (i.e. 8 * 7). To accept the left mouse button regardless of whether the right button is pressed, use 32 (i.e. 8 * 4). If a 64 is added to this parameter, the function will become true when the mouse buttons are released rather than when they are pressed.

params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the button combination that activates this graphic. Value Locator Buttons 0 No button combination will activate this graphic 1 Right button 2 Middle button 3 Right and middle buttons 4 Left button 5 Left and right buttons 6 Left and middle buttons 7 All three buttons If the above values are multiplied by 8, the meaning for multiple buttons pressed becomes "OR" rather than "AND." For example, to accept any button on a 2 or 3 button mouse, use 56 (i.e. 8 * 7). To accept the left mouse button regardless of whether the right button is pressed, use 32 (i.e. 8 * 4). If a 64 is added to this parameter, the function will become true when the mouse buttons are released rather than when they are pressed.

params.name: LeftReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the left side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: BottomReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the bottom side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here. The top and bottom references are measured down from the top of the screen.

params.name: RightReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the right side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: TopReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the top side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: ScaleLeft
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleBottom
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleRight
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleTop
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleWhole
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales the horizontal and vertical dimensions by the specified factor before the left, bottom, right and top coordinates are scaled.

params.name: Trajectory
params.description: Required. Either a Trajectory function, a variable containing a Trajectory value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Trajectory value or function, the appropriate translation is applied to the image after the rotation is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image isn't translated, but is displayed. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Rotation
params.description: Required. Either a Rotate function, a variable containing a Rotate value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Rotate value or function, the appropriate rotation is applied to the image before the trajectory is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image is rotated clockwise the number of degrees specified. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Opacity
params.description: Required. Any Numeric expression, setting the opacity of the object. A value of one results in a solid, zero is invisible and values between zero and one are used as an alpha setting for opacity.

params.name: Options
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving how a font behaves with regards to scaling, as follows: Options Font Behavior 0 The text will stay at its native font size, even though all the other graphics around it are being scaled with the page 1 The font size will scale proportionally to the vertical scaling of the page. If the text is drawn by a widget, it will scale doubly, both with the containing widget and the containing page. 2 Typically used by a widget that draws its own GUIText. By setting Options to 2, the text inside the widget will only scale in proportion to the topmost scaling, i.e. the page's scaling, and will ignore any scaling of the intermediate widget(s). Text squeezing is on by default, reducing text by as much as 35% to fit within the available space. If you set bit 3 (add 0b1000 to whatever value you are using in the Options parameter), then text will not scale down to fit within the available space. Text that does not fit  is clipped.

params.name: LeftReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the left side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: BottomReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the bottom side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here. The top and bottom references are measured down from the top of the screen.

params.name: RightReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the right side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: TopReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the top side reference coordinate. It must be a constant. A variable or expression is not valid here.

params.name: ScaleLeft
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleBottom
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleRight
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleTop
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales this side from its reference position with respect to the opposite side. If it is a numeric expression, a value of 1 will place the side at its reference position. A value of 0 will place it at the opposite side reference position. Similarly, a Normalize value will scale the side between the high and low limits. If the value is at the high level, the side will be at its reference position. If the value is at the low level, the side will be at the opposite side reference position.

params.name: ScaleWhole
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression, or any expression that returns a Normalize value. This parameter scales the horizontal and vertical dimensions by the specified factor before the left, bottom, right and top coordinates are scaled.

params.name: Trajectory
params.description: Required. Either a Trajectory function, a variable containing a Trajectory value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Trajectory value or function, the appropriate translation is applied to the image after the rotation is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image isn't translated, but is displayed. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Rotation
params.description: Required. Either a Rotate function, a variable containing a Rotate value, or a numeric expression. If this is a Rotate value or function, the appropriate rotation is applied to the image before the trajectory is applied. If it is a valid numeric expression, the image is rotated clockwise the number of degrees specified. Any other value is Invalid.

params.name: Visibility
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, the image is drawn normally. If false, the image is not drawn.

params.name: Options
params.description: Bit 1 (2^1) == Marks the transform as a GUIStretch. Rendering of the transform is done by stretching the content. Bit 2 (2^2) == Transform may be dragged onto a window from the palette. All transforms in a palette that can be dragged must have both bits set. A transform may be dragged even if its visibility flag is set to zero. Note that only Windows with bit 22 of the Style parameter set can function as a drop-target. Windows with bit 23 of the Style parameter set are palette windows.

params.name: PlainText
params.description: Required. Any text string to create a hash from.

params.name: AlgID
params.description: Specifies the algorithm to use when creating the hash. Valid options are as follows:  Defaults to 0 (SHA-1) if missing or invalid. AlgID Hash 0 SHA-1 (160 bit hash) 1 MD5 (128 bit hash) 2 SHA-2 (256 bit hash) 3 SHA-2 (384 bit hash) 4 SHA-2 (512 bit hash)
Seed

params.name: HashHandle
params.description: Optional. LValue. If Invalid, a hashing handle for the given AlgID is created and used for this and subsequent calls that supply this handle. No output is generated until a call, with this handle, is made with an Invalid PlainText parameter, at which time the hash built up using the handle is returned. At that time, the handle is destroyed and the LValue invalidated. For one-time hashing, the hash value is returned from this function as a text string of bytes. For progressive hashing the return value of this function is Invalid until a call with an Invalid PlainText parameter and a valid HashHandle is made.

params.name: CSP
params.description: Optional. The CSP to be used for hashing. This has the same type as used in ImportKey() and Encrypt(). Generated by a call to GetCryptoProvider.

params.name: Dictionary
params.description: Required. The name of any variable to test.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Reference to the object of interest.

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the name of the help system to display. May be the name of a .CHM file. To call a topic in the VTScada help system, use the system property, \DevHelpFile. Refer to the comments section for more options.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression controlling how the topic will be located within the help system, as indicated by the following table. Not all options work with all help system formats. Calls to topics using context sensitive help ID values should use option 3. Option Display Option SearchValue 0 Help contents 0 1 Key Key string 2 Partial key Partial key string 3 ID ID number 4 Help Topics 0

params.name: HexValue
params.description: Required. Any string representing a hexadecimal value.

params.name: ModuleTree
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module tree value.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code value of the module.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that indicates how to highlight Mode Highlight 0 Turn on highlighting 1 Turn off highlighting 2 Toggle highlighting

params.name: ConnectionType
params.description: A text keyword that indicates the storage methodology required. Permitted values are FileDB for storage on a local or networked hard drive, using the VTScada proprietary database format. ODBC for storage using a local or networked DBMS, accessed via ODBC drivers. The keywords are not case-sensitive.

params.name: ConnectionString
params.description: A text string that provides the information required to connect to the database specified by the ConnectionType. (Non-ASCII characters will be removed.) ConnectionType ConnectionString FileDB The root path to the storage folder. If a relative path is provided, then it is relative to the VTScada installation directory ODBC Any valid ODBC connection string. This may begin with DSN= to specify a data source name, or it may be a complete connection string.

params.name: FileDB
params.description: ODBC

params.name: ConnectionHandle
params.description: As returned by an HistorianConnect call.

params.name: TagName
params.description: A text string identifying the tag whose records are to be deleted.

params.name: Schema
params.description: This is a textual representation of a schema structure.

params.name: MinGroupValue
params.description: All sequences with a Group Value (the last 4 bytes of the 12-byte SequenceID) less than this value will be deleted, provided that the NumRecordsToKeep condition is also met.

params.name: NumRecordsToKeep
params.description: A numeric expression, specifying a minimum number of records that are to be kept for the tag.

params.name: ConnectionHandle
params.description: As returned by an HistorianConnect call.

params.name: TagName
params.description: A text string representing the desired table name. Engine code may modify this to conform with storage limitations.

params.name: Schema
params.description: A text expression describing the schema from which to retrieve data.

params.name: Data
params.description: A variable in which the data will be returned. This will be a two-dimensional array representing the returned data, indexed by [col][row]. If TPP is non-zero, the number of rows in the result set will equal the value of the NumEntries parameter. If TPP is zero there could be fewer rows than specified by NumEntries

params.name: FieldNames
params.description: Names of the fields. Typically "Value" for most tag values, or "Value!" for tag attribute data. (Value! was introduced with VTScada version 12 and is not available in legacy data. It cannot be retrieved by SQL queries.)

params.name: TPP
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the time span in seconds for each array entry. Each array element will contain the data which correspond exactly to this time period which corresponds to 0 or more data points. If TPP is positive and FieldNames selects a text value, the first entry which falls in a time is read and Mode is ignored. If TPP is equal to 0, the data is read and placed in the array on a one to one basis. If TPP is less than 0, an error will be returned.

params.name: StartTime
params.description: Timestamp in UTC. The report will include values matching and later than this time.

params.name: EndTime
params.description: Ending timestamp. Ignored if TPP is non-zero. The report will include values less than and matching this value.

params.name: NumEntries
params.description: Number of log entries in the array (numEntriesRequested - determined by Size or TPP parameters of Getlog) Use a negative value to retrieve values in reverse chronological order.

params.name: Modes
params.description: Optional numeric expression giving the method of handling the data. If TPP is greater than 0, the values that fall in each time span will be represented as follows: Mode Data Collection 0 Time-weighted average 1 Minimum in range 2 Maximum in range 3 Change in value over the range 4 Value at start of range 5 TimeOfMinInRange 6 TimeOfMaxInRange 7 SumOfZtoNZTransitions 8 SumOfNonZeroTime 9 Totalizer.  (Invalid is counted as zero) 10 Deprecated. Equivalent to mode 4. 11 Difference between the start and end values of a range (see following note) 12 Bitwise OR (see following note) 13 Bitwise AND (see following note) 14 Value at end of range Mode 11: This is for hardware that can count to a limited number, then rolls over to start a fresh count. For example, a tag that counts equipment starts, but which can only count from 0 to 15  before wrapping around to start again. This gives a value of sixteen per roll-over since there must be one more start after fifteen to have the roll-over occur. A graph of a very simple case where there is a start every second would look like the following: (Each rollover must be followed by a fresh start, not a gradually declining value. If there are a series of declining values then, because each is less than the previous, each counts as another rollover.) The formula used is (RolloverCount * RolloverValue) + (LastValidValue - FirstValidValue). Where, for any given time interval: Rollovers are counted when a new value is smaller than the last valid value. The RolloverValue is passed to the function in the parameter StaleTime. LastValidValue starts with the last valid value in the previous time interval (if any), and is updated with each new valid value within the time interval. FirstValidValue starts with the last valid value in the previous time interval (if any), and is updated with only the first valid value found in the current time span. Given this example, suppose that you want a count of starts in each thirty-second interval. In the first interval there is no previous valid value, one wrap-around and a last valid value of 12. (1*16) + (12 - 0) = 28. This is an idealized case. Consider a more realistic case where not all values are logged. (This may be due to factors such as polling intervals, deadbands, hardware, etc.) The following graph shows the same data where the orange dots represent values obtained and logged and the gray line represents what really happened: In the first 30 seconds there is one roll-over when the value drops from 13 to 2. The first value is 0 and the last is 11. The Historian will return 27: (1*16) + (11-0) = 27. The Historian will return 30 for the period from 30 to 60. The first valid value (carried from the previous period) is 11. The last valid value is 9 and there are two roll-overs. (2*16) + (9-11) = 30. Modes 12 and 13: These are intended to provide a summary of the bit-wise Historian value attributes within a query. (Value attributes were added in VTScada version 11.5 / 12.0) With mode 12, the first value is OR'd with zero, and each successive value in the time period is OR'd with result of the last comparison. From the result you will know whether any particular attribute bit was set on any values within the period. With mode 13, the first value is AND'd with a value having all bits set to 1 and each successive value is AND'd with the result of the last comparison. From the result you will know whether any particular attribute bit was set on all values within the period. In the case of modes 5 and 6, FieldName should still be set to indicate the field on which the mode is to act. The return values will be times indicating the maximum or minimum in that field for each time span. If TPP is less than or equal to 0, Mode is ignored. If the data is text, the first entry in a given time range is used for the array entry and Mode is ignored. It is possible to retrieve more than one mode in a single GetTagHistory statement. To do this, pass an array of values in as the Mode parameter.

params.name: ConnectionHandle
params.description: As returned by an HistorianConnect call.

params.name: InfoType
params.description: A numeric expression specifying the type of information to be returned, as follows: InfoType Information requested 0 Counters. A dictionary of dictionaries of dictionaries containing full counter information for all sequences stored by this Historian. 1 Errors. A dictionary of write or deletion errors that occurred in this Historian since the last time GetInfo(Historian, 1) was called. 2 Overall write queue count. The number of records in the write queue for all Historians (ConnectionHandle parameter is ignored). 3 Overall records stored. A rollover count of the records stored by all Historians (ConnectionHandle parameter is ignored). This counter rolls over (2^32) and therefore is only useful for performance diagnostics. It is not a count of all records in storage. 4 Write queue count. The number of records in the write queue for this Historian. 5 Records stored. A rollover count of the records stored by this Historian. This counter rolls over and therefore is only useful for performance diagnostics. It is not a count of all records in storage. 6 Overall write queue size. The approximate memory size of the write queue for all Historians (ConnectionHandle parameter is ignored).

params.name: ConnectionHandle
params.description: As returned by an HistorianConnect call.

params.name: TagName
params.description: A text string representing the desired table name. Engine code may modify this to conform with storage limitations.

params.name: Schema
params.description: This is a textual representation of a schema structure.

params.name: Data
params.description: A variable in which the values will be returned. This will be a single dimension array representing the Fields (columns). The entries in the array will be an array of values (all fields will be the same) and the size of one of these arrays gives the number of records (rows) in the result set.

params.name: Mid-S
params.description: A 64 bit binary token.

params.name: StartCounter
params.description: Starting counter number. Starts counting at 1 rather than zero.

params.name: EndCounter
params.description: Ending counter number. Starts counting at 1 rather than zero.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: FileDB or SQL DB error code returned. Defined error codes are provided in the reference chapter. See: Historian Error Codes

params.name: ConnectionHandle
params.description: As returned by an HistorianConnect call.

params.name: TagName
params.description: A text string representing the desired table name. Engine code may modify this to conform with storage limitations.

params.name: Schema
params.description: This is a textual representation of a schema structure.

params.name: Records
params.description: Array of data. This is a single dimension array representing the Fields (columns) to be written. Each entry in this array may be either a single data value or an array of values. If any entry is an array, then the size of the largest array gives the number of records (rows) to be written. If any individual field is underspecified, then a representation of INVALID is written for the missing values.

params.name: SequenceID
params.description: A 12-byte, binary token.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the left side coordinate of the scrollbar.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the top coordinate of the scrollbar.

params.name: Width
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the width of the scrollbar in pixels.

params.name: Steps
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the number of steps in the scrollbar.

params.name: PageLen
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of steps to jump per page.

params.name: Position
params.description: Optional numeric. This variable may be used to monitor or set the current scroll position.

params.name: StepSize
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression giving the number of lines to scroll through when the user clicks on an arrow. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

params.name: WindowObj
params.description: Used  by the Anywhere client. Enables redirection to the HScrollbar of horizontal panning over a given region. Required because on many touchscreens you cannot interact directly with the scrollbar therefore this object is needed to make it possible to scroll HScrollbar on those platforms.

params.name: URL
params.description: Full URL

params.name: pResponse
params.description: [OUT] Pointer set to a response structure when request completes

params.name: Username
params.description: Optional text. Self explanatory.

params.name: Password
params.description: Optional text. Self explanatory. The HTTP client supports both HTTP basic and digest authentication schemes

params.name: ExtraHeaders
params.description: Dictionary of extra HTTP headers where the dictionary key is used as the header name and its value as the header value

params.name: Method
params.description: Typically "POST" or "GET"; default GET

params.name: MessageBody
params.description: The "payload" of the HTTP message

params.name: ContentType
params.description: Meaningful only if MessageBody is valid; default "text/xml; charset="UTF-8""

params.name: TimeLimit
params.description: Time in seconds to wait for response; default 60

params.name: NConcurrent
params.description: Number of concurrent keep-alive connections to maintain per server-port; default 1

params.name: KeepAlive
params.description: TRUE to keep the connection alive; default TRUE

params.name: MessageOnly
params.description: TRUE to just send the message body; default FALSE

params.name: MaxSendRate
params.description: Optional numeric. the maximum number of requests to send per second to the host. Defaults to an unlimited rate if not specified. (See comments)

params.name: Left, Bottom, Right and Top
params.description: Are numeric expressions providing the bounds of the graphic to mark. The symbol will appear in the center of this area.

params.name: Period
params.description: A numeric expression setting the period (in seconds) at which the symbol is changed

params.name: Mode
params.description: A numeric expression indicating the symbol to display according to the following table Mode Symbol 0 Inhibit symbol display 1 Questionable Data symbol 2 Manual Data symbol 3 Questionable and Manual symbols 4 Error symbol 5+ User supplied symbols

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If false, nothing happens. If true, the action is performed, and any functions in the Trigger expression that may be reset are automatically reset.

params.name: Destination
params.description: Optional. Destination is not an expression, it is the text name of a state. If provided, it must be a legal name of a state in the module where this action is defined. It is not possible to change to a state in another module. Each object must have one (and only one) active state, unless the module has no states defined.

params.name: Condition
params.description: Required. An expression that returns TRUE or FALSE. If TRUE, the TRUECase is executed. If FALSE, the FALSECase is executed. If Invalid, neither case is executed.

params.name: TRUECase
params.description: Required. The expression (sometimes an Execute statement) that is executed when Condition is TRUE.

params.name: FALSECase
params.description: Required. The expression (sometimes an Execute statement) that is executed when the Condition is FALSE.

params.name: Condition
params.description: Required. An expression that will indicate whether the Expression parameters are executed. If this is true, the Expression parameters will be executed.

params.name: Expression1, Expression2, ...
params.description: Required. Any statements to be executed when Condition is true. Any number of Expression parameters may be listed. They are executed once in the order that they are listed.

params.name: Handle
params.description: Required. The image handle to copy and modify.

params.name: HorizontalSpacing
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the horizontal space between each tile.

params.name: VerticalSpacing
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the vertical space between each tile.

params.name: RowCount
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of tiles running vertically.

params.name: ColCount
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of tiles running horizontally.

params.name: Orientation
params.description: Optional numeric value between 0 and 15, specifying the orientation of the tiles. Defaults to zero. Orientation Value Meaning Orientation Value Meaning 0 No rotation, no flipping 8 No rotation, flip vertically 1 90-degree CW rotation without flipping 9 90-degree CW rotation and flip vertically 2 180-degree CW rotation without flipping 10 180-degree CW rotation and flip vertically 3 270-degree CW rotation without flipping 11 270-degree CWrotation and flip vertically 4 No rotation, flip horizontally. 12 No rotation, flip horizontally, then vertically 5 90-degree CW rotation and flip horizontally 13 90-degree CW rotation, flip horizontally, then vertically 6 180-degree CW rotation and flip horizontally 14 180-degree CW rotation, flip horizontally, then vertically 7 270-degree CWrotation and flip horizontally 15 270-degree CW rotation, flip horizontally, then vertically

params.name: CropLeft
params.description: Optional. Left coordinate of the cropping region. This and the following three parameters must all be specified if any are specified. Together, they apply a clipping rectangle that will be applied to the tiled image after tiling occurs.

params.name: CropTop
params.description: Optional. Top coordinate of the cropping region.

params.name: CropWidth
params.description: Optional. Width of the cropping region.

params.name: CropHeight
params.description: Optional. Height of the cropping region.

params.name: Tessellate
params.description: Optional Boolean. Defaults to FALSE (0). Optimizes drawing for a simple grid of images, but causes ImageArray to ignore spacing and transformation of the images. Does not improve the appearance of the result, but uses significantly less memory and may be marginally faster. The result may be clipped and stretched.

params.name: Filename
params.description: Required. The relative path and file name of the image

params.name: ColorMultiplier
params.description: Optional color value in the form aRGB A colour value, defined as four, two-digit hexadecimal values. Alpha - Red - Green - Blue. An Alpha value of FFis assumed if only the RGB values are provided. , used to apply a specific color to a gray-scale image.

params.name: Mirror
params.description: Optional Boolean. A logical value that can be set to 1 to reflect the image about the vertical axis. The default is no reflection (0).

params.name: AntiAlias
params.description: Optional numeric. This is a bit-wise parameter where Bit 0 controls whether anti-aliasing will be done when the image is stretched. Defaults to 1 (TRUE) if missing or invalid. By default, feathering will be applied to an anti-aliased image when it is stretched. Set bit 1 to 1 (TRUE) to suppress feathering.

params.name: RotateAngle
params.description: Optional floating point value, specifying the clockwise rotation in degrees to be applied when the image is drawn.

params.name: Opacity
params.description: Optional numeric expression for a  multiplier to the transparency (alpha value) of every color in the image. Range 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque). Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: Lightness
params.description: Optional numeric expression that is a  multiplier to the brightness of the image. Range 0+. Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: Contrast
params.description: Optional numeric expression to enhance the differences between the colors in the image. Range 0+. Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: Hue
params.description: Optional numeric expression for the hue rotation to apply to all of the colors in the image. Range -180 to 180. The default is no hue rotation, (0).

params.name: Saturation
params.description: Optional numeric expression that is a multiplier to the intensity of each primary color component of every color in the image. Range: 0+. Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: ColorizeIntensity
params.description: Optional numeric expression for the intensity of the added color. Zero means that no color is added. Range 0-255. Defaults to 0 if missing or invalid.

params.name: ColorizeHue
params.description: Optional numeric expression for the hue value of a color to be mixed with every color in the image. Range -180 to 180. Defaults to 0 if missing or invalid.

params.name: Handle
params.description: Required. The image handle to copy and modify.

params.name: Count
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of tiles to draw.

params.name: Radius
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the natural radius of the short axis of the ellipse, used to determine scaling.

params.name: StartAngle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the angle at which the first tile is to be drawn. The range -180 to 180. The start point is the vertical axis. Angles are positive, counter-clockwise..

params.name: EndAngle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the angle at which the last tile is to be drawn. Range -180 to 180, start point is the vertical axis, angles are positive counter-clockwise..

params.name: CropLeft
params.description: Optional. Left coordinate of the cropping region. This and the following three parameters must all be specified if any are specified. Together, they apply a clipping rectangle that will be applied to the tiled image after tiling occurs.

params.name: CropTop
params.description: Optional. Top coordinate of the cropping region.

params.name: CropWidth
params.description: Optional. Width of the cropping region.

params.name: CropHeight
params.description: Optional. Height of the cropping region.

params.name: SourceModule
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module from which the API-class constants should be imported.

params.name: DestinationModule
params.description: An optional expression, giving the module that the API-class constants should be imported into. Used only if the constants are not being imported into the current module.

params.name: CSP
params.description: Required. The handle to the CSP which is receive the imported key.

params.name: BlobType
params.description: Required. A parameter specifying the type of key BLOB to be imported. Values are defined in WinCrypt.h

params.name: KeyBLOB
params.description: Required. Text string containing the KeyBLOB to be imported.

params.name: EncryptKey
params.description: An optional parameter containing a Key handle for a key to be used to encrypt the exported key so that it may only be encrypted by the destination user. If omitted or invalid, then the value NULL is used.

params.name: Flags
params.description: An optional parameter specifying the flags to be passed to CryptExportKey. If omitted or invalid then the value 0 is used.

params.name: Error
