params.description: An optional variable in which the error code for the function is returned. It may have the following values: Error Meaning 0 Key successfully imported. 1 CSP, BlobType or KeyBLOB parameters invalid. X Any other value is an error from CryptImportKey.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which specifies which I/O port to read. Port must be in the range 0 to 65535

params.name: Array
params.description: Required. Any variable whose value is invalid or contains a dynamically allocated array (one created via a New function call). This should be a single dimension array or unexpected results may occur.

params.name: Index
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression for the index at which to insert a new element. If this value is invalid, the new element will be inserted at the end of the array.

params.name: Value
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression for the value to assign to the new array element.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any text expression that specifies the fixed module to limit. It must be in the current scope. Scope resolution operators ( \ ) are not permitted. If the module does not exist, nothing is done. If the module is not a fixed module, the return value is -1.

params.name: Count
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that specifies the number of fixed module instances allowed to run simultaneously. If Count is in the range 1 to 2, 147,483,647, the new limit is set and the old limit is returned. If Count is 0, the limit is not changed, but the current limit is returned. Count is ignored if the module is not a queued module.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. Normally this is a floating point value.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the value to integrate with respect to time.

params.name: Time
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the maximum time in seconds between integral function updates.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that gives the I/O address. Port must be in the range 0 to 65535.

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of one side of the object and its label. The smaller of X1 and X2 will always be to the left

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the object. The smaller of Y1 and Y2 will always be the top.

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the object and its label opposite to X1.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the top or bottom of the object, whichever is the opposite to Y1.

params.name: AddressList
params.description: Required. The array of IP addresses to display / the array of IP addresses returned.

params.name: BaseFocusID
params.description: Required. Reserves 10 focus ID values beginning at the value provided. Set to zero to disable user input.

params.name: Title
params.description: Optional. Any text expression to use as the title for the field. No default value

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Optional. Any logical expression. If TRUE, a bevel is drawn around the graphic. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: Optional. Any logical value. If TRUE then title affects alignment

params.name: ListBGndColor
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression setting a background color for the list. No default value.

params.name: OverlayCallback
params.description: Optional module value. Called from the listbox. No default value.

params.name: MaskSet
params.description: Required. A "maskset", generated by one ore more calls to MakeIPMask

params.name: MaskSetIndex
params.description: Optional numeric. Specifies the index into MaskSet to use, in the case where MaskSet has more than one mask and you want a mask other than the first one. Often obtained from a call to CheckIPMask. Defaults to zero.

params.name: AlarmName
params.description: Required. Unique name for the alarm. Typically the unique ID, which can be obtained using GetAlarmName . If there are multiple built-in alarms in a tag, the convention is to concatenate the UniqueID with a separator and a unique integer or string per alarm. For example, Concat(Root\UniqueID, \AlarmSeparatorString, 0).

params.name: InclShelving
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, a shelved alarm will be reported here as inactive, regardless of its status. Defaults to TRUE. In most cases, shelving an alarm is considered the same as masking the Active status to FALSE. (Makes it look like inactive, regardless of what it actually is.) For the rare use cases where shelving is to be ignored, the IncludeShelving parameter can be set to FALSE

params.name: Child
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns an object or module value.

params.name: Parent
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns an object or module value.

params.name: ServiceName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name by which the service is known.

params.name: Workstation
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name or IP address by which the workstation is known to the RPC Manager.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: Any optional parameter that provides the GUID for the application in which the service instance is located. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: Parm1
params.description: Required. Any value, to be compared to parameter 2.

params.name: Parm2
params.description: Required. Any value, to be compared to parameter 1.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any value to be tested.

params.name: AlarmName
params.description: Required. Unique name for the alarm. Typically the unique ID, which can be obtained using GetAlarmName . If there are multiple built-in alarms in a tag, the convention is to concatenate the UniqueID with a separator and a unique integer or string per alarm. For example, Concat(Root\UniqueID, \AlarmSeparatorString, 0).

params.name: Name1
params.description: Required. Any of the names or IPs by which the first workstation is known to the RPC Manager.

params.name: Name2
params.description: Required. Any of the names or IPs by which the second workstation is known to the RPC Manager.

params.name: ServiceName
params.description: Required. The name by which the service is known.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: Any optional parameter that provides the GUID of the application in which the service instance is located. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: ServiceName
params.description: Required. The name by which the service is known.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: Any optional parameter that provides the GUID of the application in which the service instance is known. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: Program
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the program name to test (with or without the .EXE extension).

params.name: ServiceName
params.description: Required. The name by which the service is known.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: Required. Any optional parameter that provides the GUID of the application in which the service instance is known. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: AlarmName
params.description: Required. Unique name for the alarm. Typically the unique ID, which can be obtained using GetAlarmName . If there are multiple built-in alarms in a tag, the convention is to concatenate the UniqueID with a separator and a unique integer or string per alarm. For example, Concat(Root\UniqueID, \AlarmSeparatorString, 0).

params.name: AlarmName
params.description: Required. Unique name for the alarm. Typically the unique ID, which can be obtained using GetAlarmName . If there are multiple built-in alarms in a tag, the convention is to concatenate the UniqueID with a separator and a unique integer or string per alarm. For example, Concat(Root\UniqueID, \AlarmSeparatorString, 0).

params.name: TagObj
params.description: Required object value. The tag to be examined.

params.name: AlarmName
params.description: Required. Unique name for the alarm. Typically the unique ID, which can be obtained using GetAlarmName . If there are multiple built-in alarms in a tag, the convention is to concatenate the UniqueID with a separator and a unique integer or string per alarm. For example, Concat(Root\UniqueID, \AlarmSeparatorString, 0).

params.name: InclShelving
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, a shelved alarm will be reported here as non-acknowledged, regardless of its status. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: IsAnwhere
params.description: Optional Boolean. When set TRUE, makes IsVICSession only return true if the session is an Anywhere client session. When FALSE (0), the function returns true if the client is either a VIC or an Anywhere client. Defaults to 0.

params.name: StringArray
params.description: Required. One-dimensional array  containing text elements to be joined into a string. Numeric elements will be treated as strings.

params.name: Delimiter
params.description: Optional text. The character (or characters) to be inserted between array elements in the output string. Defaults to "".

params.name: Count
params.description: Optional integer. If provided, then no more than Count array elements will be used in the resulting string.

params.name: InputValue
params.description: Required. Any value to be encoded as JSON. Text is expected to use UTF-8 encoding.

params.name: PrettyPrint
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, the output will have white space and line breaks added for presentation. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Alphabetical
params.description: Optional Boolean.  If TRUE, dictionaries will be listed alphabetically. If FALSE, dictionaries will be listed chronologically. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Indent
params.description: Optional numeric. Ignored if PrettyPrint is FALSE. Sets the number of spaces to indent the encoding when PrettyPrint is TRUE.

params.name: StreamVar
params.description: Optional. If a valid stream is provided, the JSON encoded string will be appended to that stream and returned. The default is for JSONEncode to return a text string.

params.name: Input
params.description: Required. Any stream expression for the socket. If this isn't a socket stream, invalid is returned.

params.name: PrettyPrint
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, the output will have white space and line breaks added for presentation. Default to FALSE.

params.name: JSONInputText
params.description: Required.  JSON text to be parsed.

params.name: ErrorMessageOut
params.description: Optional text. Output parameter that is set to a text representation of the error. If recoverable parsing errors occur, this may be set in addition to the return value being valid. If for example an array of strings has one string that cannot be displayed in the system's configured code page, only that element of the VTScada array will be invalid and the ErrorMessageOut text will reflect this.

params.name: ObjectsAsStructures
params.description: Optional Boolean. If this parameter is TRUE, JSON objects will be created as VTScada structures for compatibility with XMLParse(). If this is not specified or is false, JSON objects will be translated into VTScada dictionaries. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Option
params.description: Any logical expression. If true, the number of non-edited keystrokes is returned; if false, the edited keystrokes is returned.

params.name: Object
params.description: Any expression that returns an object value that defines a window.

params.name: String
params.description: Any text expression that gives the characters to place in the window's keyboard buffer.

params.name: N
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the number of keys to get.

params.name: Option
params.description: Any logical expression indicating whether edited mode or non-edited mode should be used. Set to TRUE for the non-edited mode.

params.name: Stream
params.description: The socket stream to which data will be written.

params.name: Source
params.description: A stream or text value containing the data to write.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object value expression that defines the window where the selected items are found.

params.name: Set
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. When TRUE (i.e. not equal to 0), the latch is set.

params.name: Reset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. When TRUE (i.e. not equal to 0), the latch is reset.

params.name: \Launchee
params.description: Required. A module pointer or a text expression giving the module to run. See Comments If this parameter is a module value that has been returned from a LoadModule or FindVariable statement, that module will be launched. If this parameter is type text it may either designate the module by its name, if it is in scope, or it may give the name of a variable that contains the module value of the module to launch.

params.name: Parent
params.description: Required. The object value of the module where the Launchee is to resolve its global variable references. If a valid non-object value is supplied the Launchee will resolve its global variable references to the scope defined by the first parameter. If this is invalid, the module will still run, but global references will be invalid.

params.name: Caller
params.description: Required. . This specifies the module instance (object) where the Launchee acts as if it were called from there. If this is invalid, the module will still run but will not stop without a Slay. A Return in the case of a subroutine. If it is valid, the module will stop when the Caller module instance stops, when a Slay is executed upon it, or (subroutine only) when it calls Return. Often, the object value of the window to draw within.

params.name: P1, P2, ...
params.description: Optional. Are any expressions that will be supplied as parameters to the launched module.

params.name: IsRestart
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE if the application is to be re-started.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. The variable whose numeric value will be limited.

params.name: Low
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the lower limit for the value X.

params.name: High
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the upper limit for the value X.

params.name: Style
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Line Types . Valid line styles are from 1 to 5 inclusive. A line style of 1 is a solid line

params.name: Width
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the width of the line in units of X screen coordinates. The width is always rounded to result in an odd number of pixels on the screen. The minimum width displayed will be 1 pixel.

params.name: Color
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the VTScada Color Palette of the line.

params.name: Curvature
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the radius of curvature of the corners for the line. This is specified in units of X screen coordinates. If the number of endpoints is 2, Curvature is ignored.

params.name: X1, Y1, X2, Y2, ...
params.description: Required. Any numeric expressions giving the screen coordinates of the line endpoints.

params.name: DataSource
params.description: Required. A Tag name, constant or expression that provides the value to show.

params.name: IndicatorImage
params.description: Required. The full path to the name of an image file to use as the indicator. Typically this is an image of a needle.

params.name: Orientation
params.description: A flag indicating the orientation of the Indicator. Set to 0 for Horizontal and 1 for Vertical. The default is 0 (Horizontal).

params.name: DrawMode
params.description: Controls how the indicator is drawn. Details of the 3 modes are as follows DrawMode Meaning 0 Scaled. This mode will scale the Indicator image from the 0 position to the position that represents the current value of the DataSource. 1 Cropped. This mode will scale the indicator image from the 0 position to the full position and then crop it to the position that represents the current value of the DataSource. 2 Moving This mode will keep the Indicator image at a constant size and simply move it to the position that represents the current value of the DataSource.

params.name: TagName
params.description: Required. The name of the Tag to use for scaling. If no tag is specified, then tag scaling cannot be used to automatically obtain the minimum and maximum scale values.

params.name: Orientation
params.description: A flag indicating the orientation of the legend. Set to 0 for horizontal and 1 for vertical. The default is 0 (Horizontal).

params.name: NumLabels
params.description: The number of Labels to show. The default is 3.

params.name: Font
params.description: The name of a Font tag to use for the legend text.

params.name: Color
params.description: A color index for the color of the legend text. The default is 0 (black).

params.name: Reserved  n/a
params.description: For use at a later time. Should be set to 0.

params.name: UseTagScaling
params.description: A flag that indicates whether to use the supplied tagâs scaling values. The default is false.

params.name: MinScaleValue
params.description: The minimum scale value to use if the UseTagScaling flag is not true. The default is 0.

params.name: MaxScaleValue
params.description: The maximum scale value to use if the UseTagScaling flag is not true. The default is 100.

params.name: AlarmObject
params.description: Required. The object value for the alarm that was passed to the Register subroutine.

params.name: EventTime
params.description: The time stamp to use when adding this event to the alarm lists. If invalid, the default is CurrentTime().

params.name: List
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of the list to which to add the alarm.

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of one side of the Listbox, usually the left side.

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the Listbox, usually bottom.

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the Listbox opposite to X1, usually the right side.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the top or bottom of the Listbox, whichever is the opposite of Y1, usually the bottom.

params.name: Data
params.description: Required. An array of data to display in the Listbox.

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. The index of the highlighted item (i.e. any variable whose value will be set to the index of the chosen item (highlight).) If Multi is true, this will be the index of the last chosen item.

params.name: Picked
params.description: An optional parameter that may be a variable whose value is set to true (1) when an item is chosen in the Listbox. The setting of Index by an external source will not trigger Picked. If this information is not required and the next parameter is used, a value of invalid or a constant may be substituted.

params.name: Flat
params.description: Obsolete.

params.name: DoubleClick
params.description: An optional parameter that may be a variable whose value is set to true (1) when an item has been double clicked upon. If this information is not required and the next parameter is used, a value of invalid or a constant may be substituted.

params.name: MaxLen
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression giving the maximum length of the list. If omitted or invalid, the maximum list length is given by the size of the array Data.

params.name: RightClick
params.description: An optional parameter that may be a variable whose value is set to true (1) when an item is selected with the right mouse button. If this information is not required and the next parameter is used, a value of invalid or a constant may be substituted.

params.name: PostIt
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0), a tool tip will be displayed if the text in the list box has been truncated at its right edge. The default is true.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression from 0 to 32767 for the focus number of this graphic. If this value is zero, the list box will not accept keyboard input, but mouse input will still be recognized. If it is less than zero, the Listbox will not accept any input and will appear grayed out. The default value is 1.

params.name: Multi
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0), multiple items may be selected in the list. The default is false.

params.name: PickList
params.description: An optional parameter that is a variable whose value is set to the list of items selected if Multi is true (1). If invalid, no items are selected. This variable may initially be set to a dynamically allocated array (one created with the New function) containing items to be highlighted/selected upon the startup of the listbox.

params.name: ColWidths
params.description: An optional parameter that indicates the starting widths for multiple columns.

params.name: ColLabels
params.description: An optional parameter that provides an array of labels for the columns.

params.name: ColDivider
params.description: An optional parameter that indicates the type of divider to appear between columns. No border appears if the list is a single column. ColDivider may have one of the following values: The default is "2". ColDivider Divider Type 0 No column divider shown. 1 Show a non-moveable column divider. 2 Show a moveable column divider.

params.name: UseMachineStore
params.description: Required Boolean. If TRUE, enumerates certificates from the Personal store in the Local Computer's certificate collection. If FALSE enumerates certificates from the Personal store of the Current User.

params.name: StoreName
params.description: Required text. The name of the certificate store to list.

params.name: ExtendedKeyUsage
params.description: Optional text. If valid, this must be an Object Identifier (OID) for an extended key usage. This allows you to filter the returned list of certificates by extended key usage (EKU). For example, "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1" is the OID for an EKU allowing server authentication.

params.name: Issuer
params.description: Optional text. If valid, specifies the name of a certificate issuer. This allows you to filter the returned list of certificates by issuer.

params.name: RequirePrivateKey
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, only returns certificates for which you hold a private key. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code value of the module.

params.name: Dictionary
params.description: Required. The name of the dictionary.

params.name: Order
params.description: An optional numeric expression. Defines the search according to the following table of values. Defaults to 0 if missing or invalid Order Meaning 0 List in forward alphabetic order. 1 Ordered by when the keys were added to the dictionary with the oldest key first. 2 List in backward alphabetic order 3 Ordered by when the keys were added to the dictionary with the newest key first. 4 Sparse Numeric. Keys must be numeric. Used to return a sparse array in order based on the key values.

params.name: AlarmObject
params.description: Required. The object value for the alarm that was passed to the Register subroutine.

params.name: EventTime
params.description: The time stamp to use when adding this event to the alarm lists. If invalid, the default is CurrentTime().

params.name: List
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of the list from which to remove the alarm.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any module or object value. This identifies the module where the variable list begins.

params.name: Name
params.description: Required. Any text value, which specifies a name to match when listing. Wildcards are allowed. The wildcard "?" will match any character in a name. The wildcard "*" will match any series of characters. The backslash character has special meaning, in that it can be added in front of the characters *, ? or \ to search for these characters explicitly. In these three cases, the leading backslash will be ignored. Other characters must match exactly. A leading backslash in front of any characters other than the three noted will be included in the search.

params.name: LowClass
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. This specifies the lowest class included in the list. Valid range is 0 to 65535. Default class for variables is 0. See also: Variable Classes.

params.name: HighClass
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. This specifies the highest class included in the list. Valid range is 0 to 65535. Default class for variables is 0.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that specifies the type of variable to match, as found by adding together values in the following table: (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations ) Type Bit No. Variable Type 0 - Match all 1 0 Normal 2 1 Array 4 2 Parameter 8 3 Module

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. The value must be strictly greater than 0 for the result to be valid.

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the file name of the DLL to load. If the path is not specified, the standard Windows search pattern for DLLs will be used. Windows applications that load DLL's without using a fully qualified pathname are vulnerable to DLL hijacking where an attacker can place a malicious copy of the DLL in the search path. Take care to specify the path in all cases.

params.name: VICRemoted
params.description: (Optional). A parameter that indicates whether the handle returned by LoadDLL will be remoted to the VIC. If VICRemoted is a valid, non-zero, positive integer, and the LoadDLL function is being executed in a module instance that is within a VIC session, then all DLL calls using the handle that LoadDLL returns will be remoted to the VIC. Whether the LoadDLL is in a VIC session is determined by the call tree from the module instance running the LoadDLL call. The root of the call tree must be an instance of BrowserClient. In practical terms, this means that you cannot expect session-aware DLL calls to function if you explicitly launch a module with a caller other than a module instance within the VIC session tree. Defaults to 0 if not otherwise specified.

params.name: MIBPath
params.description: Required. A path to any single MIB or a directory containing MIBs (possibly in further subdirectories). The returned MIB dictionary will also include those elements of the base MIBs found in <VTSInstallDir>\MIBS that are referenced in the MIB found in MIBPath. If Invalid, then the returned MIB dictionary will only include the base MIBS.

params.name: SubIDIndexing
params.description: An optional Boolean expression. If TRUE, then items in the returned MIB dictionary are keyed by numeric portion of the OID for that element. If FALSE, then the items are keyed by the label for the element. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: LoadDescriptions
params.description: An optional Boolean expression. If TRUE, then the returned MIB dictionary will contain any description for the element (which may be lengthy). If FALSE, then no description is loaded. The default is TRUE.

params.name: ErrorOut
params.description: An optional variable into which any errors found in parsing the MIBs will be returned. Will take the form of a linked list of error message structures. The message structure will contain two fields: Error, containing the error text and Next containing the next error message structure, if any.

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the .RUN file from which to load the module.

params.name: Library
params.description: Required. Any module value that indicates the library module to which the loaded module will belong.

params.name: ModuleName
params.description: An optional parameter that is the text expression giving the module's name. This name will then be associated with the module when it is displayed in certain situations, such as in the debugger and the module tree diagram. If this parameter is invalid, the module will appear as "System" when its name is displayed.

params.name: LoadNow
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0), the module and its entire sub-tree are loaded immediately. If false (0), the module and its subtree are loaded on demand. The default is false.

params.name: AppGUID
params.description: An optional parameter that should be included and hold the text GUID of the application when the LoadModule is loading an application.

params.name: Reserved
params.description: Should be set to Invalid if provided.

params.name: TestCodeLoad
params.description: An optional parameter that has been reserved for use by the Test Framework to indicate that the LoadModule is loading actual code to be run. It can contain any Boolean expression that evaluates to TRUE to indicate that the code to run is being loaded.

params.name: Group
params.description: Required. The group parameter, which is a value from 0 to 5. These values are defined in the following table: Group Local Group 0 Administrators 1 Backup Operators 2 Guests 3 Power Users 4 Replicator 5 Users

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value where Member may be found.

params.name: Member
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the member name.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. The text expression to search.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the buffer offset (in characters or bytes), from which to start searching (i.e. to start at the beginning of the buffer, set this parameter to 0).

params.name: Search
params.description: Required. Any text expression for which to search.

params.name: Method
params.description: An optional numeric expression that controls how the Search parameter is interpreted as per the following table. The default value for Method is "0". Method Description 0 Treat Search as the exact string for which to search (strstr). 1 Treat Search as the case-insensitive string for which to search (stristr). 2 Treat Search as a set of characters to match against (strpbrk). 3 Treat Search as a case-insensitive set of characters to match against.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns an object value of a window or an object within a window whose coordinate system is to be used for locator coordinate reports until capture is released.

params.name: Enable
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true (non-0), the locator input will be captured by the window containing the module expressed by Object. If false (0), the locator capture is yielded.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. The value must be strictly greater than 0 for the result to be valid.

params.name: Severity
params.description: Required. A numeric code indicating the type of event to log. Severity can be one of: Severity Event 0 Informational 1 Warning 2 Error 3 Audit Success (Security Event) 4 Audit Failure (Security Event)

params.name: ArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting index for the array operation. The index for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be examined

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to compute. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: Match
params.description: Required. Any value of any type to look for in the array. In the case of text, the search is case sensitive. If this value is invalid, the return value will also be invalid.

params.name: CaseInsensitive
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) and the array contains text strings, the comparison will not be case sensitive. If false (0), the comparison will be case sensitive for text strings. The default is false.

params.name: Expr
params.description: Required. Any expression.

params.name: AlarmRecord
params.description: Required An Alarm Record Structure to be used as the basis for voice file generation

params.name: pVoiceFilename
params.description: Required text. (Pointer) Holds the voice filename - Return variable.

params.name: pVoiceLength
params.description: Required numeric. (Pointer) Holds the length of the voice file in seconds - Return variable.

params.name: pVoiceReady
params.description: Required Boolean (Pointer) Set to TRUE when voice file generation is complete - Return variable.

params.name: Template
params.description: Optional text. Speech template. (See More Information... later in this topic)

params.name: pError
params.description: Optional Boolean (Pointer) Error pointer - Return variable.

params.name: Elem1, Elem2
params.description: Elements for the new array

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the file containing the image. A known path Known Path Aliases for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: Transparent1
params.description: An optional parameter giving the first color value to make transparent. Any of the following may be used: a palette index VTScada Color Palette a system color (constant) an RGB string in the format, "<RRGGBB>" If this value is negative 1 (-1), this parameter is ignored and no first color is made transparent.

params.name: Length
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the length (number of bytes) of the buffer to create. This value must be between 0 and 0x7FFFFFFF.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the initial value from the ASCII Character Set for every byte in the new buffer (see "ASCII Character Set"). It must be in the range 0 to 255.

params.name: PhoneNumber
params.description: Any text expression for the phone number to be called. If required, this may be the canonical international format.

params.name: Baud
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the baud rate to be used on the modem connection. The baud rate must be in the range of 0 to 115200, and must divide evenly into 115200 with no more than a 2.5% error. The value of "0" has special significance. This corresponds to the maximum baud rate available for the particular device. See Baud Rate.

params.name: DataBits
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the number of data bits per character to be used on the modem connection. DataBits must be 5, 6, 7, or 8.

params.name: StopBits
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the number of stop bits per character to be used on the modem connection. StopBits must be 1 or 2.

params.name: Parity
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the parity checking to be used on the modem connection. This may be one of: Value Parity 0 No parity 1 Odd parity 2 Even parity 3 0 Stick (space parity) 4 1 Stick (mark parity)

params.name: Opcode
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the opcode of the DAG to construct.

params.name: Parms
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that indicates the number of additional parameters to be included in the new DAG. This is normally 0, except in cases such as a new FWrite DAG.

params.name: Key1
params.description: The first key of the dictionary

params.name: Value1
params.description: Value for that key

params.name: OldMaskSet
params.description: Required. The result of previous calls to this method, or Invalid when starting afresh.

params.name: IPAddress
params.description: Required. This can be a single IP address, in which case the Mask parameter will be used if valid, OR an IP subnet address. IPv4 and IPv6 both have their subnet representations and either is acceptable here, as are IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses.

params.name: Mask
params.description: Optional text. An optional IP mask, used as an alternative way of specifying a subnet range, in conjunction with a non-CIDR IPv4 or IPv6 second parameter.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for the variable value. This value is typically returned from a FindVariable or an AddVariable call.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for the variable value. This value is typically returned from a FindVariable or an AddVariable call.

params.name: PhraseID
params.description: Required text. The key for a parameterized phrase.

params.name: P1
params.description: Required text. By definition, a parameterized phrase requires at least one parameter.

params.name: P2 - P10
params.description: Optional text. A parameterized phrase can have up to 10 parameters.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for the variable value. This value is typically returned from a FindVariable or an AddVariable call.

params.name: Size
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of bytes of storage allocated in the .VAL persistent variable file for this variable. For array types, set this to the byte size of the largest array element (normally 8 bytes for numeric values). For arrays containing text, enter the character length of the longest string element.

params.name: MachineStore
params.description: Required Boolean. If TRUE (non-zero) attempts to find the certificate in a store in the Local Computer certificate hive. If FALSE (zero) attempts to find a certificate in a store in the Current User certificate hive.

params.name: StoreName
params.description: Required text. The name of the store in which to search for the certificate.

params.name: Subject
params.description: Required text. The subject that will be written into the certificate.

params.name: KeyAlgorithm
params.description: Optional text. The name of the algorithm used with the public / private key pair and to sign the certificate.

params.name: HashAlgorithm
params.description: Optional text. The name of the algorithm used to hash the certificate prior to signing.

params.name: ValidityPeriod
params.description: Optional numeric. The number of days for which the new certificate will be valid.

params.name: KeyStrength
params.description: Optional numeric. The key strength in bits.

params.name: KeyUsage
params.description: Optional numeric. The permitted usages for the private / public key pair.

params.name: EKU
params.description: Optional text or array of text values. The Extended Key Usages permitted for the private / public key pair.

params.name: SAN
params.description: Optional text or array of text values. A set of Subject Alternative Names to be written into the certificate.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for the variable value. This value is typically returned from a FindVariable or an AddVariable call.

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required. Any string to be turned into a valid file name.

params.name: Latitude
params.description: Optional numeric expression specifying the Y-axis center of the map.  If not provided, the calculated center of all sites to be drawn on the map will be used.

params.name: Longitude
params.description:
Optional numeric expression specifying the X-axis center of the map.  If not provided, the calculated center of all sites to be drawn on the map will be used.  

If there are no sites to display on the map, the initial display will be centered on North America.

params.name: Sites
params.description: Optional array of sites to display.  Each site item in the array must be a structure, containing valid pointers for latitude, longitude and a callback object.  See comments.

params.name: InitZoom
params.description: Optional numeric expression, specifying the initial zoom factor to use for the map. Ranges from 2 to 18.  If not specified, the maximum zoom level (smallest area) that encompasses all the sites will be used.

params.name: MinZoom
params.description: Optional numeric expression, setting the lowest permitted zoom level (corresponding to the set of the largest tiles to be used, in the sense of maximum displayed area per tile).

params.name: MaxZoom
params.description: Optional numeric expression, setting the greatest permitted zoom level (corresponding to the set of the smallest tiles to be used, in the sense of minimum displayed area per tile).

params.name: UserInput
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set FALSE to disable user input. Affects only the map, not pins on the map. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: DisableTools
params.description: Optional bit-wise value controlling which tools are disabled. Default to zero - all tools enabled. (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations ) Bit # Tool disabled 0 Zoom tools 1 Reset tool 2 Style tool
Reserved

params.name: Enable
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that enables the function. Testing of keyboard input is enabled when this parameter is true (i.e. not 0). If it is 0 (false), then the function's value is false. In addition, the Enable parameter controls the type of comparison done. If the Enable is 1, a case-sensitive match is made. If the Enable is 2, then the match is not case-sensitive. (Any non-zero value other than 2 will cause a case-sensitive match. The use of 1 and 2 is recommended for clarity.)

params.name: Keys
params.description: Required. A text expression giving the key sequence to watch for. The case of individual letters may be significant, depending on the Enable parameter. To generate extended keys that are not already available as constants defined in the system layer, use MakeBuff to turn the character code(s) into a text expression. For example: PageUp  = Concat(MakeBuff(1, 253), MakeBuff(1, 0x49)); F2        = Concat(MakeBuff(1,253), MakeBuff(1,60)); F3        = Concat(MakeBuff(1,253), MakeBuff(1,61)); CtrlZKey  = MakeBuff(1, 26);

params.name: Parm1, Parm2, Parm3, ...
params.description: Required. Any number of parameters giving any numeric expressions, from which a maximum value will be selected.

params.name: Code
params.description: Required. The code value in which the module call is embedded.

params.name: Code
params.description: Required. The code value in which the module call is embedded.

params.name: ArrayStart
params.description: Required. Any numeric array element giving the starting element of the array. The index for the array may be any numeric expression and specifies the starting point for the array search. If processing a multi-dimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be examined.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to use starting at the element given by the first parameter. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: Address
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the RAM address to read. This may be specified using the @ operator.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the type of read to perform. Type Read Type 0 Read 8 bit byte 1 Read 16 bit word 2 Read 32 bit long word

params.name: Reserved
params.description: Leave blank or set to Invalid if using the second parameter.

params.name: JustThisBubble
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set to TRUE to get just the memory use for the current bubble. FALSE (the default) gets the global memory use across all of VTScada.

params.name: Address
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that gives the RAM address to write. This may be specified using the @ operator.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the type of write: Type Write Type 0 Write 8 bit byte 1 Write 16 bit word 2 Write 32 bit long word

params.name: Tracefile
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the name of the file to generate.

params.name: Lowstamp
params.description: Required. The low timestamp range specifier. Defaults to 0 if Invalid.

params.name: Highstamp
params.description: Required. The high timestamp range specifier. Defaults to 1E99 if Invalid.

params.name: Lowsize
params.description: Required. The low size range specifier. Defaults to 0 if Invalid.

params.name: Highsize
params.description: Required. The low size range specifier. Defaults to 0xFFFFFFFF if Invalid.

params.name: LowID
params.description: Required. The low caller id range specifier. Defaults to 0x0000 if Invalid.

params.name: HighID
params.description: Required. The high caller id range specifier. Defaults to 4096 if Invalid.

params.name: Done
params.description: Required. A return variable, which will be set TRUE after the memory trace file has been written. MemTrace is a threaded function.

params.name: AppendMode
params.description: Optional Boolean. When TRUE, causes the function to skip writing the output file's header and appends to the output file rather than rewriting it. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: SourceBuff
params.description: Required. The buffer or stream to be modified.

params.name: DiffBuff
params.description: Required. The buffer or stream containing formatted instructions for how to modify the source buffer.

params.name: Source
params.description: Required. Buffer or stream to be modified                      .

params.name: Diff1
params.description:
Required. Buffer or stream containing the first set of Diffs for
                        modifying "SourceBuff"

params.name: Diff2
params.description:
Required.Buffer or stream containing the second set of Diffs for
                        modifying "SourceBuff"

params.name: pConflict1
params.description:
Optional, pointer to a dictionary of conflicting
                        records of Diff1

params.name: pConflict2
params.description:
Optional, pointer to a dictionary of conflicting
                        records of Diff2

params.name: pDiffStream
params.description:
Optional, pointer to a stream contains all
                        non-conflicting records from Diff1 and Diff2.

params.name: Dictionary
params.description: Required. A variable name that will become the dictionary.

params.name: Key
params.description: Required. A text value. Integers may be used, but will be cast to text. This will become the first key within the dictionary.

params.name: Case
params.description: An optional Boolean, controlling whether the dictionary will use case sensitive keys or non case sensitive. TRUE (default) defines a non-case sensitive key. FALSE defines case sensitive.

params.name: Parm1, Parm2, Parm3, ...
params.description: Required. Any number of parameters, giving any numeric expressions, from which a minimum value will be selected.

params.name: Name
params.description: Required. Any text expression which is the full path name of the directory to create. A known path Known Path Aliases for File-Related Functions for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: ModemStream
params.description: Required. The connected modem stream (returned from a ModemStream or ModemDial function call).

params.name: DeviceName
params.description: Required. A text value describing the device whose identifier is required. Only "wave/out" is supported.

params.name: Modem
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression giving the modem number between 1 and the number of modems in the system (the return from ModemCount), or a modem stream opened via the ModemStream function.

params.name: PhoneNumber
params.description: Required. Any text expression specifying the phone number to dial. It can contain any of the special dialing characters that Windows Ã allows. If this parameter is invalid a pass-through connection will be obtained.

params.name: ReceiveLen
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the size of the receive buffer for the serial stream in bytes. ReceiveLen must be in the range 2 to 32 766. If more bytes are received than can fit in the receive buffer before the application removes them, the additional data will be lost.

params.name: TransmitLen
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the size of the transmit buffer for the serial stream in bytes. TransmitLen must be in the range 2 to 32 766. The buffer must be large enough to hold the maximum number of bytes pending transmission at any instance.

params.name: MinBaud
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the minimum baud rate which will be acceptable on the modem connection. The baud rate at which the connection is made may actually be higher than this value but may not exceed MaxBaud. The baud rate must be in the range 0 to 115,200, and must divide evenly into 115,200 with no more than 2.5% error. The value of 0 has special significance. This corresponds to the maximum baud rate available for the particular device.

params.name: MaxBaud
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the maximum baud rate which will be acceptable on the modem connection. The baud rate at which the connection is made may actually be lower than this value but may not be less than MinBaud. The baud rate must be in the range 0 to 115,200, and must divide evenly into 115,200 with no more than 2.5% error. The value of 0 has special significance. This corresponds to the maximum baud rate available for the particular device.

params.name: DataBits
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of data bits per character. DataBits must be 5, 6, 7, or 8.

params.name: StopBits
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of stop bits per character. StopBits must be 1 or 2.

params.name: Parity
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parity checking to use: Parity Checking Type 0 No parity 1 dd parity 2 Even parity 3 Stick (space parity) 4 1 Stick (mark parity)

params.name: ModemStream
params.description: Required. The connected modem stream (returned from a ModemStream or ModemDial function call).

params.name: Enable
params.description: Required. Any logical value that is "true" (non-zero) to enable digit monitoring, and "false" (zero) to cancel digit monitoring.

params.name: ModemStream
params.description: Required. The connected modem stream (returned from a ModemStream function call) that is to be handed off to another interested application.

params.name: MediaMode
params.description: Optional. Specifies the desired media mode for the call. Valid values are bit significant, and more than one may be specified. MediaMode Meaning Comments 2 Unknown Is set whenever more than one of the other values is set. 4 Interactive Voice A voice mode call using the modem microphone/speaker. 8 Automated Voice For simulated speech and wave files. Allows DTMF digit detection. 16 Datamodem For data calls. 32 Group 3 Fax For FAX calls.

params.name: Modem
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the modem number between 1 and the number of modems in the system (the return from ModemCount).

params.name: RingCount
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression designating the number of rings after which the modem should be answered. If this parameter is 0 the modem will not answer the call. The default is 1.

params.name: ReceiveLen
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression giving the size of the receive buffer for the serial stream in bytes. ReceiveLen must be in the range 2 to 32 766. The default length is 1024. If more bytes are received than can fit in the receive buffer before the application removes them, the additional data will be lost.

params.name: TransmitLen
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression giving the size of the transmit buffer for the serial stream in bytes. TransmitLen must be in the range 2 to 32 766. The default length is 1024. The buffer must be large enough to hold the maximum number of bytes pending transmission at any instance.

params.name: MediaMode
params.description: An optional numeric expression, specifying the desired media mode for the call. See ModemMedia for a description of valid values and their meanings.

params.name: ModemStream
params.description: Required. The connected modem stream (returned from a ModemStream function call) that is to be handed off to another interested application.

params.name: NewAccountData
params.description: Required. An AccountData structure, a single dimension array of AccountData structures or a dictionary of AccountData structures containing the data to modify in each account.

params.name: PtrReturnCode
params.description: Optional. A pointer to a value that will contain one of the defined result codes at the conclusion of the operation.

params.name: HaveLock
params.description: Optional. A Boolean value that indicates whether the working copy lock is held by the calling code. Default FALSE.

params.name: Handle
params.description: Required. The image handle to copy and modify.

params.name: Reflect
params.description: An optional logical value that can be set to 1 to reflect the image about the vertical axis. The default is no reflection (0).

params.name: Hue
params.description: An optional numeric expression for the hue rotation to apply to all of the colors in the image. Range -180 to 180. The default is no hue rotation, (0).

params.name: Saturation
params.description: An optional numeric expression that is a multiplier to the intensity of each primary color component of every color in the image. Range: 0 to 255. Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: Lightness
params.description: An optional numeric expression that is a  multiplier to the brightness of the image. Range 0+. Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: Transparency
params.description: An optional numeric expression for a  multiplier to the transparency (alpha value) of every color in the image. Range 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque). Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: Contrast
params.description: Optional numeric expression to enhance the differences between the colors in the image. Range 0+. Defaults to 1 if missing or invalid.

params.name: ColorizeHue
params.description: Optional numeric expression for the hue value of a color to be mixed with every color in the image. Range -180 to 180. Defaults to 0 if missing or invalid.

params.name: ColorizeSaturation
params.description: Optional numeric expression for the intensity of the added color. Zero means that no color is added. Range 0-1. Defaults to 0 if missing or invalid.

params.name: AntiAlias
params.description: Bit 0 controls whether anti-aliasing will be done when the image is stretched. Defaults to 1 (TRUE) if missing or invalid. By default, feathering will be applied to an anti-aliased image when it is stretched. Set bit 1 to 1 (TRUE) to suppress feathering.

params.name: ScalarColor
params.description: Optional color value in the form aRGB A colour value, defined as four, two-digit hexadecimal values. Alpha - Red - Green - Blue. An Alpha value of FFis assumed if only the RGB values are provided. , used to apply a specific color to a gray-scale image.

params.name: Rotation
params.description: Optional floating point value, specifying the clockwise rotation in degrees to be applied when the image is drawn.

params.name: pSuccess
params.description: A required pointer to a value, which will be set to 1 on successful completion or 0 on failure.

params.name: CallBackModuleName
params.description: A required text value, containing the name of the callback module to be launched into the caller.

params.name: ExtraInfo
params.description: An optional parameter which may be any value. If present, it will be passed through to the callback module.

params.name: Deploy
params.description: Optional Boolean. Has no effect while the application is running in automatic-deploy mode. If auto-deploy is off, then when this parameter is TRUE (or Invalid) the modified files will be deployed immediately after the changes occur. Defaults to TRUE. Deploy must be present and set to FALSE to prevent ModifyConfiguration from acting as if auto-deploy is always on.

params.name: pSuccess
params.description: An optional pointer to a value, which will be set to 1 on successful completion or 0 on failure.

params.name: TagParameters
params.description: Dictionary of tag parameters, each of which is also a dictionary. See examples.

params.name: NewTags
params.description: Optional. Dictionary of tag additions. Key is tag friendly name and value is tag type. If you have a NewTags entry for a tag that already exists, then the action will be a deletion and an add of that tag. The added tag will not have the same UniqueID as the original tag, and therefore page references and history for the old tag will not be associated with the new tag,

params.name: UserID
params.description: Optional. User making change

params.name: Comment
params.description: Optional. Comment to store with changes

params.name: Merge
params.description: Optional. On update, true to retain parameters not specified in parameter dictionary, false to revert all other parameters to their defaults.  Defaults to TRUE

params.name: HaveLock
params.description: Optional. If false, this module gets the working copy lock and commits changes and update tags when finished. If true, caller must have WC lock ModifyTags will not get WC lock, commit changes, or update running tags.  Defaults to FALSE

params.name: pErrors
params.description: Optional output: dictionary of errors, keyed by name of tag with error, containing #MODTAGS_* error code. Defined in Code. Constants used as error codes, returned in the pErrors dictionary parameter of ModifyTags: Constant Value Description #MODTAGS_BADNAME 1 Name of added tag is not allowed. Refer to tag naming rules. #MODTAGS_BADTYPE 2 Provided type is not an existing type #MODTAGS_MISSINGTAG 3 Attempting to modify a non-existent tag. #MODTAGS_MISSINGPARENT 4 Attempting to add a child to a non-existing parent. Constants used as global error codes returned in root value of ModifyTags's pErrors dictionary parameter: Constant Value Description #MODTAGS_NOERROR 0 No error. #MODTAGS_TAGERROR 1 One of the errors listed in the preceding table. #MODTAGS_NOTEDITABLE 2 Application cannot be edited at this time. (Most likely, a restart is required.)

params.name: PtrReturnCode
params.description: Required. A pointer to a variable that will be used for the return code. PtrReturnCode Meaning 1 Privilege modified. 2 Denied. The calling context does not have the Manager general privilege. 3 The privilege is not valid - no action taken. 4 The specified user does not exist - no action taken. 5 The SetPrivilege flag is invalid - no action taken. 6 The application cannot be edited.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module to enquire about.

params.name: ModuleTree
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module tree value.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module.

params.name: Date
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of days since January 1, 1970.

params.name: EditorVal
params.description: Required. An editor Value which is returned by MakeEditor.

params.name: Line
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that specifies the line to move the editor to.

params.name: Column
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that specifies the column to move the editor to.

params.name: Source
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module to be moved.

params.name: Destination
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module code value of the sibling module where Source will be moved.

params.name: Win
params.description: Required. Any expression that gives an object value contained in the window to move. Often, Self().

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the pixel coordinate to place the left hand side of the window.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the pixel coordinate to place the top of the window.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required numeric. Left placement coordinate.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required numeric. Right placement coordinate.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required numeric. Top placement coordinate.

params.name: ParmPtrArray
params.description: Required. An array of pointers to the value of each parameter.

params.name: CodePtrArray
params.description: Required. An array of pointers to the definition of each parameter.

params.name: TitleArray
params.description: Required. An array of titles to display.

params.name: PtrWaitClose
params.description: Required. A pointer to the SubwaitClose of that panel if applicable. (Note that only one is used, rather than an array. It will trigger if any of the checkboxes are being edited.)

params.name: DialogRoot
params.description: Required. The root dialog calling this control. It will be passed on to each individual check box's NumericParameterEdit.

params.name: FIDArray
params.description: Optional. An array of Focus IDs for each check box. This allows for conditional statements to change the ability of each check box to interact. Each defaults to TRUE if Invalid.

params.name: ManualWidth
params.description: Optional numeric. Use to provide a value for consideration when calculating the width needed for titles. A manual width smaller than the required width of a title will be ignored.

params.name: PTypePtrArray
params.description: Optional. An array of PTypes that are handed directly into each checkbox's numericParameterEdit.

params.name: DescArray
params.description: Optional. An array of descriptions that are placed under each related title. This allows for comments, clarification, or the splitting of a long title.

params.name: Invalid
params.description: Placeholder. This parameter is now obsolete.

params.name: MuteState
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to mute sound or FALSE to unmute. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: ExpiryTime
params.description: Optional numeric. Time at which a muted alarm should unmute (UTC). Leave empty to toggle alarm muting immediately according to the MuteState setting.

params.name: Size
params.description: Required. A numeric value specifying the size of a one-dimensional array

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object that defines the window where the focus is found.

params.name: ID
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the new focus ID number.

params.name: Local
params.description: Optional Boolean. If True then focus calls are module-specific (i.e. local to the module calling Focus.)

params.name: AlarmObject
params.description: Required. The object value for the alarm that was passed to the Register subroutine.

params.name: EventTime
params.description: Optional. The time stamp to use when adding this event to the alarm lists. If invalid or not defined, the default is CurrentTime().

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which represents the value to normalize.

params.name: LowScale
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which represents the lowest normal scaled value of Value. This is not a limit.

params.name: HighScale
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which represents the highest normal scaled value of Value. This is not a limit.

params.name: AlarmObject
params.description: Required. The object value for the alarm that was passed to the Register subroutine.

params.name: EventTime
params.description: Optional. The time stamp to use when adding this event to the alarm lists. If invalid or not defined, the default is CurrentTime().

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression from the following table. Value Meaning 0 No Op 1 App is stopping 2 Authentication Failure 3 User stopped the session 4 User logged out 5 The operator terminated the session (from the Thin Client Monitor) 6 The operator forced a server changeover (from the Thin Client Monitor) 7 Refused due to license limits

params.name: Interval
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the update time in seconds. Fractions of a second may be specified however, Interval must be greater  than or equal to 0.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object value, variable, or expression for a Module.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the left edge of the object.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the bottom edge of the object.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the right edge of the object.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the top edge of the object.

params.name: ParmVal
params.description: The parameter value to be altered. Typically, one element of the array of parameters passed to the panel.

params.name: ParmCodePtr
params.description: The code pointer to the parameter. Typically, one element of the array of parameter definition structures that correspond to the ParmVal.

params.name: TagObjPreferred
params.description: Set to TRUE to obtain a tag object when possible.

params.name: Title
params.description: The title to display.

params.name: PtrWaitClose
params.description: Wait to close. The parameter edit module will set the value of this pointer to true when the caller should wait to close. For example, if the parameter edit is displaying a dialog, or completing a calculation.

params.name: DialogRoot
params.description: Root dialog calling this control. Typically provided by the panel module.

params.name: MinLimit
params.description: Minimum limit of the selection.

params.name: MaxLimit
params.description: Maximum limit of the selection.

params.name: PTypeIdx
params.description: Index of the Parameter type selection.

params.name: TitleWidth
params.description: Optional, number of pixels allotted for the width of the title.

params.name: ShowDrawnTagProperty
params.description: Optional Boolean, set to TRUE to show "Drawn Tag Property". Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Optional value from 0 to 32767 for the focus ID of this control.

params.name: Type
params.description: Optional value specifying the type for the parameter. Defaults to Double.

params.name: IsSpinBox
params.description: Optional Boolean. When TRUE the numeric option is displayed as a spin box.

params.name: ToolTitleWidthOut
params.description: Optional numeric output value. Holds the width of the parameter edit's tool and title.

params.name: Description
params.description: Optional text describing this parameter.

params.name: DroplistChoices
params.description: Optional. Dynamic array. Contains the array of labels for a droplist. If it is valid, the NumericParamterEdit's value will be displayed as a droplist.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any module or object value of the module to count.

params.name: Statement
params.description: Required. Any expression for the statement code value or code pointer value.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object that defines the window.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any variable for which the number of sets is required.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object or module value.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the ODBC database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: SQLCommand
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the SQL command to perform on the ODBC database driver. If the query involves long binary data types, then a structure should be used. See examples.

params.name: Attrib
params.description: An optional parameter that returns a 2D array, with each row in the array holding detailed attributes for one column of the result set, as per the following Attrib Attribute Attrib[col][0] Name of the column Attrib[col][1] Type of data VTScada will return for the column: 0 == text 1 == numeric Attrib[col][2] Type SQL ODBC Types indication for the field: Attrib[col][3] A numeric value that is either the maximum or actual character length of a character string or binary data type. It is the maximum character length for a fixed-length data type, or the actual character length for a variable-length data type.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC-compliant database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: A descriptive error or status message, returned by the function. If valid, both ErrorMsg and SQLState will be valid.

params.name: SQLState
params.description: A 5-character SQL State code. SQL State codes are defined by Microsoft and by the vendor of each ODBC driver.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: An unsuccessful operation always returns a non-zero value, which is a numeric error code specific to the DBMS vendor's ODBC driver or Microsoft's ODBC Driver Manager. A successful operation will always return a 0. ErrorMsg and SQLState may or may not be set valid in the event of a successful connection. If set valid, they should be examined for relevant status information.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the specified ODBC database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: A descriptive error or status message, returned by the function. If valid, both ErrorMsg and SQLState will be valid.

params.name: SQLState
params.description: A 5-character SQL State code. SQL State codes are defined by Microsoft and by the vendor of each ODBC driver.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: An unsuccessful operation always returns a non-zero value, which is a numeric error code specific to the DBMS vendor's ODBC driver or Microsoft's ODBC Driver Manager. A successful operation will always return a 0. ErrorMsg and SQLState may or may not be set valid in the event of a successful connection. If set valid, they should be examined for relevant status information.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the mode as follows: Mode Meaning 0 Add data source 1 Configure data source 2 Remove data source In order for 64-bit VTScada to work with 64-bit data sources, add 64 to the Mode parameter. 32-bit VTScada cannot configure a 64-bit data source.

params.name: DSName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the ODBC data source name, as configured in the ODBC setup menu under Microsoft Windowsâ¢.

params.name: UserName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the ODBC login user name.

params.name: Password
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the ODBC login password.

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: A descriptive error or status message, returned by the function. If valid, both ErrorMsg and SQLState will be valid.

params.name: SQLState
params.description: A 5-character SQL State code. SQL State codes are defined by Microsoft and by the vendor of each ODBC driver.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: An unsuccessful operation always returns a non-zero value, which is a numeric error code specific to the DBMS vendor's ODBC driver or Microsoft's ODBC Driver Manager. A successful operation will always return a 0. ErrorMsg and SQLState may or may not be set valid in the event of a successful connection. If set valid, they should be examined for relevant status information.

params.name: Disconnect
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression that determines how errors are to be handled. If true (non-0), the connection to the database will be disconnected should any error (no matter how minor) occur. If false (0) an error will not cause a disconnect to occur. The default value is false.

params.name: LoginTimeout
params.description: Optional. An SQLUINTEGER (unsigned long) value corresponding to the number of seconds to wait for a login request to complete before returning to the application. The default is driver-dependent. If the value is 0, then the timeout is disabled and a connection attempt will wait indefinitely. If the specified timeout exceeds the maximum login timeout in the data source, then the driver substitutes that value and returns SQLSTATE 01S02 (Option value changed).

params.name: ConnectTimeout
params.description: Optional. An SQLUINTEGER value corresponding to the number of seconds to wait for any request on the connection to complete before returning to the application. The driver should return SQLSTATE HYT00 (Timeout expired) any time that it is possible to time out in a situation not associated with query execution or login. If the value is equal to 0 (the default) then there is no timeout.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the ODBC database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the specified ODBC database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: A descriptive error or status message, returned by the function. If valid, both ErrorMsg and SQLState will be valid.

params.name: SQLState
params.description: A 5-character SQL State code. SQL State codes are defined by Microsoft and by the vendor of each ODBC driver.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: An unsuccessful operation always returns a non-zero value, which is a numeric error code specific to the DBMS vendor's ODBC driver or Microsoft's ODBC Driver Manager. A successful operation will always return a 0. ErrorMsg and SQLState may or may not be set valid in the event of a successful connection. If set valid, they should be examined for relevant status information.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the option to indicate what information is desired about the last ODBC statement executed as follows: Option Information desired 0 Return 0 if information or 1 if error 1 SQL state text 2 Native error code 3 ODBC error text 4 Error text length

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the ODBC database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: Search
params.description: An optional parameter which is any text string indicating the pattern to match for table names. If this parameter is omitted, the search pattern defaults to "%", where the percent sign is the SQL wildcard (i.e. all table names are returned).

params.name: TableType
params.description: An optional parameter which is a list of table types to match. Parameters include the following: "TABLE", "VIEW", "SYSTEM TABLE",..., or a data source-specific type name.

params.name: AlarmObject
params.description: Required. The object value for the alarm that was passed to the Register subroutine.

params.name: EventTime
params.description: Optional. The time stamp to use when adding this event to the alarm lists. If invalid or not defined, the default is CurrentTime().

params.name: FluidType
params.description: Required numeric. An integer to identify the commodity group as follows: 0 for Crude Oil 1 for Refined Liquids 2 for Lubricating Oil 3 for Special Fluids

params.name: Alpha60In
params.description: Optional numeric.  A thermal expansion factor that is required for special fluids, where FluidType is 3.

params.name: RhoIn
params.description: Required numeric. The observed density of the fluid in kg per meter cubed.

params.name: TRhoIn
params.description: Required numeric. The temperature in Â°F at which the density of the fluid is observed.

params.name: PRhoIn
params.description: Required numeric. The pressure in psig at which the density of the fluid is observed.

params.name: TAltIn
params.description: Required numeric. The temperature in degrees F of the fluid for the volume correction.

params.name: PAltIn
params.description: Required numeric. The pressure in psig of the fluid for the volume correction.

params.name: ErrorTag
params.description: An optional tag object that will be set to the error value. Error values include: 0 No error 1 Fluid type outside range 2 Thermal expansion factor required but not specified 3 Density outside range 4 TRholn outside range 5 PRholn outside range 6 TAltln outside range 7 PAltln outside range 8 Rho60ln outside range 9 Too many iterations

params.name: FluidType
params.description: Required numeric. An integer to identify the commodity group as follows: 0 for Crude Oil 1 for Refined Liquids 2 for Lubricating Oil 3 for Special Fluids

params.name: Alpha60In
params.description: Optional numeric. A thermal expansion factor that is required for special fluids, where FluidType is 3.

params.name: Rho
params.description: Required numeric. The density of the fluid at base conditions (60Â°F,0psig).

params.name: T
params.description: Required numeric. The current temperature of the fluid in Â°F.

params.name: P
params.description: Required numeric. The current pressure of the fluid in psig.

params.name: ErrorTag
params.description: An optional tag object that will be set to the error value. Error values include: 0 No error 1 Fluid type outside range 2 Thermal expansion factor required but not specified 3 Density outside range 6 Temperature T outside range 7 Pressure P  outside range

params.name: SecurityPrivilege
params.description: Optional integer. The tag's custom security privilege, if it has one. Most often set to \Root.SecurityBit. Whether or not this is provided, the user must also have the Control Outputs privilege.

params.name: Feedback
params.description: Optional Boolean. TRUE to allow a feedback dialog to appear if permission cannot be granted. FASLE to suppress the dialog. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: EnableOutput
params.description: Optional Boolean. TRUE if the I/O tag has its output capability is enabled. Most often set to \Root.EnableOutput. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: TagObj
