params.description: Optional tag object. The I/O tag being controlled. Defaults to the calling tag

params.name: DisableControl
params.description: Optional. TRUE to disable control. Most often set by the widget according to its own internal logic or parameters. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression.

params.name: Tagname
params.description: Required. The name of the tag to be changed.

params.name: ParmsDict
User
params.description: Required. The user responsible for the operational change.

params.name: Comment
params.description: Optional text. A descriptive comment about the change.

params.name: Merge
params.description: Optional Boolean. Defaults to TRUE. Controls whether the parameters are to be merged with the existing tag's parameters. If false, the parameters replace the tag's parameters and are expected to contain user and timestamp metadata.

params.name: BranchName
params.description: Required. The name of the branch added at the highest level of the hierarchy.

params.name: CallbackContext
params.description: Required. The object value of a running module containing some or all of the following callback modules (these callback modules must be implemented by the programmer). In each case the Item ID passed to the callback will *not* contain the top-level branch name specified in the call to OPCServer.

params.name: Parm1, Parm2[, Parm3 ...])
params.description: Required. Any number of numeric expressions. The expressions will be truncated to 32 bit unsigned integers.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the I/O address of the port to write. Port must be in the range 0 to 65535.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the byte to write. Value must be in the range 0 to 255.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X screen coordinate of the lower left corner of the number or text on the screen.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y screen coordinate of the lower left corner of the number or text on the screen.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the type of the data to display. The valid values for this parameter are: Type Data Type 1 Short 2 Long 3 Float 4 Text 5 Binary 6 Octal 7 Hexadecimal Status variables can be output using a Type value of 1 that will produce either a 0 or 1 on the screen. The type of the Value parameter does not have to match the Type parameter, except for text.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the I/O address of the port to write. Port must be in the range 0 to 65535.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the word to write. Value must be in the range 0 to 65535.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for the variable value.

params.name: Data
params.description: Required. An object value, an array, or a structure. Contains the data or the object value of the module whose parameters are to be packed. For example, if you have 5 numeric values to pack, you would allocate a 1-dimensional array, 5 elements in length. You would then assign the 5 numerics to this array's elements, and pass the array to this parameter. You would specify that you wish to pack from subscript 1 to 5. Refer to the example section  for more information.

params.name: Start
params.description: Required. The starting array index (zero-based), or parameter number (one-based) of the data to pack.

params.name: End
params.description: Required. For arrays this is the last array index. For parameters, it is the parameter number of the data to pack. If packing a structure rather than an array, this must be the number of elements rather than the final index.

params.name: StreamVarPtr
params.description: Required. A pointer to a variable holding the stream into which the data will be packed. The variable can also hold Invalid - see Comments section  for more details.

params.name: KeyDictionary
params.description: Optional. A dictionary that maps structure names to a number that will represent the structure in the packed stream. Within the dictionary, the key is the structure name and the value is the assigned number. There is no requirement for the Pack KeyDictionary parameter and the Unpack MirrorKey parameter to have the same number of elements. All that is required is that the Unpack MirrorKey dictionary has all of the structures that are in that particular packed stream. If the KeyDictionary doesnât have the structure that was packed, the returned data is a simple array rather than a structure. IfKeyDictionary is not used at all, structures packed using Pack() will also include additional data to allow UnPack to generate an equivalent structure. So use the KeyDictionary mechanism if you need to avoid the associated code bloat.

params.name: Stream
params.description: Required. The initial packed RPC stream. The parameters provided in parameters P1, P2, etc. will be packed and appended onto this stream. If Invalid, a new BuffStream will be created to hold the packed parameters.

params.name: P1, P2, â¦
params.description: Optional parameters that will be packed into the stream. Up to 100 parameters are allowed.

params.name: Stream
params.description: Required. The initial packed RPC stream. The RPC specified in this call will be appended onto the end of this stream. If Invalid, a new BuffStream will be created to hold the RPC.

params.name: ModuleName
params.description: Required. The textual name of the RPC subroutine to be executed. Must be valid.

params.name: ModuleContext
params.description: Required. The context in which the "ModuleName" will be executed. The "base" context for a VTScada layer-based application is "Code". For a non-VTScada (pure script) application, the base context is "\System". Must be valid.

params.name: Parameters
params.description: Required. A set of up to 32 parameters to the RPC subroutine. Can be any mixture of the legal types. Supplying a parameter of an illegal type will cause it to be replaced with Invalid when the RPC subroutine is invoked.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: IODevice
params.description: Any expression for the object value of the I/O device driver being used.

params.name: SupportedData
params.description: A bitwise expression, indicating the data type. (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations ) Bit Meaning when set 0 Digital 1 Analog 2 Text

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Title
params.description: Required. Any text expression to be used as a title for the droplist.

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: Optional. Any logical expression. Indicates the title alignment such that if it is TRUE (non-zero), the title is included in the calculation for vertical alignment. If FALSE (0), it is added to the droplist after it, and its bevel (if one exists) has been vertically aligned. The default is TRUE.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Optional. Any logical expression. A variable whose value is set to true (1) when the ParmNum parameter's value has been set by the droplist. The setting of the parameter will not cause Trigger to be set. If this information is not required, a constant may be used.

params.name: Init
params.description: Optional. Any expression for the initial value displayed in the field. The default value is Data[Index]. If Index is invalid, then the droplist will initially appear blank.

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Optional. Any logical expression. If TRUE (non-0), a bevel is drawn around the droplist. If FALSE (0), no bevel is drawn. The default value is TRUE.

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the unopened droplist according to one of the following: Value Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated is determined by the value of AlignTitle. The default value is 0.

params.name: Color
params.description: Required. Any expression giving the color to examine. May be a number from 0 to 255 (from the VTScada palette) or an RGB value with alpha channel, expressed as "<AARRGGBB>".

params.name: RGBIndex
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the color component to return. Red, green, blue, or alpha. RGBIndex Color Content 0 Red 1 Green 2 Blue 3 Alpha channel

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object (the object value of any module instance).

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of the parameter of interest, starting from 1.

params.name: ParmVal
params.description: The variable to be changed. Metadata indicating the revision number (always 0) must be attached.

params.name: ParmPtr
params.description: Code Pointer to the parameter value so the ParameterEdit modules can dissect and categorize it

params.name: Enable
params.description: Flag - TRUE to enable the drawing of this parameter edit module.

params.name: Title
params.description: Title for this parameter

params.name: Modules
params.description: Array of module names (snap-ins such as ParmEditColor, etc.) for parameter editing

params.name: Contexts
params.description: No longer used. Should be set to INVALID. Context is always Code.

params.name: Parameters
params.description: Parameters for the parameter edit modules. A multidimensional array, where each sub-array is a parameter list for each of the entries in the Modules array.

params.name: TitleWidth
params.description: Width allotted for the title. If Invalid, uses a standard size (160px).

params.name: StartIndex
params.description: Starting Index for Parm Edit Modules

params.name: PtrWaitClose
params.description: Set to true to tell caller to wait to close

params.name: DialogRoot
params.description: Calling dialog window

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Optional focus ID value from 0 to 32767 . Defaults to 1 if the control is enabled, otherwise 0. The parameter edit control will have two parts and thus use two ID values: the one specified (or the default) and one greater than that.

params.name: Description
params.description: Optional text, describing this parameter

params.name: Parm0
params.description: The first parameter to include.

params.name: Parm1 to Parm256
params.description: More parameters.

params.name: CanEdit
params.description: Any logical expression. If true (non-0) the text displayed in the area droplist can be edited in the same manner as an editfield, if false (0) it cannot be edited directly. Defaults to true (1) if invalid.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: Init
params.description: Any numeric expression indicating the initial value. No default is provided.

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Any logical expression. If true (non-0) a bevel is drawn around the area droplist, if false (0) no bevel is drawn. Defaults to true (1) if invalid.

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: Any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the unopened area droplist according to one of the following: VertAlign Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated, is determined by the value of AlignTitle. Defaults to 0 if invalid.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. The object you are inquiring about.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object (the object value of any running module instance).

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object (the object value of any running module instance).

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the first parameter to format, starting from 1.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of parameters to format. If there are fewer actual parameters than N + Index, this statement stops at the last parameter.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which specifies the format of the buffer read. Option Format 0 Unsigned binary (low byte first) 1 Signed binary (low byte first) 2 BCD (binary coded decimal) (low byte first) 3 ASCII octal (high byte first) 4 ASCII decimal (high byte first) 5 ASCII hex (high byte first) 6 ASCII floating point (high byte first) 7 IEEE float/double (low byte first) 8 <obsolete> 9 Allen-BradleyÂ® PLC/3 floating point 10 VAX single precision floating point

params.name: ParserStack
params.description: Required. Any expression for the parser stack value.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for the variable value that will be referenced by scope resolution.

params.name: ObjectText
params.description: Required. The text string containing objects.

params.name: SelDAGs
params.description: Required. An array of code pointers of the pasted objects.

params.name: Closed
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, this is a closed path, and the last Vertex is considered to be connected to the first point. If false, this is an open path ending at the last Vertex.

params.name: V1, V2, ...
params.description: Required. Any expressions that return Vertex values.

params.name: Pen
params.description: Required. Defines the color, style and width of the path. May be any of the following: Value Notes Pen object If the pen color is transparent, invisible, or has a zero width, then a 1-pixel black line will be shown only while the path is being drawn to show the position. Palette index Defines only the color of the line. A 1-pixel, solid line will be drawn. System color Defines only the color of the line. A 1-pixel, solid line will be drawn. -1 (transparent line) The line will not be shown, except that a 1-pixel solid black line will be used while the path is being drawn. aRGB string Defines only the color of the line. A 1-pixel, solid line will be drawn.

params.name: Pen object
params.description: Palette index

params.name: System color
params.description: -1 (transparent line)

params.name: aRGB string
params.description: Brush

params.name: Brush object
params.description: Palette index

params.name: System color
params.description: -1 (transparent line)

params.name: String
params.description: Required. The string you wish to compare to Pattern.

params.name: Pattern
params.description: Required. The reference pattern to which you wish String to be compared. Wildcards are allowed. The wildcard "?" will match any character in a name. The wildcard "*" will match any series of characters. The backslash character has special meaning, in that it can be added in front of the characters *, ? or \ to search for these characters explicitly. In these three cases, the leading backslash will be ignored. Other characters must match exactly. A leading backslash in front of any characters other than the three noted will be included in the search.

params.name: CaseInsensitive
params.description: An optional Boolean parameter that indicates whether PatternMatch should be case insensitive when it performs the matching. The default for this parameter is FALSE, indicating that PatternMatch should be case sensitive.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Label
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a label with the check box. The default value is a blank label.

params.name: BoxOnLeft
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If TRUE (non-0) the check box will appear to the left of the label, if FALSE (0) it will be to the right. The default value is TRUE.

params.name: Alignment
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the alignment of the check box and its label according to one of the following options: Alignment Horizontal Alignment Vertical Alignment 0 Left Top 1 Right Top 2 Full Top 3 Left Centered 4 Right Centered 5 Full Centered 6 Left Bottom 7 Right Bottom 8 Full Bottom

params.name: Parms
params.description: Required. A pointer to the array of parameters.

params.name: Hue
params.description: The parameter number for the Hue.

params.name: Saturation
params.description: The parameter number for the Saturation.

params.name: Brightness
params.description: The parameter number for the Brightness.

params.name: Transparency
params.description: The parameter number for the Transparency.

params.name: Contrast
params.description: The parameter number for the Contrast.

params.name: ColorizeHue
params.description: The parameter number for the ColorizeHue.

params.name: ColorizeInt
params.description: The parameter number for the Colorize Intensity.

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression for a title to be applied.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Set when the variable is changed.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: BtnLabel
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a label on the color selection button.

params.name: BtnOnLeft
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) the button will appear to the left of the color display area, if false (0) it will be to the right. The default value is true.

params.name: Standard
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) the button and color display area will be standard system size, if false (0) they will be sized to fit their boundaries and VertAlign will be ignored. The default value is true.

params.name: VertAlign

params.description: Optional. If the droplist is editable, Trigger provides feedback. While editing, the value will be 0. When editing is complete (tab, enter or loss of focus) the value will change to non-zero, 1 if enter is pressed, and 2 otherwise.

params.name: Init
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression for the initial value displayed in the field. The default value is  Parms[ParmNum]. If Index is invalid, the droplist will initially appear blank.

params.name: DataType
params.description: Defaults to 4 unless otherwise specified. DataType Type 0 Byte (unsigned) 1 Short (2 byte signed) 2 Long (4 byte signed) 3 Double precision floating point (8 byte signed) 4 Text 5 Octal (4 byte unsigned) 6 Hexadecimal (4 byte unsigned) For types 0 - 2, if the number entered into the field is prefaced by a "0x" the value is taken to be hexadecimal format, and if it is prefaced by a "0" it is considered to be octal. In either case, the value is converted to decimal format when return is pressed or the focus is lost. For type 5, regardless of whether the number entered into the field is prefaced by a "0" the value is taken to be octal and will be displayed as such. The actual type of Variable will be text. Type 6, like type 5 will be kept in its declared format of hexadecimal regardless of whether the number entered into the field is prefaced by a "0x". The actual type of Variable will be text

params.name: Style
params.description: An optional parameter indicating the style of the EditField object. It is a bit-wise field made up of the sum of the following values, to yield the desired effects. (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations ) Bit Value Definition 0 1 Reserved for bit compatibility with WinComboCtrl, and should be set to "0" 1 2 Reserved for bit compatibility with WinComboCtrl, and should be set to "0" 2 4 Input is converted to all uppercase (note 1) 3 8 Input is converted to all lowercase (note 1) 4 16 Input is masked. Any characters typed will appear as asterisks. This is useful for such things as password fields 5 32 Multiline editing. Setting this bit causes a typed <CR> (Enter or Return) to be interpreted as "move to the start of the next line". Text that contains <CR> characters has a line break inserted at each 6 64 Reserved 7 128 8 256 Reserved 9 512 Not used. Height is defined by \EditHt or TEditHt (with title). If neither values 4 or 8 are set, input is passed to script code as typed.

params.name: Parm1, Parm2, Parm3...
params.description: Required. Any number of parameters giving any expressions, from which the first valid value will be selected.

params.name: PV
params.description: Required. Any numeric parameter which gives the "process variable" to be maintained at the given setpoint.

params.name: SP
params.description: Required. Any numeric parameter that gives the value to use for the "setpoint." The PID function will change its return value to make the PV value match the SP value.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Any numeric parameter giving the manual/auto mode for the function. When the parameter is not equal to 0, the function is in auto mode and uses the PID algorithm to control the output. When the parameter is equal to 0, the function simply returns the value of the Track parameter. When the mode switches from manual to auto, the PID function implements a "bumpless transfer." This results in a smooth output change rather than an abrupt change. This is done by forcing the internal integral to assume a value which forces the PID function to output a value which matches the Track parameter at the moment of the change. The integral value will not, however, exceed the value imposed upon it by the LowLimit and HighLimit parameters. Mode Algorithm Derivative Gains 0 Manual N/A N/A 1 Normal Uses PV Independent 2 Normal Uses PV Dependent 3 Normal Uses Error Independent 4 Reverse Uses Error Dependent 5 Reverse Uses PV Independent 6 Reverse Uses PV Dependent 7 Reverse Uses Error Independent The PID function operates in eight automatic modes and one manual mode. These modes are listed in the above table. If in doubt, use mode 1 or 5. The Action column in the above table indicates whether the PID function operates using normal action (SP - PV) or reverse action (PV - SP). With normal action, when PV increases, the function output decreases. With reverse action, when PV increases, the function output increases also. The Derivative column in the above table indicates whether the PID function derivative bases its value upon PV or the error between PV and SP. For normal action, the error is (SP - PV). For reverse action, the error is (PV - SP). The difference between the two modes is only clear when the setpoint (SP) is changed. If the derivative uses PV, the response to setpoint changes is normal. If the derivative uses the error, the response to setpoint changes is faster but usually produces an abrupt change in the PID function output which is often undesirable. The Gains column in the above table indicates which PID equation is used. Refer to the "Comments" section for these equations. The independent gains equation uses seconds as the time base and the gain parameter (P) does not affect either the integral or derivative. The dependent gain equation is the ISA equation. It uses minutes as the time base and the gain parameter (P) affects both the integral and derivative.

params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the file name to play. If the extension is omitted, the default extension ".WAV" is added. If an empty string is provided here, then any currently playing sound is stopped.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that indicates how to play the file. The value of Option may be obtained by adding together numbers from the following table: Value Bit No. Option 1 0 Play asynchronously (don't wait) 2 1 Don't use default sound if file missing. 4 2 Reserved for future use. 8 3 Loop the sound until next Sound function executed. 16 4 Don't stop any currently playing sound. If Option is "0", VTScada will halt all execution until the sound is finished. This is not recommended. Add "1" to avoid this behavior. (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations )

params.name: ArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression specifying the starting array element to plot. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to plot starting at the element given by the first parameter. N must be greater than or equal to 2, and no greater than 32000. If this parameter is greater than the dimension of the first array, the number of points plotted will be the array dimension. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: Low
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the limit of data values to be plotted. This value need not be less than High but must not be equal to it. In the standard case, when this value is less than High, it will define the minimum value to display. For example, if Low was 10, a data value of 10 would fall on the edge of the bounding box, on either the line described by X1, if the plot is vertical, or on the line described by Y1, if the plot is horizontal. Any values below 10 in this case would not be shown since they would be outside the clipped box.

params.name: High
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the limit of data values to be plotted. This value need not be greater than Low but must not be equal to it. In the standard case, when this value is greater than Low, it will define the maximum value to display. For example, if High was 1000, a data value of 1000 would fall on the edge of the bounding box, on either the line described by X2, if the plot is vertical, or on the line described by Y2, if the plot is horizontal. Any values above 1000 in this case would not be shown since they would be outside the clipped box.

params.name: X1 (Left)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the left side of the plot area. For horizontal plots, this is the screen coordinate of the first point or bar plotted. For vertical plots, this is the value which corresponds to the Low parameter value. For vertical bar plots, X1 is the base coordinate for the bars.

params.name: Y1 (Bottom)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of bottom side of the plot area. For vertical plots, this is the screen coordinate of the first point or bar plotted. For horizontal plots, this is the value which corresponds to the Low parameter value. For horizontal bar plots, Y1 is the base coordinate for the bars.

params.name: X2 (Right)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the right side of the plot area. For horizontal plots, this is the screen coordinate of the last point or bar plotted. For vertical plots, this is the value which corresponds to the High parameter value.

params.name: Y2 (Top)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the top side of the plot area. For vertical plots, this is the screen coordinate of the last point or bar plotted. For horizontal plots, this is the value which corresponds to the High parameter value.

params.name: Style
params.description: Required (Format version 1 only). Any numeric expression giving the style of the plot. The plot Style gives the line style, direction, bit number for bits plots, and the number of points to average per point displayed. The Style is determined by adding together the following values: Line style + Direction + Path + Bit number + Average Line style is a number between 1 and 5 inclusive which gives the line style for line plots. A line style of 1 indicates a solid line (see Chapter 9 for more styles). For bar plots, the line style portion of the Style parameter is ignored. Direction is either 0 or 10. Use 0 for a standard horizontal plot (array index runs along the X axis and values are plotted up or down). Use 10 for a vertical plot (array index runs along the Y axis and values are plotted left or right). Path is either 0 or 50. A 0 indicates that line plots are to be drawn directly from point to point. A 50 indicates that plots are to be drawn in a step fashion with two line segments between each point. The first segment runs parallel to the X-axis and the second segment runs parallel to the Y-axis. This produces a square-looking plot. These step plots are useful for plotting status values which change in jumps rather than continuously. The Path value is ignored for bar plots. Bit number is either 0 or a value starting at 100. This is the number of the bit to use in the array data for plotting. If the normal entire value of the data is to be plotted, use 0 for this value. If only one of the bits from the data is to be plotted, use the bit number plus 1. The value to add is (Bit number + 1) * 100 or 0. The ability to plot only a single bit from an array of short or long values allows status data to be stored very efficiently by not requiring a separate array for each status value. For bit plots, the value plotted is always a 0 or a 1 corresponding to the value of the selected bit. The use of this plotting option is usually done in conjunction with a Path value of 50 for step plots. Average is either 0 or a value starting at 10000. This is the number of consecutive array points to average to give a single point on the screen. It can be used to plot a very large array of values on the screen without having to draw all of the points on the screen. This will produce a smoothed plot and reduce the drawing time. The number to add is (Data points per displayed point - 1) * 10000.

params.name: Color
params.description: Required (Format version 1 only). Any numeric expression giving the VTScada Color Palette of the line and the foreground color for filled plots. If the number is less than 10000, the plot is non-destructive. If the number is greater than or equal to 10000, the plot is destructive and the actual color used is Color - 10000. RGB color strings may not be used.

params.name: Pattern
params.description: Required (Format version 1 only). Any numeric expression giving the bar Fill Patterns for the plot. For a Pattern value of 0, the plot is a line plot. For Pattern values in the range of 1 to 25 inclusive, the plot is a bar plot with the hatch pattern corresponding to the Pattern parameter value. If the parameter is 1, the bars are a solid color and the Background parameter is ignored.

params.name: PatternBackground
params.description: Required (Format version 1 only). Any numeric expression giving the color number of the plot fill background color. This number is ignored if the Pattern parameter is equal to 1. For values of Pattern greater than one, it gives the background color for the bar. RGB color strings may not be used.

params.name: Pen
params.description: Required (Format version 2 only). The pen to be used (if any). Must be provided, but will be ignored for bar plots.

params.name: Brush
params.description: Required (Format version 2 only). The brush to be used (if any). For line drawing, this parameter must be provided with pattern 0.

params.name: XORMode
params.description: (Format version 2 only) An optional parameter specifying whether the plot is destructive (if destructive, the plot line won't be affected by the background color). If set to 0 or Invalid (default), the destructive drawing mode will be used. If set to 1, the non-destructive or XOR drawing mode will be used.

params.name: Direction
params.description: An optional parameter specifying the horizontal or vertical direction for the plot. 0 or Invalid indicates horizontal, while 1 indicates vertical.

params.name: DrawStepped
params.description: (Format version 2 only) An optional parameter specifying whether the plot is to be drawn from point-to-point, or stepped. 0 or Invalid indicates point-to-point, while 1 indicates stepped.

params.name: BitNumber
params.description: (Format version 2 only) An optional parameter specifying the use of a whole value or a bit number. Invalid indicates a whole value should be used, while >=0 indicates that the specified bit number should be used. No default

params.name: Average
params.description: (Format version 2 only) An optional parameter specifying whether consecutive points should be averaged to give a single point. Invalid or 0 indicates that averaging should not be used, while >0 indicates that the number of consecutive points should be averaged to give a single point. No default.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text expression that contains data to be plotted.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that gives the starting buffer position in data elements (not bytes or characters) of the first data element.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of elements to plot starting at the element given by the offset parameter. N must be greater than or equal to 2, and no greater than 32000. If this parameter is greater than the length of the buffer, the number of points plotted will be the number of points available in the buffer. If the end of the buffer is encountered before N points have been plotted, plotting continues with the first point in the buffer (offset 0).

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the type of data held in the buffer. The types are described in the following table: Value Type 0 Byte (0-255) 1 Short (2 bytes. -32768 to 32767) 2 Long (4 byte signed integer) 3 Float (4 byte IEEE floating point)

params.name: XArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting point in the array of X coordinates. The subscript for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used.

params.name: YArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting point in the array of Y coordinates. The subscript for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to plot starting at the element given by the first parameters. N must be greater than or equal to 0, and no greater than 16384. If this parameter is greater than the dimension of the first array, the number of points plotted will be that array dimension. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: DataLimitLeft
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the limit of data values to be plotted. This value need not be less than Right but must not be equal to it. In the standard case, when this value is less than Right, it will define the minimum value to display from the array of X-values. For example, if Left was 10, a data value of 10 would fall on the edge of the bounding box, on either X1, if the plot is vertical, or on Y1, if the plot is horizontal. Any values below 10 in this case would not be shown - they would be outside the clipped box.

params.name: DataLimitRight
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the limit of data values to be plotted. This value need not be greater than Left but must not be equal to it. In the standard case, when this value is greater than Left, it will define the maximum value to display from the array of X-values. For example, if Right was 1000, a data value of 1000 would fall on the edge of the bounding box, on either X2, if the plot is vertical, or on Y2, if the plot is horizontal. Any values above 1000 in this case would not be shown - they would be outside the clipped box.

params.name: DataLimitTop
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the limit of data values to be plotted. This value need not be less than Bottom but must not be equal to it. In the standard case, when this value is less than Bottom, it will define the minimum value to display from the array of Y-values. For example, if Top was 10, a data value of 10 would fall on the edge of the bounding box, on either Y1, if the plot is vertical, or on X1, if the plot is horizontal. Any values below 10 in this case would not be shown - they would be outside the clipped box.

params.name: DataLimitBottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that defines the limit of data values to be plotted. This value need not be greater than Top but must not be equal to it. In the standard case, when this value is greater than Top, it will define the maximum value to display from the array of Y-values. For example, if Bottom was 1000, a data value of 1000 would fall on the edge of the bounding box, on either Y2, if the plot is vertical, or on X2, if the plot is horizontal. Any values above 1000 in this case would not be shown - they would be outside the clipped box.

params.name: X1 (Left)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the left side of the plot area. This corresponds to the Left parameter for horizontal plots and to the Top parameter for vertical plots.

params.name: Y1 (Top)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the top side of the plot area. This corresponds to the Top parameter for horizontal plots and to the Left parameter for vertical plots.

params.name: X2 (Right)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the plot area opposite to X1.  This corresponds to the Right parameter for horizontal plots and to the Bottom parameter for vertical plots.

params.name: Y2 (Bottom)
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the side of the plot area opposite to Y1. This corresponds to the Bottom parameter for horizontal plots and to the Right parameter for vertical plots.

params.name: Style
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the style of the plot - the line style, direction, bit number for bits plots, and the number of points to average per point displayed. If PlotXY senses that the Style parameter is a Pen, XORMode, DrawStepped, BitNumber, and Average parameters will become relevant. The Style is determined by adding together the following values. Line style + Direction + Path + Bit number + Average Line style is a number between 1 and 10 inclusive which gives the line style for line plots. A line style of 1 indicates a solid line. For other line styles, the background color is set to the current background screen color. Direction is either 0 or 10. A 0 indicates a horizontal plot and a 10 indicates a vertical plot. Path is either 0 or 50. A 0 indicates that line plots are to be drawn directly from point to point. A 50 indicates that plots are to be drawn in a step fashion with two line segments between each point. The first segment runs parallel to the X-axis and the second segment runs parallel to the Y-axis. This produces a square-looking plot. These step plots are useful for plotting status values which change in jumps rather than continuously. Bit number is the number of the bit to use in the YArray data for plotting. If the normal entire value of the data is to be plotted, use 0 for this value. If only one of the bits from the data is to be plotted, use the bit number plus 1. The value to add is (Bit number + 1) * 100 or 0. The ability to plot only a single bit from an array of short or long values allows status data to be stored very efficiently by not requiring a separate array for each status value. For bit plots, the value plotted is always a 0 or a 1 corresponding to the value of the selected bit. The use of this plotting option is usually done in conjunction with a Path value of 50 for step plots. Average is the number of consecutive array points to average to give a single point on the screen. Both XArray and YArray values are averaged. It can be used to plot a very large array of values on the screen without having to draw all of the points on the screen. This will produce a smoothed plot and reduce the drawing time. The number to add is (Data points per displayed point + 1) * 10000.

params.name: Color
params.description: Any numeric expression giving the VTScada Color Palette of the line and the foreground color for filled plots. If the number is less than 10000, the plot is non-destructive. If the number is greater than or equal to 10000, the plot is destructive and the actual color used is Color - 10000.

params.name: Pen
params.description: The pen to be used (if any).

params.name: Reserved
params.description: Reserved has been allocated to permit the addition of a Brush parameter, should such a parameter become necessary in the future. Reserved can currently be any value or Invalid.

params.name: XORMode
params.description: An optional parameter specifying whether the plot is destructive (if destructive, the plot line won't be affected by the background color). If set to 0 or Invalid (default), the destructive drawing mode will be used. If set to 1, the non-destructive or XOR drawing mode will be used.

params.name: Direction
params.description: An optional parameter specifying the horizontal or vertical direction for the plot. 0 or Invalid indicates horizontal, while 1 indicates vertical.

params.name: DrawStepped
params.description: An optional parameter specifying whether the plot is to be drawn from point-to-point, or stepped. 0 or Invalid indicates point-to-point, while 1 indicates stepped.

params.name: BitNumber
params.description: An optional parameter specifying the use of a whole value or a bit number. Invalid indicates a whole value should be used, while >=0 indicates that the specified bit number should be used.

params.name: Average
params.description: An optional parameter specifying whether consecutive points should be averaged to give a single point. Invalid or 0 indicates that averaging should not be used, while >0 indicates that the number of consecutive points should be averaged to give a single point.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: LeftToRight
params.description: Required. If TRUE, order from left to right. If FALSE, order from top to bottom.

params.name: CheckBoxLabels
params.description: Required. An array of labels for the checkboxes.

params.name: ID
params.description: Starting with FocusID with one for each checkbox. Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Optional Boolean expression that when set to TRUE, causes a bevel to be drawn around the control. Default: False

params.name: Label
params.description: Required. A text expression to be used as a label for the checkboxes.

params.name: BitOffset
params.description: Offset at which to start the bit setting.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. A numeric constant, that describes the reference x-axis location of the point. Expressions are not permitted here. If it is desired to change the x coordinate, use the Trajectory or Rotation parameters.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. A numeric constant, that describes the reference y-axis location of the point. Expressions are not permitted here. If it is desired to change the y coordinate, use the Trajectory or Rotation parameters.

params.name: Rotation
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns a Rotate value. This specifies any translation of this point from its reference position (X, Y) by rotation about another point. If this is invalid, no rotation is performed, but the Point is still valid.

params.name: Trajectory
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns a Trajectory value. This specifies any translation of this point from its reference position of (X, Y) along a path. If this is invalid, no translation is performed, but the Point is still valid.

params.name: ArrayStart
params.description: Required. Any expression that specifies the starting array element. This array contains the pointers to the variables whose values will be written to a buffer. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to convert starting at the element given by the first parameter. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that specifies the format of the buffer write: Option Format 0 Unsigned binary (low byte first) 1 Signed binary (low byte first) 2 BCD (binary coded decimal) (low byte first) 3 ASCII octal (high byte first) 4 ASCII decimal (high byte first) 5 ASCII hex (high byte first) 6 ASCII floating point (high byte first) 7 IEEE float/double (low byte first) 8 <obsolete> 9 Allen-BradleyÂ® PLC/3 floating point 10 VAX single precision floating point For Options 7 and 9 the data is written as appropriate binary format.

params.name: TagType
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving a type of tag or the name of a tag group.

params.name: SearchString
params.description: An optional text expression. The search will be limited to tags with matching names. May include wildcards. The default is "*" (any name).

params.name: NoFilterSimulation
params.description: Obsolete.

params.name: ModuleName
params.description: Required. Any expression providing a text result. Name of module to draw in the window

params.name: Title
params.description: Required. Any expression providing a text result. Window title

params.name: Width
params.description: Required. Numeric expression. Number of pixels wide for the dialog

params.name: Height
params.description: Required. Numeric expression. Number of pixels high for the dialog

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Numeric expression. Location on the screen for the dialog, measured from the left.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Numeric expression. Location on the screen for the dialog measured from the top.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: ShowHotbox
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If TRUE, the click-able area will be shown.

params.name: ShowHighlight
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If TRUE the area will be emphasized with the HighlightColor.

params.name: HighlightColor
params.description: An optional output giving the highlight color to display if ShowHighlight is true.

params.name: IntTrigger
params.description: An optional trigger used by the caller's Edit field.

params.name: ShowProperties
params.description: An optional Boolean, controlling whether the Properties item should appear in the menu.

params.name: ValType
params.description: Optional. The VTScada value type of the parameter.

params.name: MinVal
params.description: Optional numeric. The minimum for the parameter value.

params.name: MaxVal
params.description: Optional numeric. The maximum for the parameter value.

params.name: ValArray
params.description: Optional array. If provided, defines a list of acceptable values for the parameter.

params.name: Enable
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to enable the right-click menu. Defaults to TRUE

params.name: DoNotTranslate
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE when you do not want to translate a parameter that is a PhraseKey, retaining it as a key for later translation.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number to be raised to the power of Exponent.

params.name: Exponent
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number to which X should be raised.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a title for the droplist.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the droplist according to one of the following options: VertAlign Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated is determined by the value of AlignTitle. The default value is 0.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a title for the droplist.

params.name: PhraseIDArr
params.description: An array containing Phrase IDs (keys) for the list.

params.name: CanEdit
params.description: Boolean. If TRUE, users can edit within the field, adding new phrases.

params.name: Index
params.description: Numeric. The index variable to update within the array.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a title for the field.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: DeviceName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the modem as configured in Windowsâ¢. The function will return Invalid if this parameter is not a valid text value.

params.name: PhoneNumber
params.description: An optional text expression giving the phone number to be used when making a PPP call. Required only for use with modems. Defaults to Invalid.

params.name: UserName
params.description: An optional text expression, providing the user name for remote authentication.

params.name: Password
params.description: An optional text expression, providing the password for remote authentication.

params.name: Domain
params.description: An optional text expression, providing the domain name for remote authentication.

params.name: Flags
params.description: An optional numeric expression, specifying compression, encryption and other options to be provided. A bit-wise AND operation is done between this value and the following constants. Value Constant Meaning 0x0001 PPPDF_IpHeaderCompression Use IP header compression 0x0002 PPPDF_SwCompression Use software compression 0x0004 PPPDF_DisableLcpExtensions Disable LCP extensions. 0x0008 PPPDF_RequireEncryptedPw Require encrypted password. 0x0010 PPPDF_RequireDataEncryption Require data encryption

params.name: PPPHandle
params.description: The PPP Handle to be monitored.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: Border
params.description: Numeric that may have the following values: 0 = No outline (default) 1 = Raised box outline 2 = Bevel outline

params.name: Title
params.description: Any text expression to be used as a title with the radio buttons. The default value is to have no title.

params.name: Options
params.description: A bit-wise expression. Bit 0 controls left/right placement of the buttons. If set, buttons will be placed to the left of the labels. Bit 1 controls vertical/horizontal orientation. If set, the radio buttons will be displayed horizontally. Bit 0 has no effect while bit 1 is set. Bit 2, if set, causes the radio buttons to adopt a "standard" vertical spacing of 5 pixels. Defaults to 0 - neither bit set.

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: Any logical expression; if TRUE (non-0) the title is drawn within the radio buttons' boundaries, if FALSE (0) the buttons fill their bounding area and the title is added at the top (i.e. it extends past the top boundary). The default is true.

params.name: L0
params.description: Labels. The number of labels determines the number of buttons displayed. At least two must be provided. If L0 is an individual label, then up to L15 individual labels may follow. If L0 is an array of labels, L1 may (optionally) be defined as an array of Return values, similar to the return array in PDropList.

params.name: L1
params.description: A flexible parameter. If L0 is an array, this may contain a matching array of return values. Otherwise, this may contain the second label.

params.name: L2
params.description: A flexible parameter. This may contain a logical expression indicating (when TRUE) that expressions should not be translated. Or, this may be the third label.

params.name: L3...L15
params.description: The remaining labels, if any.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. The text to be cleaned.

params.name: PrinterSpec
params.description: ...will accept any of the following: Local Printer: Port name (including virtual ports) with or without a trailing colon (e.g. DEF or DEF:. COM1 or COM1:; USB001 or USB001:; etc.) Windows printer share (e.g. "XYZ Laser Printer") Windows share name (if the printer is shared) (e.g. "XYZLaser") Local or Remote Printer: UNC share name (which includes the host and share name (e.g. "\\localhost\XYlaser" or "\\lab1\NetPrinter")

params.name: PrinterName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the initial printer name to display as selected. If this is not a valid text value, the default printer (as configured under Windows) will initially be selected. If PrinterName refers to a variable and the user clicks the "Print" button on the dialog, thereby closing it, the variable will be set to the name of the selected printer. If the user cancels the dialog box, the variable is unchanged.

params.name: PrinterDevice
params.description: Required. Any variable that will be set to the device name for the selected printer when the user clicks the "Print" button on the dialog. If the user cancels the dialog box, the variable is unchanged. The text expression returned here can be supplied to a FileStream statement to open a stream to the selected printer.

params.name: MinPage
params.description: Required. Any positive integer expression specifying the minimum page number in the printed output (see Comments section  for further details).

params.name: MaxPage
params.description: Required. Any positive integer expression specifying the maximum page number in the printed output (see Comments section  for further details).

params.name: FirstPage
params.description: Required. Any integer expression specifying the first page to be printed (see Comments section  for further details).

params.name: LastPage
params.description: Required. Any integer expression specifying the last page to be printed (see Comments section  for further details).

params.name: NumCopies
params.description: Required. Any integer expression specifying the number of copies to be printed (see Comments section  for further details).

params.name: Result
params.description: Required. A variable that will be set to one of the following values: Invalid when this statement is run, Zero (0) to indicate that the user has canceled the dialog, or One (1) to indicate that the user has clicked the "Print" button.

params.name: PrinterSpec
params.description: ...will accept any of the following: Local Printer: Port name (including virtual ports) with or without a trailing colon (e.g. DEF or DEF:. COM1 or COM1:; USB001 or USB001:; etc.) Windows printer share (e.g. "XYZ Laser Printer") Windows share name (if the printer is shared) (e.g. "XYZLaser") Local or Remote Printer: UNC share name (which includes the host and share name (e.g. "\\localhost\XYlaser" or "\\lab1\NetPrinter")

params.name: DataType
params.description: Required. A numeric value that specifies the type of process information to be retrieved by the function. DataType Function returns 0 Process ID 1 GDI Handle Count 2 User Handle Count

params.name: LeftReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the left side reference coordinate.

params.name: BottomReference
params.description:
A constant number that gives the bottom side reference coordinate. 
The top and bottom references are measured down from the top of the screen.

params.name: RightReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the right side reference coordinate.

params.name: TopReference
params.description: A constant number that gives the top side reference coordinate.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. The value to display as the progress.

params.name: Low
params.description: Optional numeric, specifying the minimum value for the progress bar. Defaults to zero.

params.name: High
params.description: Optional numeric, specifying the maximum value for the progress bar. Defaults to 100.

params.name: LeftLabel
params.description: Optional text providing the left-justified label.

params.name: RightLabel
params.description: Optional text providing the right-justified label.

params.name: Align
params.description: Optional numeric. If 0 (the default if unspecified) the graphic will be top-justified.  If 1, the graphic will be center-justified.

params.name: Delay
params.description: Optional numeric. The number of seconds to wait before the graphic is displayed. Defaults to zero.

params.name: ContinuousLoop
params.description: Optional Boolean. When set true, the progress bar will loop continuously rather than representing the value.

params.name: ProtobufHandle
params.description: Protobuf handle generated by ProtobufParse

params.name: MessageTypeName
params.description: Message type from ProtobufHandle's proto file

params.name: EncodedString
params.description: Protocol buffer to decode

params.name: NoOptionalDefaulting
params.description: Optional Boolean. Defaults to FALSE when unspecified or invalid. When TRUE, fields in a Protobuf message defined as optional and not present in the message are not given a default value when decoded.

params.name: ProtobufHandle
params.description: Protobuf handle generated by ProtobufParse

params.name: MessageTypeName
params.description: Message type from ProtobufHandle's proto file. This is the full name, meaning that if the .proto file includes a package name "com.trihedral.protobufexample" and the message name is "AMessage", this would be "com.trihedral.protobufexample.AMessage". For nested messages this also includes all ancestor messages

params.name: DataToEncode
params.description: VTScada data structure representing the message to be encoded

params.name: ProtobufHandle
params.description: A Protobuf handle returned from ProtobufParse.

params.name: MessageTypeName
params.description: The message type to use for decoding. This is the full name, that is, if the .proto file includes a package name "com.trihedral.protobufexample" and the message name is "AMessage", this would be "com.trihedral.protobufexample.AMessage". For nested messages this also includes all ancestor messages

params.name: OptionalsAsInvalid
params.description: Optional Boolean. Defaults to FALSE when unspecified or invalid. When TRUE, fields in a Protobuf specification file that are defined as optional are not given a default value when instantiated.

params.name: ProtobufFileName
params.description: Required text. Absolute path to the file that defines a Protobuf spec.

params.name: ErrMsg
params.description: Optional. If provided, this will be set to an array of error messages on failure.

params.name: Window
params.description: An optional object value of a module instance that specifies the window to print. If it is not specified, it defaults to Self which will print the window from which the PrtScrn function is executed.

params.name: PaletteChanges
params.description: An optional two-dimensional array of RGB values. Each RGB value overrides the default printed color for the palette index, which is the same as the first array subscript. The first array subscript may have any size (e.g. [0..255] for the whole palette, or [123..125] for just palette indices 123 to 125). (Please see the example in the "Example" section.) The second array subscript should be sized [0..2] and holds the red, green, and blue components of the color respectively. Each color value must be a real number between zero and one. "0" represents a total absence of that color, while "1" represents the full intensity of the color. Colors that are in other indexed positions of the palette, but which have the same RGB value as the indexed color to be changed, will usually also change. The danger is that the process of mapping colors from VTSâs palette to that of the printer may cause results to differ from those expected. If using the PaletteChanges parameter, you are advised to test this function to determine the actual results.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Title
params.description: Required. Any text expression to be used as a title for the droplist.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the droplist according to one of the following options: Value Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated is determined by the value of AlignTitle. The default value is 0.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: TagType
params.description: Required. May be a text expression for the type or type-group of tag to be used to create the droplist. (Type-groups include "ports", "drivers", "analogs", etc.) Alternatively, this may be an array of types. The array may not include groups. All existing tags of the type or types will be listed.

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a title for the droplist. If not provided, the title will be blank.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the unopened droplist according to one of the following: VertAlign Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated is determined by the value of AlignTitle. The default value is 0.

params.name: Parms
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression for a title to be applied.

params.name: ID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Set when the variable is changed.

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Optional Boolean expression that when set to TRUE, causes a bevel to be drawn around the control. If the editfield is beveled, its size will become fixed and will be the same as that for a droplist.

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the droplist according to one of the following options: VertAlign Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated is determined by the value of AlignTitle. The default value is 0.

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: Boolean. Set to TRUE if the title is aligned with the top.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Label
params.description: Required. Any text expression to be used as a label with the spinbox.

params.name: BoxOnLeft
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true (non-0) the spinbox will appear to the left of the label, if false (0) it will be to the right. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: LowLimit
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the lowest permissible value. If the spinbox is editable and a value less than LowLimit is entered, it will revert to the LowLimit value.

params.name: HighLimit
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the highest permissible value. If the spinbox is editable and a value greater than HighLimit is entered, it will revert to the HighLimit value.

params.name: Alignment
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the alignment of the spinbox and its label according to one of the following options. The default value is 0. Alignment Horizontal Alignment Vertical Alignment 0 Left Top 1 Right Top 2 Full Top 3 Left Centered 4 Right Centered 5 Full Centered 6 Left Bottom 7 Right Bottom 8 Full Bottom

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: Title
params.description: Text to be displayed above the parameter.

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: Boolean controlling the text alignment. If this parameter is invalid or numeric, it indicates the title alignment such that if it is true (non-0) the title is included in the calculation for vertical alignment, if false(0) it is added to the droplist after it (and its bevel if one exists) has been vertically aligned. The default is true

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Optional. If the list is editable, Trigger provides feedback. While editing, the value will be 0. When editing is complete (tab, enter or loss of focus) the value will change to non-zero: 1 if enter is pressed, 2 otherwise.

params.name: InitVal
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression for the initial value displayed in the field.

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Optional Boolean expression that when set to TRUE, causes a bevel to be drawn around the control.

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the unopened list according to one of the following: VertAlign Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom Whether the title is included when the vertical alignment is calculated is determined by the value of AlignTitle. The default value is 0.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object (the object value of a running module instance).

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of the parameter of interest, starting from 1.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) in the caller to alter.

params.name: TagType
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the type of tag used to create the droplist portion of the graphic. All existing tags of this type will be listed.

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a title for the tool. May be left as Invalid for no title.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parameter number (from 0) to alter in the caller.

params.name: Title
params.description: Any text expression to be used as a the title to put on the bevel.

params.name: Focus ID
params.description: Boolean. If this value is FALSE (0), the field will display its current setting, but cannot be opened (i.e. its value cannot be changed), and will appear disabled (grayed-out).

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Set when the variable is changed.

params.name: DrawBevel
params.description: Any Boolean expression that when set to TRUE causes a bevel to be drawn around the control. Defaults to TRUE

params.name: VertAlign
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression that sets the vertical alignment of the button and display area according to one of the following options: VertAlign Vertical Alignment 0 Top 1 Center 2 Bottom The default value is 0, top alignment.

params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: If true (non-0) the title is included in the calculation for vertical alignment, if false(0) it is added to the droplist after it and its bevel has been vertically aligned. The default is true.

params.name: UnspecifiedLabel
params.description: Optional. Caption to appear inside the selector field when a selection has not been specified.

params.name: AuthToken
params.description: The concatenation of the user name, a colon (:) and the password.

params.name: Device
params.description: Optional. Name of the device that is making the request. Defaults to none.

params.name: Namespace
params.description: Optional. The namespace of the user. Defaults to none.

params.name: DataSource
params.description: Required. A Tag name, constant or expression that represents the value to show.

params.name: IndicatorImage
params.description: Required. The full path to the name of an image file to use as the indicator. Typically, this is an image of a needle.

params.name: OffsetFromCenter
params.description: The offset from the center to translate the image. This allows the user to change the rotation center point of the indicator image. The default is 0 which sets the bottom of the indicator image as the rotation center point.

params.name: Direction
params.description: A flag indicating the direction from the minimum to the maximum value representation. 0 means increase in a clockwise manner while 1 indicates a counter-clockwise manner. The default is 0 (clockwise).

params.name: MinimumAngle
params.description: The start angle of the sweep. 0 is defined as up or the 12 oâclock position. The default is 225.

params.name: MaximumAngle
params.description: The end angle of the sweep. 0 is defined as up or the 12 oâclock position. The default is 135.

params.name: Hue
params.description: The Hue translation to perform on the Indicator image. This enables you to change the color of the indicator image. The image must have color in it already to perform a hue translation. If there is no color to start with, then changing this value does nothing. You can add color by setting a value for the ColorizeHue parameter, described later. The default is 0, indicating that no hue translation is done and the indicator is in its native color.

params.name: Saturation
params.description: The amount of saturation of the colors in the indicator image. A value of 0 will make the image black and white (no color saturation). A value of 2 produces a brightly colored (saturated) indicator. The default is 1 which corresponds to the native saturation of the indicator image.

params.name: Brightness
params.description: An adjustment of the brightness of the indicator image. Higher numbers produce a brighter indicator image. A 0 produces a black image. The default is 1 which corresponds to the native brightness of the indicator image.

params.name: Transparency
params.description: An adjustment of the opacity of the indicator where 1 means 100% opacity and 0 means %100 transparent. The default is 1.

params.name: Contrast
params.description: An adjustment of the contrast of the colors in the indicator image. A value of 0 produces a flat looking image and a value of 2 gives a high contrast image. The default is 1 which corresponds to the native contrast of the indicator image.

params.name: ColorizeHue
params.description: A value that works in conjunction with ColorizeIntensity. This is the hue of the color that is introduced by colorizing an image. Colorizing an image will introduce color into an image that previously was black and white or grayscale. The default value is 0.

params.name: ColorizeIntensity
params.description: A value to define how much color to introduce into the image. The default is 0, meaning not to introduce any color at all into the image.

params.name: UseTagScaling
params.description: A flag that indicates whether to use the supplied Tagâs scaling values. The default is FALSE.

params.name: MinScaleValue
params.description: The minimum scale value to use if the UseTagScaling flag is not true. The default is 0.

params.name: MaxScaleValue
params.description: The maximum scale value to use if the UseTagScaling flag is not true. The default is 100.

params.name: DampenIndicator
params.description: A flag to indicate whether to dampen the indicator movement. Dampened movement creates the effect of animating the indicator. The default is false.

params.name: TagName
params.description: Required. The name of the Tag to use for scaling. If no tag is specified, then tag scaling cannot be used to automatically obtain the minimum and maximum scale values.

params.name: MinimumAngle
params.description: The start angle of the sweep. 0 is defined as up or the 12 oâclock position. The default is 225.

params.name: MaximumAngle
params.description: The end angle of the sweep. 0 is defined as up or the 12 oâclock position. The default is 135.

params.name: NumLabels
params.description: The number of Labels to show. The default is 5.

params.name: Font
params.description: The name of a font tag to use for the legend text.

params.name: Color
params.description: A color index for the color of the legend text. The default is 0 (black).

params.name: Direction
params.description: A flag indicating the direction from the minimum to the maximum value representation. 0 means increase in a clockwise manner while 1 indicates a counter-clockwise manner. The default is 0 (clockwise).

params.name: Orientation
params.description: A reserved parameter and should be set to 0.

params.name: UseTagScaling
params.description: A flag that indicates whether to use the supplied Tagâs scaling values. The default is false.

params.name: MinScaleValue
params.description: The minimum scale value to use if the UseTagScaling flag is not true. The default is 0.

params.name: MaxScaleValue
params.description: The maximum scale value to use if the UseTagScaling flag is not true. The default is 100.

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of one side of the radio buttons.

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the radio buttons.

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the radio buttons opposite to X1.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of the top or bottom of the radio buttons, whichever is the opposite to Y1.

params.name: Labels
params.description: Required. An array of text expressions used to label the buttons. The number of labels determines the number of buttons.

params.name: Select
params.description: Required. A variable whose value will be set to the index from 0 of the selected button. If the value of this variable is initially invalid, it will default to 0.

params.name: FocusID
params.description: An optional parameter that is any numeric expression from 0 to 32767 for the focus number of the first radio button. Each radio button following will have a focus ID number equal to the next number in sequence. If this value is 0, the radio buttons will display the current setting of Select, but its value will not be able to be changed and the buttons will appear grayed out. The default value is 1.

params.name: Border
params.description: Optional numeric that may have the following values: 0 = No outline 1 = Raised box outline (default) 2 = Bevel outline

params.name: Title
params.description: An optional parameter that is any text expression to be used as a title with the radio buttons. The default value is to have no title.

params.name: BtnsOnLeft
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) the radio buttons will appear to the left of their labels, if false (0) they will be to the right. The default value is true.
