params.name: AlignTitle
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) the title is drawn within the radio buttons' boundaries, if false(0) the buttons fill their bounding area and the title is added at the top (i.e. it extends past the top boundary). The default is true.

params.name: AllowTextResizing
params.description: An optional flag. If true, then text will resize with the control.

params.name: LeftToRight
params.description: An optional flag. If true, the buttons will be drawn from left to right.

params.name: BGColor
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression for the background color of the control. No default value.

params.name: FGColor
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression for the foreground color of the control (text color). No default value.

params.name: Spacing
params.description: Optional. Any of: FALSE/Invalid = Full spacing TRUE = Standard spacing Array = An array of numeric values, providing the spacing in pixels to be used between one button and the next.

params.name: EnableFlags
params.description: Optional.  An array of flags to enable or disable single buttons.

params.name: Height
params.description: Optional return value. If a variable is provided for this parameter the function will be set to the control's height, measured in pixels. Standard spacing will be used unless a spacing array has been provided.

params.name: DotColorParm
params.description: Optional color value, to be used for the radio dot.

params.name: TitleBGColor
params.description: Optional background color value to be used for the title bar.

params.name: TitleFGColor
params.description: Optional foreground color value to be used for the title text.

params.name: BevelColor
params.description: Optional color value to be used for the bevel line.

params.name: Address
params.description: Required. The address of the data to read. Depending on the driver protocol being used, this can be the starting register of the data to be read, a single address string, or an array of address strings.

params.name: N
params.description: Required.  If the PLC supports reading a range of registers, this must be the number of elements to read. If Address is an array, this must be the size of the array. Otherwise this should be set to 1. This must not exceed the driver's VTSMaxBlock value.

params.name: PtrDataDest
params.description: Required. A pointer to destination for the data. May be a pointer to a variable or the object value of a module that contains a NewData module. If a pointer and N is 1, this will be set to the value that was read. If N > 1, this will be set to an array of values that were read. If an object value, the object's NewData will be called with the value that was read. Will be set to Invalid if the read fails.

params.name: Info1
params.description: Driver dependent. The first grouping parameter.

params.name: Info2
params.description: The second grouping parameter.

params.name: Info3
params.description: The third grouping parameter.

params.name: DType
params.description: The data type to read from the I/O device.

params.name: CallBackModuleName
params.description: Required text value, which is the name of the module (either launched or a subroutine that returns Invalid) . The named module is launched in the caller.

params.name: File
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the absolute path and file name of the configuration file or the actual buffer containing its contents, depending on the UseBuff parameter.

params.name: Section
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the section in the file. This should not include the square brackets delimiting the section.

params.name: VarName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the variable for which the value is required.

params.name: UseBuff
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) the value of File must be a buffer, if false (0) it is a file that is to be used. The default used if this parameter is omitted is false.

params.name: Result
params.description: Required. A pointer to a value that, when all files have been read, is set to the dictionary of structures described in the comments section. If this is already a valid dictionary and the FileName parameter is valid, the data for the single file will be updated in the dictionary. This feature allow the publisher calls to Notifiy to update the structures.

params.name: ExternalLock
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set to TRUE if you do not want to acquire and release the lock. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: SuppressOrphanedComments
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set to TRUE to ignore "+PseudoProperty" - comments that are not associated with a property. Defaults to FALSE.
Optional. Any

params.name: ActivePtr
params.description: Required. A pointer to a variable that will be set to "1" when the Read lock is obtained.

params.name: Service
params.description: Required. The name by which the service is known.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression giving the 16-byte binary form of the globally unique identifier (GUID) for the application in which the service instance is located. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: File
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the full path and file name of the Settings file or the buffer containing its contents, depending on the IsBuffer parameter.

params.name: IsBuffer
params.description: An optional logical expression. Set TRUE if the File parameter is a buffer. Defaults to FALSE (0).

params.name: SuppressOrphanedComments
params.description: An optional logical expression. If TRUE then "+PseudoProperty"s - comments that aren't associated with a property will be left out. Defaults FALSE.

params.name: File
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the absolute path and file name of the Settings file or the name of the buffer containing its contents.

params.name: Section
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the section in the file. This should not include the square brackets delimiting the section.

params.name: UseBuff
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0) the value of File must be a pointer to a buffer, if false (0) it is a file that is to be used. The default used if this parameter is omitted is false.

params.name: PtrSectionStatus
params.description: A flag used to inform the caller of what was found, according to the following table: Value Meaning Invalid when either of the first 2 parameters are invalid 0 when both section and settings exist 1 when no section is found 2 when section is found, but not settings

params.name: ArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting point in the array in which to store the data. The subscript for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used. The array may be either statically declared or dynamically allocated.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to read starting at the element given by the first parameter. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: File
params.description: Required. A text expression giving the file name of the data file. It should be enclosed in double quotes if it is a constant. A known path Known Path Aliases for File-Related Functions for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: XArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting point in the array in which to store the X coordinates. The subscript for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used. The array may be either statically declared or dynamically allocated.

params.name: YArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting point in the array in which to store the Y coordinates. The subscript for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used. The array may be either statically declared or dynamically allocated.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to read starting at the elements given by the first two parameters. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: File
params.description: Required. A text expression giving the file name of the data file. It should be enclosed in double quotes if it is a constant. A known path Known Path Aliases for File-Related Functions for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: Service
params.description: The name by which the service is known.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression giving the 16-byte binary form of the globally unique identifier (GUID) for the application in which the service instance is located. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: Service
params.description: The name by which the service is known.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: An optional parameter that is any expression giving the 16-byte binary form of the globally unique identifier (GUID) for the application in which the service instance is located. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: SettingsFile
params.description:
Required. Text or Integer. The name of the settings file to be altered. As a convenience
                                this parameter can also be an integer
                                representing any of the four standard settings file
                                types as follows: 0 => workstation.Dynamic 1 => Settings.Dynamic 2 => workstation.Startup 3 => Settings.Startup

params.name: Section
params.description: Required. May be the name of the section that the property belongs to, or an array of section names. The section will be <hidden> or [visible] according to the optional Hide parameter.

params.name: Name
params.description: Required. May be the name of the property to modify, or an array of property names.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. May be the value to be set for the property, or an array of values matching the array of property names.

params.name: Comment
params.description: Optional. May be the comment to add to the property or an array of comments matching the array of property names. If invalid, the existing comment will be used.

params.name: CommitComment
params.description: Optional. The comment to be added when the change is committed to the repository.

params.name: Deploy
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to deploy the change immediately.

params.name: CallerHasLock
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE if the caller holds the layer lock in write mode.

params.name: ClearSection
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUE to empty the section (or sections if an array was provided), before writing the new value(s).

params.name: Workstation
params.description: Optional text. If an integer 0 or 2 was used for the SettingsFile parameter, then the name of the workstation should be provided. Defaults to the current workstation (WkStaInfo(0)) if missing or invalid.

params.name: Hide
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set TRUEto hide the section or FALSE to reveal it. Invalid will leave the section as it is.

params.name: UserID
params.description: Optional text. The user account to be associated with the revision. Defaults to the currently signed-in user.

params.name: Local
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the local device to redirect, for example "G:", "LPT1:", "DEF:" (default printer), etc.

params.name: Remote
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the network resource to map the local device to. If this parameter is an empty string or invalid, the current connection for the device Local is disconnected. If Local has any value other than "DEF:", this parameter must be the same form used by the Windowsâ¢ command prompt, "net use" function: "\\MyServer\MyPrinter" If Local has a value of "DEF:", the value of this parameter has three elements separated by commas, as follows: <printer name>, <driver name>, <port> Each of these elements must be valid to have a valid Remote parameter. If any are invalid, programs such as Print Manager may revert back to the previous valid printer, while other programs may have unpredictable behavior.

params.name: AlarmObject
params.description: Required. The object value of the new alarm to add to the configured alarm list. A variable called "Name" must exist within the scope of AlarmObject. This variable uniquely defines the text name of the alarm.

params.name: Enable
params.description: Required Logical Expression. Set to true if the alarm should start enabled. Defaults to "Enabled" if invalid or not defined.

params.name: Context
params.description: An object value of the context in which the discriminator module is to be called.

params.name: Station
params.description: A unique identifier for this discriminator instance.

params.name: Priority
params.description: The relative priority of this discriminator to others. Priorities are in the range of 0..99 with numerically higher priorities being called first.

params.name: MediaMode
params.description: specifies the media mode that this discriminator wishes to handle. Typically, this would specify AUDIO to handle incoming audio calls. The default is DATAMODEM which handles normal data calls. Please refer to the Comments section.

params.name: Voice
params.description: If this discriminator is to handle AUDIO calls, then this parameter specifies the text GUID of the voice to be used by the Text-to-Speech engine.

params.name: TimeOutVal
params.description: An AUDIO discriminator generally relies on some human-generated response. This parameter sets the number of seconds that the discriminator runs from before giving up. The default value is 20 seconds. Please refer to the Comments section  for further information.

params.name: Name
params.description: Usually Context will, when cast to a text value, identify the name of a variable in Code whose value is the object context for the discriminator. If this is not the case, then the name should be given here.

params.name: Challenge
params.description: A string to send in response to incoming calls that don't initially transmit any data.

params.name: ServiceName
params.description: Required. The name of the tag to register.

params.name: ListSource
params.description:
The object that is the source of this service's server list.
                 Should have the following callbacks (like LayerModule): ServerListSubscribe ServerListUnsubscribe GetServerList GetRPCServiceSettings Defaults to Layer object with this service's LocalGUID.

params.name: ListName
params.description: Name of the server list to use for this service. If invalid, the section name will be ServiceName. If ListSource is a Layer, then the list used follows the following rules of precedence: service and workstation-specific list, service-specific list, workstation-specific list, then default server list. If no lists can be found at all, this machine is assumed to be the sole server.

params.name: SemObj
params.description: An object value for an instance of the system Semaphore module. If Invalid, the RPC Manager will launch an instance of Semaphore for this service.

params.name: StartMode
params.description: The mode that the service instance will start up in or become when it loses its connection to the server instance. The mode of a service determines whether the RPC Manager transmits service broadcast messages from the server. You should supply the constant \RPC_ACCEPT_ALL (default) if your service requires no synchronization whatsoever. Otherwise, set it to \RPC_SYNC_MODE. Set TRUE to prevent server from sending Broadcast messages to us.

params.name: PrioritySync
params.description: When set to non-zero, the PrioritySync flag prevents higher priority servers from syncing with lower priority servers, forcing the lower server to synchronize with itself. Most system services do not set this flag.

params.name: ServerList
params.description: An optional parameter that is an array of server names for this service. If used, it overrides any server list configuration that has been done in the .RPC files. If not used, the usual method of determining the server list is used.

params.name: Sticky
params.description: An optional flag that causes this service to stick to a server, even if a higher order server comes online (see also sticky status).

params.name: Name
params.description: Required. Any text value for the name of the table.

params.name: Description
params.description: Required. Any text value for the description of the table

params.name: Columns
params.description: Required. May be either a dictionary or a callback module. If the first, then Columns will be a dictionary of structures that describing the column contained in the table. The dictionary keys should be the names of the columns. Use this option when the table will refer to a single tag or type of information where the column format is known. If the second, then a callback context may be provided where the module SQLQueryGetColumnInfo is called to retrieve the column info. If the current module contains this submodule (as is usually the case) then you will use Self() for this parameter. Use this option if the custom table may refer to multiple tag types, each having its own structure. Further information is provided in the comments section.

params.name: IsReadOnly
params.description: Required numeric. Set to 1 for read only. Writes (value 0) are not currently supported through the SQL interface.

params.name: CallbackObj
params.description: Required. The object value of a module which must contain a submodule named SQLQueryRetrieveData. In most cases, this will be stored in the current file, in which case self() should be used for this parameter. SQLQueryRetrieveData will be called by VTSSQLInterface\SQLQuery when it needs to retrieve data from the custom table. Further information is provided in the comments section.

params.name: SupportsTPP
params.description:
Required Boolean. Set TRUE if the table has support for additional TPP
                          tables. In this case SQLQueryRetrieveData will be
                          called with a TPP value specified at query-time.

params.name: TagID
params.description: Required string. The UniqueID of the tag from which to release the token.

params.name: TokenGUID
params.description: Required string. The GUID of the token to release

params.name: Custom
params.description: Optional. A structure of custom fields to log

params.name: Timestamp
params.description: Optional The UTC timestamp of this event. Defaults to current time

params.name: SessionID
params.description: Optional. The ID of session releasing the token. Relevant only if the token ownership is tied to the session.

params.name: AccountID
params.description: Optional. The Account ID of user releasing the token. Defaults to the currently signed-in user.

params.name: MachineID
params.description: Optional. The MachineIDof the workstation where this request originated. Defaults to the current machine.

params.name: Device
params.description: Optional. Name of client device

params.name: MachineStore
params.description: Required Boolean. If TRUE (non-zero), attempts to remove the certificate from a store in the Local Computer certificate hive. If FALSE (zero) attempts to remove the certificate from a store in the Current User certificate hive.

params.name: StoreName
params.description: Required text. The name of the store from which to remove the certificate.

params.name: Thumbprint
params.description: Required. A binary buffer holding the SHA1 thumbprint of the certificate to remove.

params.name: TagID
params.description: Required text. The unique ID of tag from which to remove the lock.

params.name: LockGUID
params.description: Required text. The lock record GUID of the lock. To find the lock record use a statement such as AlarmManager.GetAlarmList(...). RemoveLock is not not designed to be user-friendly. Most users should use the 'Remove' button in the Alarm List widget.

params.name: Note
params.description: Optional text. A note to log following the release operation.

params.name: Custom
params.description: Optional. A structure of custom fields to log.

params.name: Timestamp
params.description: Optional timestamp. UTC timestamp of this event. Defaults to current time.

params.name: SessionID
params.description: Optional text. The ID of the session where this function was called. Defaults to the current security session.

params.name: AccountID
params.description: Optional text. The AccountID of the user removing the lock. Defaults to the user signed in at the station where this function is called.

params.name: MachineID
params.description: Optional text. The workstation's MachineID. Defaults to the workstation from which this function is called.

params.name: Device
params.description: Optional text. The name of the client device.

params.name: Auto
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set true for automatic lock removal.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module or object value.

params.name: ParmNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the parameter to remove, beginning at 1.

params.name: Realm
params.description: Required. The name of the VTScada Realm to have its web service removed.

params.name: OldName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the current name of the file to be changed. A known path Known Path Aliases for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: NewName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the new name that the file is to be changed to. A known path alias may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the buffer to search. There is no limit on the size of the buffer.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the buffer offset from 0 to start the search. Must be non-negative, otherwise Invalid will be returned.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of buffer characters (bytes) to search.

params.name: Search
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the search string. The search is case sensitive. If an empty string is provided in this parameter, Replace will return the original text.

params.name: Replace
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the replace string.

params.name: NewS
params.description: Required. Any expression for the statement value of the new statement. (This value can be obtained using the Compile function.)

params.name: Location
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code value that indicates what statement to replace. (This value can be obtained using the Compile function.)

params.name: Size
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the size of the new statement text, in characters.

params.name: Adjust
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, the text in the file will be moved to allow for the statement that is being replaced. If false, the text will not be moved.

params.name: eMsg
params.description: Required. Any text containing the error message.

params.name: QualifierSet
params.description: Required. An additional error data dictionary.  This dictionary can accept any keys and values that can cast to strings. Each error generates a two-column table of information, built using this dictionary. The keys are displayed in the first column and the values are displayed in the second. Note that VTScada system code typically uses Setup.INI values to generate these strings so that they can be changed to suit different languages, but this is not a requirement.

params.name: UserAndSession
params.description: Optional. This parameter should  capture the user responsible for the operation that lead to the error. This  is required since users are linked to sessions that are only available to modules ultimately called by the Display Manager (that is, GUI objects). As a result, the "user and "session" often need to be captured earlier and passed to any modules likely to generate errors.

params.name: Silent
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, the error dialog will be suppressed. Defaults to  the application property, ReportErrorSilenceAll, or FALSE if not otherwise set.

params.name: HelpFile
params.description: Optional text. If the dialog is to have a help button, and you are using a custom help file, provide its name here. May be left blank if you are using the VTScada help file.

params.name: HelpID
params.description: Optional numeric. If the dialog is to have a help button, provide the ID value from the help file's Alias file to link to the correct topic.

params.name: TraceCategory
params.description: Optional. The category to use in the VTScada Trace program.

params.name: ApplicationGUID
params.description: Optional text.  Defaults to the current application's GUID. In the rare case where there can be ambiguity over which application caused the error, a GUID may be supplied for the source application.

params.name: Subscriber
params.description:
Required. Scope of the destination for the published
                                messages.

params.name: CallBack
params.description:
Optional. Name of the module to call in the
                                Subscriber when something is published.  If
                                invalid, this will default to "RepoNotify".

params.name: TagID
params.description: Required string. The UniqueID of the tag for which a token request is to be made.

params.name: Level
params.description: Optional numeric. The priority level of the token request. Defaults to 1.

params.name: Auto
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set to TRUE if the request is automatic and to FALSEif the request is manual. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Custom
params.description: Optional structure. A set of custom fields to log. Must be packed.

params.name: Timestamp
params.description: Optional timestamp. The UTC time of the request. Defaults to current time.

params.name: SessionID
params.description: Optional. The IDof the session adding the token. Relevant only if token ownership is tied to sessions.

params.name: AccountID
params.description: Optional. The IDof the user requesting the token. Defaults to the signed in user at the current workstation.

params.name: MachineID
params.description: Optional. The MachineIDof the workstation where the request was made. Relevant only if token ownership is tied to workstations.

params.name: Device
params.description: Optional. The IP address of a Thin Client device.

params.name: VoiceTalkStream
params.description: Required. A speech stream returned from VoiceTalk.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object (the object value of a running module instance).

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of the parameter of interest, starting from 1.

params.name: DataArray
params.description: Required. An array of fields and records to transpose

params.name: MakeSingle
params.description: Required. If true (1), and if the array size is 1 this indicates that the a single dimension array should be returned.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module or object value.

params.name: Unsync
params.description: An optional parameter that is any logical expression. If true (non-0), the module's .RUN file(s) are forced to be out of sync with the time stamp on its .SRC file(s). If false (0) the .RUN and .SRC files are synchronized. The default is 0.

params.name: X
params.description: Optional. Any variable, expression, constant or object value. It can be of any type.

params.name: Resettable
params.description: Optional Boolean. Defaults to TRUE. If present and set to FALSE, the return value will not reset to INVALID until another Return statement specifies otherwise. See comments.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the type of the Value parameter. Type Meaning 1 Short 2 Long (32-bit Integers) 3 64-bit Integers 4 Text

params.name: CommandID
params.description: Required. A variable holding the unique identifier for the activated command.

params.name: CommandData
params.description: Required. A variable holding any command-specific data.

params.name: CommandID
params.description: Required. The unique identifier of the command.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Horizontal coordinate within the nearest window at which to display the pop-up.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Vertical coordinate within the nearest window at which to display the pop-up.

params.name: CommandID
params.description: The unique command identifier of the gallery.

params.name: GalleryItems
params.description: A structure containing two members: Categories - A one-dimensional, ordered array of category labels. Each member of the Items array belongs to a category, identifying its category by the index into this array. The categories are displayed as headings within the gallery. If there are no categories, this member must be Invalid. Items - A one-dimensional, ordered array of RibbonItem structures. Each entry in the array represents an item or command in the gallery. These are displayed in the same order (within their category) as they appear in this array. RibbonItem structures are described in the comments section.

params.name: CommandID
params.description: Required. The unique identifier of the command. If set to zero, the property and value are applied to all elements of the ribbon, allowing all to be disabled or enabled with a single call.

params.name: Property
params.description: Required. An integer from the table that follows.

params.name: Value
params.description: Varies according to the property being set.

Property Value Property Meaning Value Type 0 Enable/Disable the command. If the command is disabled, all control representations of the command will be rendered grayed and the user will be unable to activate the command. Boolean: 0  (Disable). 1 (Enable) 1 Boolean value of the command. For example, a command intended to be represented by a toggle button or check-box would have Boolean value. Boolean 2 Numeric value of the command. Commands represented by a combo-box or spinner control use numeric values. Integer or double 3 String value. Commands represented by controls that display a string value use this to provide the value. Text 4 Minimum value. Commands represented by a spinner control use this to regulate the minimum value the user can select. Integer or double 5 Maximum value. Commands represented by a spinner control use this to regulate the maximum value the user can select. Integer or double 6 Label. The label displayed by a control that has a textual representation of the command, for example the text next to a button. Text 7 Description. The description displayed by a control that has a long textual description of a command, for example, a "MajorItems" button in a DropDownButton control. Text 8 Tooltip Title. The emboldened title displayed in a tooltip. Text 9 Tooltip Description. The textual description displayed in a tooltip. This is not emboldened and is displayed below the tooltip title (if any). Text 10 Key tip. Text that is displayed to assist the user when a key combination is bound to the key, e.g. "F9" or "Alt+U". Text 11 Small Image. The small (?x?) image displayed by a control. Image (see comments) 12 Large Image. The large (?x?) image displayed by a control. Image 13 Color. An RGB quad value for a command that is intended to be represented by a color picker control. Integer 14 Color Type.  An enumerated type for use by a command that is intended to be represented by a color picker control. Normally used in conjunction with the Color property. Integer as follows: 0 == no color 1 == automatic color 2 == RGB color value 15 Selected Item. Used for item galleries to force a specific item to be drawn as selected. Integer 16 Context Available. Commands whose representation is a contextual tab group have their visibility controlled by this. Boolean 17 Font. Commands represented by a font selection control have the values for the fields in the font control set by this property. A font command structure 18 Representative String. Supply a string for combo-box or spinner controls to set their width. The string will be used to measure how wide the control will be. Text 19 Increment. For spinner controls, the increment or decrement applied when the up or down arrow buttons are clicked. Integer or double 20 Decimal places. For spinner controls, the number of decimal places displayed. Integer

params.name: Name
params.description: Required. Any text expression that is the full path name of the directory to delete. A known path Known Path Aliases for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: DelAll
params.description: An optional parameter which, when set to 1, causes all files and sub-directories of the named directory to be deleted. Default: 0

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression which returns an object value. This is the object value for which the root transform is being sought.

params.name: Dictionary
params.description: Required. The name of the dictionary to find the root value of.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns an object value. This is the object value where the search starts for the root window.

params.name: Amount
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns a Normalize value, specifying how much to rotate.

params.name: MinDegrees
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the minimum amount of rotation, in degrees. This is not a limit on the amount of rotation.

params.name: MaxDegrees
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the maximum amount of rotation, in degrees. This is not a limit on the amount of rotation.

params.name: Center
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns a Point. This is the center point for the rotation.

params.name: Enable
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the condition that results in the timer counting. When this parameter is true (not 0), the timer is "running." When this parameter is false (0), the timer stops but the total time accumulated so far is maintained as the point which counting will start when the parameter becomes true again.

params.name: Time
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the time-out limit in seconds. When the cumulative time that Enable is true reaches this value, the function becomes true (1).

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module or object value.

params.name: BubbleHandle
params.description: Required bubble handle. A handle as returned by the Bubble and BubbleList functions. Specifies the bubble where the ModuleOrObject will be loaded and launched.

params.name: ThreadName
params.description: Required text. The name given to a new script thread that is started in the bubble. These names generally only appear in the user interfaces of debugging tools.

params.name: ModuleOrObject
params.description: Required. The root module that is loaded and launched into the bubble. It is always loaded and launched with no parent or caller.

params.name: ImportDictionary
params.description: Optional. If provided, a dictionary passed into this parameter allows the caller to specify a subset of variables, modules or both from the ModuleOrObject parameter that will be loaded, launched, or both, into the child bubble rather than simply loading and launching the entire module. This is of particular use when you want to be able to share the same code between modules running inside and outside of the child bubble. A complete description of this parameter is provided in the Bubble function.

params.name: Stream
params.description: Required. A packed RPC stream obtained from one or more PackRPC method calls.

params.name: Service
params.description: The name of the service to be used to determine root scope for the RPCs within Stream. Invalid for non-service RPCs. If valid, the RPC subroutines specified in the package will be searched for starting in the scope of the service instance of the machine on which the RunPack() RPC is executing.

params.name: NStatus
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of status type values to store in the file. Any functions used in this parameter must be able to be executed in a script, since triggering of the Save re-evaluates it as if it were in a script. Status types must be equal to a 0 or a 1. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.

params.name: NByte
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of values that are only one byte long. Any functions used in this parameter must be able to be executed in a script, since triggering of the Save re-evaluates it as if it were in a script. Byte types must be in the range 0 to 255 inclusive. This is a subset of the short type but require 50% less file space than short values and 75% less space than either long or float values. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.

params.name: NShort
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of short type values to store in the file. Any functions used in this parameter must be able to be executed in a script, since triggering of the Save re-evaluates it as if it were in a script. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.

params.name: NLong
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of long type values to store in the file. Any functions used in this parameter must be able to be executed in a script, since triggering of the Save re-evaluates it as if it were in a script. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.

params.name: NFloat
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of float type values to store in the file. Any functions used in this parameter must be able to be executed in a script, since triggering of the Save re-evaluates it as if it were in a script. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.

params.name: NText
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of text type values to store in the file. Any functions used in this parameter must be able to be executed in a script, since triggering of the Save re-evaluates it as if it were in a script. This value must be greater than or equal to 0.

params.name: TSize
params.description: Required. A short constant giving the number of characters to reserve for text values. Text values that are longer than this number will lose the characters that fall beyond this limit. All text values stored will have the same size.

params.name: Records
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of entries in the file. If the file is to be created full size (to prevent fragmenting of the file as it grows larger), the size should be multiplied by -1. Because the file is circular in nature, after this number of records have been written, new records will overwrite old ones, beginning with the oldest record in the file.

params.name: Buffers
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of records to keep in memory (RAM) before writing to disk. A value of 0 will result in the data being directly written to disk each time Trigger is true. Setting the buffer to large numbers speeds the average data logging rate substantially but requires RAM equal to the number of records specified by Buffers. When the RAM buffer is full the entire buffer is written to disk. If the buffer size is changed or if the Save is stopped (such as when VTScada stops), any data in the buffer is immediately written to disk. Also, if a Get is executed, any data in the buffer will be immediately written to disk, so that the user in ensured of getting all current data. Normally when Save stops, a record with all invalid fields, and the current time and date stamp, is written to the file. This indicates that data are no longer logged, and fields are unknown until Save resumes. If Buffers is negative, this invalid record is not written, and the number of buffered records is -Buffers - 1. This is to remain compatible with prior versions of VTScada. Be aware that any data held in a RAM buffer will be lost if VTScada is not correctly stopped (for example, a power failure).

params.name: File
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the file name for the historical data. Any path name, including any special, remote, and networked drive is allowed. The default extension is ".DAT" and the default path is the current application path (where VTScada was started). If the file name is prefixed with a period, the path will be to the directory the module is contained in.

params.name: Trigger
params.description: Required. Any resettable function whose transition from false to true indicates the data items V1, V2, ... are to be written to the file. The Save statement resets the Trigger parameter if the Trigger is true (not 0).

params.name: V1, V2, ...
params.description: Required. A series of expressions which give the values to be stored in the file. The parameters must be in the order: status, byte, short, long, float, and text. The number of each type is given by the NStatus, NByte, NShort, NLong, NFloat and NText parameters. There must be exactly the number of Vn parameters specified by each of these parameters.

params.name: Input
params.description: Required. Input stream, file name or full path to file name to be saved. Alternatively, may be a callback module that will write data. The callback module should be a launched module and may have two parameters. The first is required and must be a stream to which data will be written. The second is optional and  typically called pAbortSave, which is a pointer to a value that the callback can set to TRUE if the SaveFile operation is to be aborted. If that flag is set, anything that has already been written to the file will be discarded. If the destination already existed, it's original contents will have already been deleted so pAbortSave cannot be used to stop that from happening).

params.name: Destination
params.description: File name or path to save to.

params.name: MimeType
params.description: Mime type to send to the Anywhere Client in "view" mode.

params.name: DeleteOnCompletion
params.description: Optional Boolean. Defaults to False. Delete input on completion. Applies only when using a file name as the Input parameter. Does not apply to a stream.

params.name: pResultPath
params.description: Optional pointer to output destination. The output destination can be a string of the resulting file name including its path if the user selected a file, or can be Invalid if the user canceled the selection or the session is running on the Anywhere Client.

params.name: pCompletionVar
params.description: Optional pointer to percentage completion of writing the stream to the VIC. Invalid for the Anywhere Client or server sessions.

params.name: OpenFileDialog
params.description: Optional Boolean. TRUE to open FileDialogBox. Defaults to TRUE.

params.name: FilterPattern
params.description: Optional. Array of wildcard file patterns for the file types that will be offered to the user.

params.name: FilterDesc
params.description: Optional. Array of text values that are the descriptions corresponding to the FilePattern values.

params.name: FileExt
params.description: Optional text expression giving the default file extension to use if the user does not specify one.

params.name: Array2DElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting point into the two dimensional array containing the data to write to the file. The subscripts for the array may be any numeric expression, but both must be specified. The format of the array is the same as that returned by GetHistory: [column][record]. Column 0 is the timestamp in seconds since January 1, 1970, while each subsequent column is the data for that record in the same order used by the Save function that created the .DAT file. Extra columns are ignored, but if there are fewer columns than required to specify all fields in the .DAT file then the function fails and does nothing.

params.name: Num
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of records to write to the file.

params.name: File
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the file name for the historical data file. If this file does not exist the SaveHistory function will create it with default format (see Comments). The file extension is optional and will default to ".DAT" if omitted.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Historical data files use an invalid record to mark discontinuities in the recorded data. Under certain circumstances, it may be desirable to manipulate these records. This optional parameter provides the mechanism to do so. The mode parameter has the following options: (Defaults to 0) Value Meaning 0 Add data after the previous record according to time stamp, and donât write an invalid record (default). 1 No longer used 2 Add data according to time stamp. If previous record is invalid, overwrite it, write data, and then write an invalid record after it. 3 Perform a tidy closedown of a file which has been written with Mode = 2. 4 Specifies that SaveHistory should perform a special merge of the supplied data into the referenced data file. The aim of the special merge is remove invalid records unless the existing and the incoming data both agree that they should exist in the file. The aim of this mode is to assist the resolution of data at primary and backup log servers.

params.name: BitmapHandle
params.description: Required. The handle to the image to be saved.

params.name: Filename
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the name to be given to the new file.

params.name: MIMEType
params.description: Optional text for the format to be used. Defaults to "image/png" if not specified. Options include "image/bmp", "image/jpeg", "image/gif", "image/tiff", and "image/png".

params.name: Width
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression for the width of the image in pixels. Defaults to the native size of the image.

params.name: Height
params.description: Optional. Any numeric expression for the height of the image in pixels. Defaults to the native size of the image.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. Any expression for the module or object value.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the value to be scaled.

params.name: In1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the minimum of Value's unscaled range. This parameter corresponds to Out1. This is usually the "zero" for the unscaled Value.

params.name: In2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the maximum of Value's unscaled range. This parameter corresponds to Out2. In2 must not equal In1.

params.name: Out1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the minimum of Value's scaled output range. This parameter corresponds to In1. This is usually the "zero" for the scaled Value.

params.name: Out2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the maximum of Value's scaled output range. This parameter corresponds to In2.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value (module) where Member may be found.

params.name: Member
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the member name. This must be a simple variable or module.

params.name: ScopeLocal
params.description: Optional. A Boolean expression. Defaults to FALSE if missing, invalid or if a non-Boolean is provided. If set TRUE then the call will not search up the scope tree for name matches.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value (module) where Member may be found.

params.name: Member
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the member name. This must be a simple variable or module. Array references or further scope resolution are not allowed inside the text expression.

params.name: ArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting point in the array. The subscript for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array elements to use starting at the element given by the first parameter. If N extends past the upper bound of the lowest array dimension, this computation will "wrap-around" and resume at element 0, until N elements have been processed.

params.name: HeadingFont
params.description: Required. The font to use for the heading.

params.name: HeadingTextColor
params.description: Required. The color to be used for the heading text.

params.name: HeadingBackColor
params.description: Required. The color to be used as the background for the heading text.

params.name: Privilege
params.description: Required. A privilege number to be used in the security check. System Privilege Reference for Programmers

params.name: Suppress
params.description: Optional. A Boolean indicating whether a privilege refusal dialog should be displayed if the SecurityCheck fails. TRUE to suppress the dialog. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: AccountName
params.description: Optional. The name or AccountID of an account against which to check the privilege. Defaults to the callerâs account.

params.name: DenyCaller
params.description: Optional. The object value of the caller to use when launching the privilege refusal dialog. Defaults to the callerâs user session. This is used to control the lifetime of the dialog until dismissed by user action.

params.name: TagName
params.description: Optional. The name of a tag that will be used in the security check.

params.name: Stream
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns the stream to do the Seek on

params.name: Position
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that returns either the absolute position, or a relative amount to move the position, depending on Mode. If the mode is relative, this number may be negative (i.e. earlier in the stream).

params.name: Mode
params.description: An optional numeric expression that denotes which type of positioning to do. If equal to 0, the stream position is changed to Position (absolute mode). If equal to 1, the Position is added to the current stream position (relative mode ). Defaults to 0.

params.name: Label
params.description: Required text. Sets the title of the color selection dialog.

params.name: ColorIndex
params.description: Required text. The selected color value will be returned via this parameter.

params.name: Enable
params.description: Required Boolean. Must be set to TRUE for the color picker to open. This parameter is set to FALSE by the color picker upon closing. Use this as a signal that the user has chosen a color.

params.name: NoTrans
params.description: Boolean. Deprecated option - all transparent options are shown.

params.name: ShowColorIndex
params.description: Optional Boolean. When true, the string value, "<aaRRGGBB>" of the selected color is shown. Defaults to true.

params.name: DisplayRoot
params.description: Optional object value. For example, to make the dialog appear on a monitor than the one holding the window that contains the caller of SelColor (or if the caller of SelColor is not running inside a window), you can pass an object into DisplayRoot to specify the monitor that the dialog should appear on. You would pass in an object running in a window on the desired monitor. Thus, to make the dialog appear on the same window as a pop-up page, you would pass in the popup page object.

params.name: DisableAlpha
params.description: Disable transparency options in the color picker. This Parameter is false by default meaning transparency settings are enabled, if set to True Transparency settings are disabled.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that identifies the window.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the left side coordinate of the area.

params.name: Bottom
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the bottom side coordinate of the area.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the right side coordinate of the area.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the top side coordinate of the area.

params.name: MustContain
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, an object will be selected only if it is completely enclosed by the area. Otherwise, an object will be selected if any part of that object falls within the area.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that identifies the window containing the graphic.

params.name: CodePointer
params.description: Required. Any code pointer value expression for the graphic object. (see comments)

params.name: Statement
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code value of the statement to select.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that identifies the module instance where Statement is found.

params.name: Index
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the function within Statement.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that identifies the window.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the x-axis coordinate of the selection point.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the y-axis coordinate of the selection point.

params.name: Dist
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the maximum distance a graphic may be from (X,Y) and still be considered for selection.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the object to select. 0 is the first object, 1 is the next, and so on. This allows selection of graphics that are 'underneath' other graphics.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value which identifies the window.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the x-axis coordinate of the selection point.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the y-axis coordinate of the selection point.

params.name: DragAll
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, dragging a handle will drag all selected handles at (X,Y). Otherwise, only the first selected handle (in the topmost layer) will drag.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value which identifies the window.

params.name: HandleNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the handle number which you wish to choose. The handles are numbered as follows. 0 1 2 6 8 7 3 4 5

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any expression for the object value that identifies the window.

params.name: CodePointer
params.description: Required. Any expression for the code pointer value of the path to select.

params.name: ServiceName
params.description: Required. The name of the service to transmit to. For directed RPCs, set this value to either Invalid or a zero-length string.

params.name: RemoteGUID
params.description: Required. The GUID of the application to receive the RPC. If Invalid, RemoteGUID is searched for in the caller's scope. The RemoteGUID parameter MUST be a binary GUID. GetGUID() can be used to convert a text GUID into a binary GUID if required.

params.name: ModeCutOff
params.description: Required. The service synchronization mode above which this message should not be sent. Normal RPCs should set this to RPC_ACCEPT_ALL mode.

params.name: SendServer
params.description: Required. If set to "1", this flag will transmit this RPC to the service instance that is currently the server for the service. Ignored for directed RPC requests.

params.name: MachineName
params.description: Required. The IP or name of the workstation to be used for a directed RPC. Invalid for service RPCs.

params.name: SendClients
params.description: Required. May be any of the following: 0: Do not send to clients 1: Transmit this RPC to all service instances that are currently clients of the service server. Ignored for directed RPC requests. 2: Send to all clients that are on the local machine's list of potential service servers.

params.name: ExecLocally
params.description: Required. ExecLocally only has an effect on directed RPCs (i.e. not on service RPCs). If ExecLocally is TRUE, the RPC is forced to execute on the local machine ONLY.

params.name: Recursive
params.description: Required. If set to "1", and SendClients is also set to "1", this flag will transmit this RPC to all service instances that are clients of this workstation and all service instances that are clients of them. If set to a "1" and SendServer is also a "1", will transmit to servers of this workstation and servers of those workstations. This is of use when "clients of clients" are configured. In most cases, it is wise to set this flag when making service broadcast updates.

params.name: ModuleName
params.description: Required. The textual name of the RPC subroutine to be executed. Must be valid.

params.name: ModuleContext
params.description: Required. The context in which the "ModuleName" will be executed. The "base" context for a VTScada layer-based application is "Code". "." may be used as an alias for the  object that registered for the RPC service. See comments. For a non-VTScada (pure script) application, the base context is the root of the application specified by the RemoteGUID parameter. Must be valid.

params.name: UpdateObject
params.description: Required. If valid, is an object that will act as a holding point for the RPC until it is actually transmitted to the remote workstation. A subsequent RPC with the same UpdateObject value will discard the previous RPC if it has not yet been transmitted, and replace it with the new one. This is of most use to services whose updates completely negate the effect of previous updates, and serves to minimize the transmission of redundant RPCs.

params.name: InputSessionID
params.description: Required. If Invalid, the RPC will be queued for transmission. If valid, will be interpreted as a SID which must match the current SID for the multi-server application. Otherwise, the RPC will not be queued for transmission. Only of use in directed RPCs.

params.name: Parameters
params.description: A set of up to 32 parameters to the RPC subroutine. Can be any mixture of the legal types. Supplying a parameter of an illegal type will cause it to be replaced with Invalid when the RPC subroutine is invoked.

params.name: Server
params.description: Required. Any text or buffer expression of the mail server name or IP address

params.name: To
params.description: Required. Any text or buffer expression of the address of destination

params.name: From
params.description: Required. Any text or buffer expression of the address of the person from whom the mail is from

params.name: Subject
params.description: Required. Any text or buffer expression of the subject of the message

params.name: Message
params.description: Required. Any text or buffer expression of the message - no attachments

params.name: Error
params.description: Required. A pointer to an error variable, set to 0 if OK. The Error parameter should initially be set Invalid by the caller. When this method is done, it will set Error to one of the following values: The following error codes are produced by VTScada. Your email server may produce others. Error Meaning 0 Mail has been successfully sent. 1 Unable to open a connection to the server. 2 Server did not send a good SMTP welcome message. 3 Server rejected SMTP HELO message. 4 Server rejected SMTP MAIL message. 5 Server rejected SMTP RCPT message. 6 Server rejected SMTP DATA message. 7 Server rejected message body. 8 Badly formatted TO: address. 9 Server does not support AUTH. 10 Server does not support implemented AUTH. mechanisms. 11 Failure to login to SMTP server. 12 TLS wanted for SMTP, but not available 13 TLS unavailable or negotiation with server failed 14 Badly formatted bcc address

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or serial stream value (returned from a SerialStream function).

params.name: Status
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true (non-0), a break will be sent to the serial port defined in Port, if false (0), the break will be cleared from the serial port.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or serial stream value (returned from a SerialStream function).

params.name: Reset
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true (non-0), the serial port status register will be cleared.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the serial port number to be used. For COM1: Port = 1. For COM2: Port = 2. The valid range for Port is 1 to 4096.

params.name: ReceiveLen
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the size of the receiver buffer in bytes. ReceiveLen must be in the range 2 to 32766. If more bytes are received than can fit in the receive buffer before your application removes them using SerRcv or a similar VTScada function, the additional data will be lost.

params.name: TransmitLen
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the size of the transmitter buffer in bytes. TransmitLen must be in the range 2 to 32766. The buffer must be large enough to hold the maximum number of bytes pending transmission at any instance.

params.name: Baud
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the baud rate. Baud must be in the range 10 to 57600, and must divide evenly into 115200 with no more than 2.5% error.

params.name: DataBits
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of data bits per character. DataBits must be 5, 6, 7, or 8.

params.name: StopBits
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of stop bits per character. StopBits must be 1 or 2.

params.name: Parity
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the parity checking to use: Parity Checking 0 No parity 1 Odd parity 2 Even parity 3 0 Stick (space parity) 4 1 Stick (mark parity)

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: Peek
params.description: Required. Any status expression to control whether the byte being read should also be removed from the receive buffer. If Peek is true, the byte is not removed from the receive buffer.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any status expression. If Option is true, the number of bytes in the transmit buffer is returned. If Option is false, the number of bytes in the receive buffer is returned.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the byte value to send. Value must be in the range 0 to 255.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: Count
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which gives the number of bytes to read. Value must be in the range 0 to 65500.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or serial stream value (returned from a SerialStream function).

params.name: Level
params.description: Required. TRUE if the RTS line is to be turned on or false if the RTS line is to be turned off.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text expression to send.

params.name: MaxBytes
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the maximum number of bytes to send.

params.name: Escape
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the byte value of an escape code. Whenever an escape code is encountered, two escape codes will be transmitted. To be valid, Escape must be in the range of 0 to 255. If the Escape parameter is greater than 0 or less than 256, it is transmitted with escape codes. If Escape is a value greater than 255, it will perform in the same manner that it would if Escape were a value of 0. If the value of Escape is less than 0, it doesn't take into account escape codes and the buffer is transmitted in its entirety, stopping at MaxBytes.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text variable to write the received data. This text buffer must already exist. It could be created by another function such as MakeBuff, or by assignment of a text constant.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the offset from zero where SerStrEsc will start writing data to Buffer.  If Offset is negative, Offset is returned and nothing is done.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Either a numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: Escape
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the terminating character code. This must be in the range 0 to 255 to be valid. A value of -1 means that no such code exists.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text buffer to write the received data to. It must already exist - either by creating it with a function such as MakeBuff, or assignment of a text constant.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which gives the offset from 0 where SerString will start writing data to Buffer.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: String
params.description: Required. Any text expression which gives the terminating string.

params.name: Obsolete
params.description: Parameter is no longer used, but is maintained for backward compatibility with previous versions of VTScada. Set to 0.

params.name: Domain
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the domain. If this is invalid, the current domain will be used.

params.name: Obsolete
params.description: Parameter is no longer used, but is maintained for backward compatibility with previous versions of VTScada. Set to 0.

params.name: Handle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the handle returned by the SocketServerStart function.

params.name: Port
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the serial port number (opened with a ComPort function) or any stream value.

params.name: Count
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which gives the number of bytes to wait for. Value must be in the range 0 to 65500.

params.name: NewVal
params.description: The value to write to the tag.

params.name: NDrivers
params.description: Required. Any number of drivers in the Buffer.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. A stream containing all of the data.

params.name: Vals
params.description: Required. A packed array of driver values.

params.name: TimeStamp
params.description: Required. A packed array of driver values.

params.name: Attrib
params.description: Required. A packed array of driver values.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression that gives the number to modify the bit in.

params.name: BitNumber
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the bit number to set or clear. Bit 0 is the least significant bit. Legal values are from 0 to 31 inclusive.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any status expression indicating whether the bit is to be set or cleared in the Value. A true indicates that the bit is to be set (i.e. set to 1), and a false indicates that it is to be cleared (i.e. set to 0).

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any buffer expression giving the buffer to set. This buffer must already exist. It could be created by a function such as MakeBuff, or by assignment of a text constant.

params.name: Offset
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the offset from the start of the buffer in bytes, starting from 0.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the byte value to write at Offset bytes from the beginning of Buffer.

params.name: MachineStore
params.description: Required Boolean. If TRUE (non-zero) attempts to find the certificate in a store in the Local Computer certificate hive. If FALSE (zero) attempts to find a certificate in a store in the Current User certificate hive.

params.name: StoreName
params.description: Required text. The name of the store in which to search for the certificate.

params.name: Thumbprint
params.description: Required. A binary buffer holding the SHA1 thumbprint of the certificate to locate.

params.name: Property
params.description: Required integer. The identifier of a property to set. Properties are identified by numbers.

params.name: PropertyValue
params.description: Required text. The text to which the property will be set.

params.name: Date
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the new date, in days since 1 January 1970.

params.name: Time
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the new time, in seconds since midnight.

params.name: CodeValue
params.description: Required. Any code value giving the statement whose text is to be replaced..

params.name: NewText
params.description: Required. Any text or a buffer

params.name: Reserved
params.description: Optional. Set to Invalid

params.name: TextInDescription
params.description: Optional text. Filters for alarms with a matching description. Wild cards are allowed.

params.name: TextInDescription_Case
params.description: Optional Boolean. True if the text in the description filter is case-sensitive.

params.name: TagName
params.description: Optional text. Filter for alarms with a matching tag name. Wild cards are allowed.

params.name: TagName_UniqueID
params.description: Optional text. Filter for alarms with a matching unique ID value.

params.name: TagName_Children
params.description: Optional Boolean. Set to TRUE to include children of the tags.

params.name: Area
params.description: Optional text. Filter for alarms with a matching area value

params.name: Priority
params.description: Required numeric. Filter for alarms with a matching priority.

params.name: Priority_orHigher
params.description: Required Boolean. Set to TRUEto include alarms with a priority higher than that specified.

params.name: User
params.description: Required text. Filter for alarms handled by the matching user.

params.name: Reserved
params.description: Set to Invalid.

params.name: Action
params.description: Optional text. Filter for alarms with the matching action string (Trip, Rearm, Shelve, etc)

params.name: DateRange_Start
params.description: Optional timestamp. Filter for alarms later than this date and time.

params.name: DateRange_End
params.description: Optional timestamp. Filter for alarms earlier than this date and time.

params.name: Units
params.description: Optional text. Filter for alarms with the matching units.

params.name: ShowShelved
params.description: Optional Boolean. True to show shelved alarm records.

params.name: ShowConfig
params.description: Optional Boolean. True to show configuration records.

params.name: SearchString
params.description: Optional text. Search field string.

params.name: NewVal
params.description: Required text. The new value, to which CurrentRecipe should be set. This must use the phrase key of the recipe name, not the displayed name in the current language. Refer to your language .CSVfile to find the matching phase key. Related information: Languages

params.name: PickFirstVersion
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE(the default), the version is set to the alphabetically first version. If FALSE, the version is set to the alphabetically last version.

params.name: NewVal
params.description: Required numeric. The version to set.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Usually a numeric expression giving the cursor type to display according to the following table, but may also be a text argument giving the full path of the image file to be loaded as the cursor. Most of the common image files formats can be used. If giving the image file, the size of the cursor will be the system default. Type Cursor Type -1 Set the cursor to the parent window's cursor 0 Normal Select (Standard arrow) 1 Busy (Waiting hourglass) 2 Text Select (Text I-beam) 3 Precision Select (Crosshairs) 4 Unavailable (Slashed circle) 5 Move (Four-pointed arrow pointing north, south, east, and west) 6 Diagonal Resize 2 (Double-pointed arrow pointing northeast and southwest) 7 Vertical Resize (Double-pointed arrow pointing north and south) 8 Diagonal Resize 1 (Double-pointed arrow pointing northwest and southeast) 9 Horizontal Resize (Double-pointed arrow pointing west and east) 10 Alternate Select (Vertical arrow) 11 Working in Background (Standard arrow and small hourglass) 12 Help Select (Standard arrow and small hourglass)

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object expression that identifies the window.

params.name: Title
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the new topic name.

params.name: Variable
params.description: Required. Any expression for the variable value.

params.name: Default
params.description: Required. Any expression for the new default value.

params.name: Service
params.description: Required. The name by which the service is known.

params.name: MachineName
params.description: Required. A machine name or IP by which the synchronizing client is known.

params.name: OptGUID
params.description: An optional GUID of the application in which the service instance is located. The default is the application to which the caller belongs.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object expression that identifies the window.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the new edit mode: Mode Edit Mode 0 Disable mouse actions 1 Enable mouse actions 2 Toggle mouse on/off

params.name: TagName
params.description: Required. The name of the tag that owns the alarm.

params.name: AlarmObj
params.description: Required. An instance of the alarm module.

params.name: Disable
params.description: Boolean. Set TRUE to disable the alarm, FALSE to enable.

params.name: FeedBack
params.description: Numeric. Indicates the result of the action. Set to 1 if the alarm was enabled or disable, and 0 if no operation was performed.

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name of the file. A known path alias for File-Related Functions may be provided in the form, :{KnownPathAlias}.

params.name: Attributes
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression which designates the attributes to be set. This parameter is formed by adding together numbers from the following table: Value Bit No Attribute 0 - Normal 1 0 Read only 2 1 Hidden 4 2 System 8 3 Archive Optionally if mode is 1, may be a timestamp. (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations )

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object expression which identifies the window.

params.name: Object
params.description: Required. The object value of a module instance that is running inside the window whose help context is to be affected.

params.name: HelpFileName
params.description: Required. The file name of the help file to use if the user presses F1 while the specified window is the active window. If Invalid, the parent window of the specified window will be checked for a help file reference. This continues recursively until the top of the window tree is reached. If no help file name is found, the default VTScada help file is used. The default help reference can be set by adding the variable "WEBHelp" to the [System] section of the Setup.INI file, or by using the EnableHelp statement. The help file name may be any .CHM format help file, typically added to the VTScada installation folder. (The .HLP format is obsolete and will not open in modern versions of Windows.) If you have created a NetHelp (DocToHelp format) or MadCapWebHelp (Flare format) help system, use the strings, "MyHelpFolder\NetHelp" or "MyHelpFolder\MadCapWebHelp" respectively, where MyHelpFolder points to the folder containing your custom help system. To use the default VTScada Help system, enter simply: \DevHelpFile without quotation marks.

params.name: HelpContext
params.description: Optional help context. If absent or invalid, but the HelpFileName is valid, then the default home page of the help file or system is displayed when the user presses F1. If valid and numeric, the help file is searched for a topic with a matching alias number and help is displayed for that topic. If there is no topic with a matching alias ID value, then NetHelp and MadCapWebHelp formats will open to the default home page. CHM formats will not open. If valid and textual, and if the help file is .CHMformat, then the help file is searched for an exact match on the text string in the topic index of the help file. If there is more than one text match, the index is positioned at the first partial string match.
