params.name: Object
params.description: Required. Any object value expression for any module instance in the application.

params.name: FileName
params.description: Required text. The path and name of the CSV file containing X and Y values for a graph.

params.name: Input
params.description: Required numeric. An X value, for which this function will return an interpolated Y value. This value must be within the range of X values found in the given CSV file.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required numeric. Sets the type of interpolation to use. Set to 0 for linear interpolation. Set to 1 to return the Y value associated with the closest X value.

params.name: ErrorTag
params.description: Optional tag object. If provided, this must be an analog tag (typically an I/O tag in Analog mode). The value of that tag will be set according as follows: Value Meaning 0 Success 1 No file 2 Bad file (Includes a header or does not hold X,Y data points sorted by ascending X value .) 3 Input exceeds the maximum X value in the CSV file 4 Input is less than the minimum X value in the CSV file 5 Input value not provided 6 Mode not set to 0 or 1

params.name: DSNSource
params.description: Required. Data source name of the database to retrieve data from.

params.name: DSNDest
params.description: Required. Data source name of the destination database to send data to

params.name: TableName
params.description: Required. Table name to read/write in both databases

params.name: WhereFields
params.description: Required. A text array of field names to select using an SQL WHERE clause

params.name: WhereOperators
params.description: Required. A text array of operators to use when selecting fields using an SQL WHERE clause

params.name: WhereValues
params.description: Required. A text array of values to use when selecting the above fields using an SQL WHERE clause

params.name: WhereSQLDataTypes
params.description: Required. Values indicating the data type of the Where values. Should be a simple value or an array matching the WhereFields parameter. Refer to Data Type Codes used in the ODBC Manager for a list of the codes.

params.name: WhereAND
params.description: Required. Set to true (1)  if  the fields in the SQL WHERE clause are to be AND'ed. Otherwise, OD'ed

params.name: SourceUsername
params.description: Required. User name for source db

params.name: SourcePass
params.description: Required. A password for source db

params.name: DestUsername
params.description: Required. A user name for destination db

params.name: DestPass
params.description: Required. A password for destination db

params.name: TransObj
params.description: The object value of transaction

params.name: NRecords
params.description: Required. A number of records to synchronize

params.name: CurrRecord
params.description: Required. Current record being written

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression to be normalized.

params.name: LowInput
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which represents the lowest normal input value of Value. This is not a limit.

params.name: HighInput
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which represents the highest normal input value of Value. This is not a limit.

params.name: LowScale
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which represents the lowest normal scaled value of Value. This is not a limit.

params.name: HighScale
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression, which represents the highest normal scaled value of Value. This is not a limit.

params.name: Mode
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. Deprecated, but must be present and valid.

params.name: Freq
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression. Deprecated, but must be present and valid.

params.name: TagReference
params.description: Required. A reference to the tag for which the unlinked widget, questionable, manual or dummy tag indicator should be shown.

params.name: ShowInConfigParm
params.description: Optional Boolean. If TRUE, the marker will be visible (but blank) in the Idea Studio. Defaults to FALSE.

params.name: Angle
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the angle in radians.

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of one side of the screen area ("target").

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the screen area ("target").

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X coordinate on the screen of the side of the "target" opposite to X1.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y coordinate on the screen of either the top or bottom of the target, whichever is the opposite of Y1.

params.name: Buffer
params.description: Required. Any text or buffer expression. This serves as the initial content of the stream.

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the X screen coordinate of the lower left corner of the text on the screen.

params.name: Y
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the Y screen coordinate of the lower left corner of the text on the screen.

params.name: Value
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the value to display.

params.name: Foreground
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the color of the characters to display.

params.name: Fill
params.description: Obsolete - set to zero.

params.name: Background
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the color of the background area for the output characters.

params.name: Size
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the height of the characters in units of Y screen coordinates. If this value results in a specification of less than 12 screen pixels high, the text will be the small text (8 pixels high). Otherwise, the text will be the large text. If Size is negative, it will be interpreted as a dot text output of size equivalent to the absolute value of the size. The number will be displayed to the nearest multiple of the base 8 pixel by 8 pixel text. This produces faster, non-destructive large characters than the normal large text characters. Setting size greater than 12 results in non-XOR drawing.

params.name: Obsolete
params.description: No longer used, but is maintained for backward compatibility with previous versions of VTScada. Set to 0.

params.name: Text
params.description: Required. Any text expression.

params.name: Font
params.description: Required. Any font expression.

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the desired parameter: Option Parameter 0 Width of text in pixels 1 Height of text in pixels

params.name: X1
params.description: Required. The left side coordinate.

params.name: Y1
params.description: Required. The bottom side coordinate.

params.name: X2
params.description: Required. The right side coordinate.

params.name: Y2
params.description: Required. The top side coordinate.

params.name: Msg
params.description: Required. The message buffer to display.

params.name: FontVal
params.description: Required. The font to use (defaults to \_DialogFont).

params.name: Style
params.description: Required. The bevel/border/wordwrap requirements. This can be one of: Bit 0 Draw a bevel at X1/Y1/X2/Y2. An 8-pixel margin will be added when determining the text rectangle. The default is TRUE. Bit 1 Draw a border around the text rectangle. A further 4-pixel margin will be added. The default is TRUE. Bit 2 Word wrap text. The default is TRUE. Bit 3 Transparent background. Can be clicked-through to the controls beneath. Default is FALSE Bit 4 Disables the vertical scroll bar when TRUE. Default is FALSE Bit 5 Disables the horizontal scroll bar when TRUE. Default is FALSE. (See: Bitwise Parameters & Operations )

params.name: Bit 1
params.description: Bit 2

params.name: Bit 3
params.description: Bit 4

params.name: InputText
params.description: Required text. The information to be encoded.

params.name: ErrMsgOut
params.description: Optional return parameter. If provided, this will be set to a text representation of the error.

params.name: InputCharacterSet
params.description: Optional text. The IANA character set name to use. Defaults to the character set given by the local system code page.

params.name: OutputCharacterSet
params.description: Optional text. The IANA character set name to use for output. Defaults to "UTF-8".

params.name: IP
params.description: Required. The IP that you want converted to Binary format. Formatting example 192.168.0.200.

params.name: CodeValue
params.description: Required. Any code value expression for the item.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the value type of CodeValue.

params.name: ArrayElem
params.description: Required. Any array element giving the starting index for the array operation. The index for the array may be any numeric expression. If processing a multidimensional array, the usual rules apply to decide which dimension should be used.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the number of array elements to search. If N plus the starting element is larger than the size of the remaining array, then this function will "wrap around" to restart at the first element. For this to have any useful result, the array would need to be sorted to match before running TextSearch.

params.name: Text
params.description: Required. Any text string to search for. Does not take an expression.

params.name: Case
params.description: Required. Any logical expression. If true, the search is case-sensitive. Otherwise, the search is case-insensitive.

params.name: TypeText
params.description: Optional. A numeric expression that controls the type of sort according to the following table. Defaults to zero - numeric sorting. TypeText Sort Performed 0 Reserved 1 Alphabetic sort 2 Reserved 3 Lingual sort 4 Reserved
Locale

params.name: CmpFlags
params.description: A set of flags directing how the comparison should be done, as described in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/api/stringapiset/nf-stringapiset-comparestringex Supported flags include: #NORM_IGNORECASE #NORM_IGNORENONSPACE #NORM_IGNORESYMBOLS #LINGUISTIC_IGNORECASE #LINGUISTIC_IGNOREDIACRITIC #NORM_IGNOREKANATYPE #NORM_IGNOREWIDTH #NORM_LINGUISTIC_CASING #SORT_DIGITSASNUMBERS #SORT_STRINGSORT

params.name: CodeValue
params.description: Required. Any code value expression for the item.

params.name: Type
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression for the value type of CodeValue.

params.name: Array
params.description: Required. A variable which will be set to an array upon completion of the data retrieval.

params.name: N
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of array entries to create.

params.name: File
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the file name for the historical data file. The file extension should not be added to the name since the default of ".DAT" is automatically added.If the file name is prefixed with a period, the path will be to the directory the module is contained in.

params.name: FieldNum
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the field number to be read from the file. The value number for the actual data starts at 0 and corresponds to the columns specified in Save or SaveHistory. It is also possible to retrieve time data associated with each record by setting this parameter to a negative value.Time options are: FileNum Time Option -1 Time of day only -2 Date only -3 Time since January 1, 1970 It is possible to retrieve more than one field in a single TGet statement. To do this, pass an array of values in as the FieldNum parameter.

params.name: Module
params.description: Required. A module pointer or a text expression giving the module to run. If the module is in scope, the text expression giving its name may be used, otherwise the module pointer returned from either a LoadModule or FindVariable statement is typically used.

params.name: Parent
params.description: Required. The object value of the module where Module is to resolve its global variable references. If a valid non-object value is supplied Module will resolve its global variable references to the scope defined by the first parameter. If this is invalid, the module will still run, but global references will be invalid.

params.name: Caller
params.description: Required. The object value of the window to draw in. This specifies the module instance where Module acts as if it were called from. If this is invalid, the module will still run but will not stop without a Slay. If it is valid, the module will stop when the Caller module instance stops or when a Slay is executed upon it.

params.name: Name
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the name that is to be associated with this particular thread. This is the name that will be returned by the ThreadList function.

params.name: P1, P2, ...
params.description: Required. Are any expressions which will be supplied as parameters to the module.

params.name: Unused
params.description: Reserved. Should be set to Invalid.

params.name: ArrayToPopulate
params.description: Name of the array. See comments.

params.name: NumRecords
params.description: Defaults to 10,000 if not specified.

params.name: ObjectValue
params.description: Required. The object value of the thread to monitor.

params.name: Instance
params.description: Required. Any object value designating the thread for which the name is required.

params.name: ObjectReference
params.description: Required. Indicates the thread to be modified.

params.name: Priority
params.description: Required. A value from -3 to 3 that indicates the priority of the thread. This may be one of: Priority Description -3 THREAD_PRIORITY_IDLE -2 THREAD_PRIORITY_LOWEST -1 THREAD_PRIORITY_BELOW_NORMAL 0 THREAD_PRIORITY_NORMAL (Default) 1 THREAD_PRIORITY_ABOVE_NORMAL 2 THREAD_PRIORITY_HIGHEST 3 THREAD_PRIORITY_TIME_CRITICAL

params.name: Sec
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the number of seconds since mid night. The function, Now(1), is commonly used as it returns the current time of day, expressed in seconds.

params.name: TimeForm
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the option for the time Time Formatting Codes . Will also accept a time locale such as "us-en" matching the Windows locale. If TimeForm is numeric, the format for the time will be interpreted. If TimeForm is a text value that does not resolve to a numeric, it is interpreted as a time formatting string as follows. String Example Description h 9 Hours with no leading zero for single-digit hours. 12-hour clock. hh 09 Hours with leading zero for single-digit hours. 12-hour clock. H 21 Hours with no leading zero for single-digit hours. 24-hour clock. HH 21 Hours with leading zero for single-digit hours. 24-hour clock. m 7 Minutes with no leading zero for single-digit minutes. mm 07 Minutes with leading zero for single-digit minutes. s 12 Seconds with no leading zero for single-digit seconds. ss 12 Seconds with leading zero for single-digit seconds. f .1 Tenths of a second ff .01 Hundredths of a second fff .001 Milliseconds t P One character time-marker string, such as A or P. tt PM Multi-character time-marker string, such as AM or PM. In the event that the TimeForm parameter does not resolve to either a numeric or text value, the system-configured time format, as specified through the Windows Control Panel, is used. In this case, the Flags parameter is used to select from a number of options for the time.

params.name: TriggerTime
params.description: Required. A UTC timestamp, specifying when the TimeArrived function will become true..

params.name: Enable
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the condition that results in the timer counting. When this parameter is true (not 0), the timer is "running." When this parameter is false (0), the timer stops and the timer is reset to 0.

params.name: Time
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the time-out limit in seconds. When the cumulative time that Enable is true reaches this value, the function becomes true (1). If this value is 0 the function will trigger immediately and will continue to trigger as long as the state containing this function is active.

params.name: PeriodName
params.description: Text. May be any of the following: CurrentDay CurrentMonth CurrentQuarter CurrentWeek CurrentYear PreviousDay PreviousMonth PreviousQuarter PreviousWeek PreviousYear

params.name: BoundaryName
params.description: Text. Specifies the start or end boundary of the period, in either UTC or local time. May be any of the following: EndTimeLocal EndTimeUTC StartTimeLocal StartTimeUTC

params.name: Option
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the information to return as follows: Option Returns 0 Time displacement in seconds to UTC 1 Name of time zone (maximum of 32 characters) in "Daylight Time" or "Standard Time", which ever is applicable. The language used will match the user's locale as configured in Windows. 2 Name of time zone (maximum of 32 characters) in "Standard Time" only. The name is given in English only, making this suitable as an input to ConvertTimestamp. Commonly used for display purposes. 3 A structure of time zone information: StdTimeZone (Standard time zone) ObservesDST (Boolean indicating Daylight Savings Time usage when true) The time zone name is returned in English only, making this suitable as an input to ConvertTimestamp.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the ODBC database as returned by TODBCConnect or ODBCConnect.

params.name: SQLCommand
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the SQL command to perform on the ODBC database driver.

params.name: Attrib
params.description: Required. Any variable that will be set to an array that gives certain information regarding the table returned in the next parameter. The first dimension of the array contains the name of the column in the return table, while the second dimension contains the type - 0 for character data, 1 for numeric data.

params.name: Result
params.description: Required. Any variable that will be set to an array containing the data resulting from the SQL command. The format for the array is Result[Field][Record].

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: Required. Any variable that will contain the last error message returned by the function. If no errors occurred this parameter will be set to 0 to indicate the termination of the thread.

params.name: SQLState
params.description: Required. Any variable that will contain the SQL state that the statement was in when the last error occurred.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: Required. Any variable that will contain the native error code for the given driver and an error condition for the last error that occurred.

params.name: QueryTimeout
params.description: An optional parameter that sets the period (in seconds) which the driver will wait for a query request to complete. The default value of "0" indicates that there is no timeout. Please note that not all ODBC drivers support the optional QueryTimeout parameter. In particular, the Microsoft Access (.mdb) driver. If the driver does not support this option, then an error message will be returned by the statement. If this occurs, then the parameter should be left as Invalid to allow the statement to proceed.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. A n ODBC value for the specified ODBC database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: A parameter that will contain the last error message returned by the function.

params.name: SQLState
params.description: A parameter that will return the SQL state that the statement was in when the last error occurred.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: A variable that will contain the native error code for the given driver and an error condition for the last error that occurred.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the specified ODBC database as returned by ODBCConnect.

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: A parameter that will contain the last error message returned by the function.

params.name: SQLState

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: A parameter that is a variable that will contain the native error code for the given driver and an error condition for the last error that occurred.

params.name: DSName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the ODBC data source name, as configured in the ODBC setup menu under Microsoft Windowsâ¢.

params.name: UserName
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the ODBC login user name.

params.name: Password
params.description: Required. Any text expression for the ODBC login password.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the ODBC database after a connection has been established.

params.name: ErrorMsg
params.description: Required. Any variable that will contain the last error message returned by the function. If no errors occurred this parameter will be set to 0 to indicate the termination of the thread.

params.name: SQLState
params.description: Required. Any variable that will contain the SQL state that the statement was in when the last error occurred.

params.name: ErrorCode
params.description: Required. Any variable that will contain the native error code for the given driver and an error condition for the last error that occurred.

params.name: Disconnect
params.description: An optional parameter which is any logical expression that determines how errors are to be handled. If true (non-0), the connection to the database will be disconnected should any error (no matter how minor) occur; if false (0) an error will not cause a disconnect to occur. The default value is false.

params.name: LoginTimeout
params.description: Sets the period (in seconds) which the driver will wait for a login request to complete. The default value of "0" indicates that there is no timeout.

params.name: ConnectionTimeout
params.description: Sets the period (in seconds) which the driver will wait for any request other than a query or login on the connection to complete. The default value of "0" indicates that there is no timeout.

params.name: DB
params.description: Required. An ODBC value for the ODBC database as returned by TODBCConnect or ODBCConnect.

params.name: DB

params.name: SQLState

params.name: ErrorCode

params.name: X
params.description: Required. Any numeric expression giving the status value to use to cause the function value to change state.

params.name: Value
params.description: Specifies the length of the period for each TRUE / FALSE cycle in seconds.

params.name: String
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the string to convert to all lower case characters.

params.name: Left
params.description: Required. The coordinate of the left edge of the toolbar.

params.name: Top
params.description: Required. The coordinate of the top of the toolbar.

params.name: Right
params.description: Required. The coordinate of the right edge of the toolbar.

params.name: Data
params.description: Required. A 2-dimensional array of button information.

params.name: ParOffset
params.description: An optional parameter that is the data index at which to start. The default for ParOffset is 0.

params.name: ParHasBevel
params.description: An optional parameter that can be set to FALSE (0) to draw a bevel around the toolbar, or TRUE (1) to inhibit bevel drawing. The default for ParHasBevel is 1.

params.name: String
params.description: Required. Any text expression giving the string to convert to all upper case characters.

params.name: Normalize
params.description: Required. Any expression that returns a Normalize value. This gives the low and high scales for the animation.

params.name: Path
params.description: Required. Any expression which returns a Path value, which specifies the path along which the object moves.

params.name: TransObjPtr
params.description: Required. A Pointer to the transaction object

params.name: TReadyPtr
params.description: Required. A Pointer to a variable, used to set the ready status

params.name: TErrorPtr
params.description: Required. A Pointer to a variable, used to set the error status

params.name: CallerObj
params.description: Required. The object value of the original calling module

params.name: UseTrans
params.description: Required. Set to true (1) to use BEGIN and END of transaction

params.name: UserName

params.name: ErrorPtr

params.name: CmdStr

params.name: UserName

params.name: Password

params.name: BatchSize
params.description: Obsolete.

params.name: AlarmObject
